text: Awesome place for dinner, the steak and sides were amazing. Been to the one in Auckland and the Melbourne one definitely didn't disappoint, I'll be back again very soon üòç

Extremely disappointed. The door handles were cute and put a smile on our faces, but it all went down hill from there.  Asian lady gave us a cold reception and looked down at us when we arrived.  Waited for her to *check*  if there was a table available.  When she returned, she took us upstairs and it took a while before we got any service. The maitre d' was nervous and fumbled his words and lacked confidence. We were *entertained* by staff who would be discussing things that perhaps should not be audible to customers.  Not to mention staff who were talking across the room! Appalling! And the constant walking aimlessly of staff.  Back and forth.  What is that all about?  And they multiply!  We were served by so many different people it was a joke. Perhaps it‚Äôs no wonder staff walk around like headless chooks.  No-one knows what‚Äôs going on!  The food, not worth the hefty price tag!  Way over priced.  Would certainly have expected more for our money. Mixologist needs to learn basic bar skills. Add the ice first, not after to avoid getting a dirty glass from the splashing, especially when it‚Äôs a drink like Baileys.  Not coming back.  Better places to go to get fine dining.
I ordered the wagyu tomahawk. It was cooked to perfection. The service was also pretty good. Overall I would come back.

Dined in with my Family to celebrate our birthdays. Service was great, staff were lovely and gave honest recommendations about the menu and the specials, however ordering proved difficult. We had a new staff member who was doing her best however we all order a different 'type' of meat with different cooked preferences. (Some rare, medium-rare, well-done etc) When we recieved our meals the preference of cooked was all jumbled up, So the 300g  Sorloin that was suppose to be rare came well-done, the sauces ordered with the meat were missing or also jumbled up. I hope this was a one time mix up but for the price you're paying for a few grams of meat at a Butchery, I was hoping for the best meal possible.

Went here with high hopes, the concierge was great but after that the service was mediocre at best. Our waitress was terrible, which was highly disappointing when we we‚Äôre spending close to $500 for two people. Our entree‚Äôs were ok, and steaks weren‚Äôt cooked to perfection as expected from the price tag. We were offered dessert, but on the condition that we had it ordered and eaten in 10 minutes as they wanted they table back, which we were not told at the beginning. Every table around us who had been seated before us, were still sitting and eating there food. Then I paid the bill in cash and she had the audacity to ask me if I wanted my change.  Overall, poor service & average food for the price tag, we won‚Äôt be coming back in a hurry.

We booked for 12pm lunch, in which we arrived to be the only ones in the section of the restaurant. The music was really loud vocals, in which my friend and I had to raise voices to hear each other. We asked if the music could be turned down. They reduced is down only slightly. We asked again saying we were finding it hard to chat or consider the menu. The manager who didn‚Äôt even bother to come down from the upper floor to check, said rudely that she wouldn‚Äôt because it‚Äôs not just for us but for others too - which at that point was no one. When we got up to leave saying that obviously we were not willing to stay because of her rudeness towards the handling of the situation, she tried to back track. Other staff tried to de-escalate, while the manager tried defending herself. We then went to Cumulus Inc where the ambient music and service was excellent. The prices on the Botswana Butchery wine list were easily 3-4 times what you can buy at wine stores as well. Will definitely not be recommending.

Was excited to come here, but it was a massive let down. Food was ok, wasn't great, but it wasn't terrible. Prices didn't match. Huuuge let down with cocktails, they were mediocre and tired, and very under whelming. They also need to get some cocktail glasses, as we were served different cocktails all in wine glasses, not acceptable for a place that charges so much, only our espresso martini was in a coupe glass. Service wasn't bad, but not good either, something i expect from a Cafe not a place where I just spent $100 on steak. Finished our courses and sat there for a good 15mins before our plates were cleared. About 6 empty glasses on our table and wasn't cleared, except when a girl came over to pick up the espresso martini glass, but didn't pick up anything else Overall, very overpriced and underwhelming.

Very nice steak house and one that lives up to the hype. We came here for one thing and one thing only, and that is the steak. I found it really good to see that the selection is from all around Australia and the cuts were of a very good quality. Kudos to the chef for cooking medium rare perfectly. The service was all round very good and venue had a nice feel to it.
Great food

Everything was amazing, especially the food. Had the 1.6kgs lamb shoulder for 2. Only negative was, it took 23 mins for a waiter to come and ask us for our drink order from when we first sat down. And when we said no to the dessert, they just brought us the bill even though we were still having our drinks. Other than those 2 negatives, everything else was perfect.

We had the lobster and bottomless fries offer...only there was no bottomless fries. Don't get me wrong,  the portions were decent,  but there was no talk of more fries when the plates were clean. In fact, service was not great. We were seated immediately,  and received our drinks and food in good time, but then completely ignored. Our bottle of wine was placed on a bench opposite our table,  despite plenty of room on our table,  and yet no one returned to fill our drinks. The mark up on their wines is also triple
Excellent food and very nice atmosphere

Just a ridiculous amount of fake reviews by the owner.  Hmm..150+ 5 star reviews in the last few weeks, all of them being the first review written by the person, or the reviewer has given every restaurant in the group 5 stars.  It's so fake they even mistakenly posted a 5 star review for one of the other restaurants in the company's group (Wong Baby) on the Botswana Butchery listing. Just so lame.  BTW, I've ACTUALLY been here, and it's way over-priced and is devoid of any cool vibe or atmosphere.  Oh, and read the small print on the menu.  "Service charge of 10% on groups of 8 or more. 15% surcharge on Public Holidays. 10% surcharge on Sundays."
Brilliant waitier and bar staff, Kiah, Kai and Ellie we especially attentive and fed me cake, cannot complain really. 5star!
Deal advertised on the website was not honoured when we got there. Very disappointed and ended up paying much more for our lunch than we expected.

With so many great places to choose from in Melbourne, why come here? The service is indifferent, the food is just ok. If you‚Äôre going to spend $300+ on a meal, do yourself a favour and go to Hazel, Gimlet, Meatmaiden, Bar Margaux, Phillipe, Grill Americano, Pearl Diver, Fable‚Ä¶.

Tried their lobster and bottomless fries special and it was well-cooked and good value. 5-star for the food, but dropped 1 star because the matcha cocktail tasted like just milk and sugar‚Ä¶ missing green tea flavour and alcohol! The service was also very average. It seems like they are understaffed and because we sat out at the front instead of the main restaurant space, we were mostly forgotten.

First time at Botswana Butchery. Lovely place, although it‚Äôs interior design feels a tad dated. Good service, and lovely food. I wasn‚Äôt blown away by the steak I ordered, nonetheless it was very tasty and all the sides were excellent.
Rose chaja is surprisingly good :) My steak is on the rare side though even when I ordered medium.

We came here off the back of the half lobster and bottomless fries special as per the article on Concrete Playground. We made a lunch booking only to find out that apparently you have to request the lobster specials at the time of the booking. No where in the article or their website is this stated. I could see a few tables around us were here for the lobster too, unfortunately they looked just as disappointed as we were.  So we ordered off the √† la carte lunch menu. The food was decent but at those prices you would expect something that exceeds expectations. Unfortunately this did not. We ended up getting the burger, snapper, veal cutlet, and some sides, which were fine but nothing to expound about. The potato salad came in a tiny bowl, unmixed. So you have to mix it yourself all the while trying not to spill it. The waitress dumped the mac and cheese on the table, very close to my sister's arm whilst she was trying to cut her burger, nearly burning her arm with the hot cast iron bowl it came in. At one point the music was blasted up so loud it was all you could hear, before it was turned back down.  Furthermore, the dishes took quite some time to come out that we, and especially the kids, grew restless. Between the noisy clanging of bar staff dropping stuff and the kitchen staff dropping stuff, by the end we just wanted to leave.  At these prices, I would not recommend. The service and the food should at least be above average to warrant such prices but it was just a very average, and disappointing, experience.
Deals advertised were not honoured at the restaurant, staff were rude and inattentive.
Specials / deals on Instagram and their website are not honoured, even when you book online

I came here after hearing about it from a few of my friends.  In general, the food was great. My steak; however, was a little dry when it came out, not reflected by others at the table.  The service did feel a little rushed to me. Mains came out about 5 minutes after starters. Desert, much the same.  The food and wine selection is enormous. French onion soup was pretty good. The onion rings were average. Salad and greens were fantastic.  In all. I would recommend it.

So happy to celebrate the 2023 F1 Grand Prix here. We visited when Botswana was offering a Pit Stop Lunch with St hugo wines. Pit Stop lunch was $95pp and included choice of entr√©e and main, finished off with a petit four and  Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon pairing. We had the Kingfish and permisson for entree, salmon and steak for mains and passionfruit dessert. Was such an amazing experience.  Service was very good and staff were very friendly.

My partner and two of his coworkers got extreme food poisoning after eating lobster here. I am physically scarred from witnessing the extent of this food poisoning. STRONGLY do not recommend this place

Attended with a party of four; three of us suffered food poisoning from the Lobster.  We could see the Lobster pre-cooked and sitting under a heat lamp in the kitchen.  The service was very poor, and the follow up customer service once we reported the incident was also very poor.

2023: Very disappointed with Pope Joan recently.  So expensive, such small portion and it‚Äôs not even tasty.  I had this The Cornish: Milawa roast chicken, stuffing, mayo, jalape√±os, tarragon, lettuce and the chicken looks and tastes like some stodgey paste.  For $23 I expected so much better.  I felt so disappointed that I bought friends here, recommending them because I thought it would be nice to dine in.  I might as well go to the food court.  No matter what grade chicken they use, it was still a disappointing lunch.  2020 3.5 stars ‚≠êÔ∏è Ever since Pope Joan has closed down in Brunswick I often lament that I have never tried them.  So when they put a signage up near Sofitel I had to knock on their door and asked ‚Äú Is this THE pope Joan?!‚Äù Turns out it was!  Took my girlfriend to lunch there the other day and we had a whipped cheese w kohlrabi and a mixed platter of salad.  I was a bit unsure about the whipped cheese dish.  It had a weird taste to it which I wasn‚Äôt sure whether it‚Äôs the parsley oil with the dehydrated parsley on top, or whether there was something else which tasted a bit licorice / cuminey which I wasn‚Äôt a big fan of.  The mixed salad was fabulous.  We had a miso pumpkin w seaweed (note to self replicate that!), a cauliflower salad, a modern take to Caesar which is one large cos leaf w one fish sitting on a bed of creamed egg.  Everything tasted nice but not sure whether it‚Äôs worth $24 for this.  Maybe it‚Äôs the location, maybe it‚Äôs the name, maybe it‚Äôs both but I just found the price is a bit steep for the portion you got, but the quality is fantastic.

Great location and relaxing outdoor terrace dining at the top of Collins St. Reuben sandwich must be one of the best in Melbourne Quality ingredients and condiments which go very well with fries. Service is attentive. The breakfast menu is worth a try as well.

Went to Pope Joan for the first time living almost next door in Spring Street. What was potentially a good experience was WRECKED by their "penny-pinching" attitude! Ordered a salad that was rather wet with juices and dressing and subsequently asked for "a piece of bread" in order to soak-up the remaining liquid on my plate. Two requests and 10 minutes later 2 pieces of bland toast were supplied with a $10 charge - what a rip off and a sad and mean way to treat customers. Whatever happened to the concept of hospitality and leaving customers feeling pleased with the experience and valued as a customer? Shame on you! You deceived $10 out of me but how short-sighted of you as you won't be receiving anymore of my money NOR any of my friends.
For when you can‚Äôt get into the European for breakfast. Rice pudding is üëå ‚Ä¶
Lovely atmosphere. Coffee Lovely, just a little low tide cup fullness wise. Love m6 coffee and relish every last drop so a full cup is important to me.
Gorgeous setting, delicious food and impeccable service. The kitchen staff even cut up my dish so i could eat it with one hand due to being injured. Very sweet!
Nice vibe nice coffee
Great, would recommend the chilli scrambled eggs! Good service too.

If you like your coffee burnt with no teaspoon, no sugar & no napkin , indifferent & lazy service & soggy scrambled eggs sprayed with house cleaner then it's a right place for you. Absolutely the worst cafe in the city of Melbourne!
Great coffee. I enjoyed the comfortable outdoor table. I had the egg and bacon breakfast roll and was very satisfied with it. Could not ask for better. Good service
Coffee machine is turned off at approx 3:45 daily so if you‚Äôre looking for a coffee here don‚Äôt bother after 4pm
Sandwiches made to perfection.
The food portions for breakfast  were extremely small for the price. A spoonful of rice pudding ? #shrinkflation
Undoubtedly best long black coffee in Melbourne with service overseen by Leah. Try the Friday Champagne Gosset special  - a delightful way to end the working week.
Cute spot with lots of action and people to watch. Thought the menu was a bit limited, but that‚Äôs probably more to do with the busy lunch crowd rather than encouraging people to linger.
Nice place for a morning coffee
Pine mushroom spring roll - great. The ‚ÄúCornish‚Äù  - $24 for a mini chicken roll with rocket - uh.  Nice setting with good service does not excuse the exorbitant price!
Lovely service and delicious food

Had a delicious brekky here, very chic, great coffee. Hidden in the valet parking courtyard of The Sofitel Hotel, indoor & outdoor dining. Open lunch and dinner, not open weekends during the day, so check times.
Excellent first time experience, meal and friendly attentive staff
Waited 15 minutes for a 1/8 of a schnitzel and small chips, only customer waiting. Bloody rip off.
Wrap missing 2 out of 6 ingredients. Very small portion. Staff were unhappy.
AMAZING
Really quick.

I placed a fairly large catering order with Shnitz Collins Place and Marie went above and beyond to ensure that my corporate lunch went well. She was extremely communicative, and handled any obstacles or issues with a great attitude. Really appreciated her efforts in getting my order fulfilled. Compliments to her and the team. Would recommend for any large group orders.
25mins for a wrap‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
Service was quick, food great and price very reasonable.
Food delivery
Can never go wrong with Schnitz for a work lunch. Queues can get quite long from 12.15 onwards but they are able to cope with the volume.
Friendly staff tasty food reasonable prices.

Waited nearly 15 minutes for cold chips and a very sloppy wrap. In fairness they looked like they were training. $21 for reg cold chips and a wrap that needed a knife and fork and a solo drink is a bit rich though. Had better here in the past
Ordered the chicken parmigiana, large chips and a roll. The oil used to cook these items was rancid/very stale. It was so disgusting i had to throw away the entire meaL.

This place has such a rude staff. My partner was given wrong items in her order, something that she didn‚Äôt order and doesn‚Äôt eat as well. When she pointed out she got a wrong one, she was told if she wants it changed she has to buy it and pay for it. Staff might have not heard it properly when my partner was ordering, that can happen, acceptable. But sending her back and asking to pay for new one is not expected behaviour from Schnitz, and definitely not part of food industry culture in this country. She didn‚Äôt have her card and was carrying limited cash, so she had just throw the food and walk off.
I love that they do beef now! Beef was cooked beautifully and quickly.
After I played a show in Melbourne, me and my crew were returning back to our hotel room when we noticed that Schnitz was open. The staff were awesome and cooked up a mad feed.

I enjoy coming to this place regularly after shopping on Collins St. The chicken is golden and tasty, chips are beautiful and go well with dip. They have a really good selection of drinks available, service is fast and they have good music playing.  I love that the staff are helpful and joyful, really puts a smile on my face.
Beautiful quality of chicken, amazing staff and amazing chips. I give it two thumbs up
YUMMYYYYY
Delicious pan fried dishes - with very tasty chips.
One of the better schnitz places I've been to, great for food on the move. The staff are always eager to help and offer great service
fried chicken to goated üò§üôè‚ö†Ô∏è

When I gave the menu to a Korean woman, I threw the menu and went, but it was very unpleasant. Not only that, but I tried to order the menu step by step, but I didn't order a lot of menus. ‚ÄúDo you only order this? ‚Äù, which sounded really bad. I went for a drink in a good mood, but I was offended and left right away.  They throw there menu list on the table and they had the worst service.

I liked the atmosphere but the food was OK. I liked the spicy pork. But the rest of the food was just OK. The plain rice was a bit undercooked and didn't taste too well. Even Uncle Rogers would have cried if he saw a Korean restaurant fail in cooking simple rice.
Sorry, great service but food was a miss for me.

The most delicious kimchi fried rice I've ever had in my life. The rice was not stir-fried properly, so it clumped together, but it only tasted like butter or margarine mixed with white rice. I mixed only this kimchi, butter, and rice and added an egg. I ordered it to be unsatisfied, but some kind of roasted pig's feet came, not a dissatisfaction It's food that I'll never make again and never eat again.

How come I found Sichuan peppercorn, star anise and  Sichuan chilli bean paste in my pork leg pot? Did I have Korean food or Chinese dishes last nightü§î. By the way, they should improve their hygiene because i rushed to the toilet after having their food.
long waiting time and worse service ever„ÄÇ„ÄÇ„ÄÇ„ÄÇ
ORDER THE FRIED CHICKEN WITH BONES!!! You won‚Äôt regret!!!!
Really good Korean restaurant with extremely decent prices. Portions are huge and taste is unique.
Garlic jokbal restaurant üê∑ You must be try garlic jokbal !!

I ate half and half bossam a while ago. I was eating radish and something caught on it, so when I took it out, there was a string inside. I want to upload a picture but I don't know how to upload it ;; You need to take care of your hygiene.
The meat was pretty dried. It used to be one of my favourite place but no more.
Ordered the bossam + boneless fried chicken. You can't go wrong with bossam at Dosirock!! The food is absolutely great. I would come back again

I ordered for takeout. They took out the air rice and gave it to me.. I'm so sorry... I couldn't check it because the store tied the packaging bag. Still, I was able to fill my longing for pork feet. Makguksu also feels more abundant than in Korea. I'm complaining because it's broken. I wish it was more spicy. The side dishes were all fresh and delicious.

I ordered cold vegetable pig's trotters and soft tofu with Uber Eat, but cold vegetable pig's feet are not the cold vegetable pig's feet you know, but a mix leaf, a few pieces of pig's feet, buckwheat noodles, and the sauce is not that spicy of mustard sauce, it's not spicy, it's just sweet.. $46.20 The moment I was disappointed because it wasn't worth it at all, the moment I saw the soft tofu stew, I was again disappointed that the soft tofu was really a soup like the name on the menu. Just frozen seafood cocktail shrimp frozen clams in plain water The total payment of 69$, which was not well-resolved, was so disappointing that I was put on the list of things I would not order.
I usually order fried chicken and Kimji soup. They are very tasty. I also tried the fish roe soup , the best I can find in Melbourne.  Recommended !!!
Good food Unique menu - pork hock than elsewhere don‚Äôt have Their cold noodle also exceptionally good Reasonable price
ÏïåÌÉï was very good, but the Ï°±Î∞ú (pork hoc) we ordered was served cold. We never experienced a pork hoc served cold, as it is supposed to be served hot. Atmosphere was nice and good staff :)
Was recommended to try the pork hock, and it was delish! We had a serve of pork hock, soba salad, and a large soup, and it was definitely more than enough for 3 of us.
Moderately priced  authentic Korean. The nengmyon is fantastic. I'm gonna bring my friends here to try more dishes.
The pork belly and hock is one of their most well known dishes and it‚Äôs reputation is definitely well deserved. One of the great Korean food places that opens late as a bonus!
As a tourist who has been to Seoul before, I think this place is really amazing. The Pork tastes amazing and I love the vibe here
The hotpot price nowadays is just too expensive with the serving size however the taste was great without a doubt

We randomly picked Dosirock after getting slightly overwhelmed by the Korean food options in the neighborhood. Their specialties, jokbal (pig's trotters) and bossam (pork belly), did not disappoint as they were perfectly cooked and generously portioned! As four people, we could barely finish a medium-sized half and half. There are other non-pork options available. Kudos to their prompt service and friendly staff too

The food is deliscious, we try the chicken corndue or forndue ( not sure the exact name) it was awesome! And the hotteok was so gummy and yummy!üòã worth the money. It will just take time for your order to come as only few staff i guess is cooking.  Will definitely come back again.
Great Experience ‚ù§Ô∏è
Definitely try the soy garlic chicken, so yum!!! But the waiting line is quite troublesome
Good chicken and love the spicy sauce, beer was not as good though
Tasty vegetarian fried dumplings
Unusual time restrictions on eating.
Customer service very nice. The food at gami is very good too
Very delicious food. You should try it tooüòçüòç
very delicious food
Great service and food.
The fried chicken was not good. The chicken had no flavour except for old oil. It was also extremely oily. The sweet mustard sauce was good, as was the corn cheese. Very disappointing.

Finally made it to the restaurant as we have only ordered fried chicken in the past which was always spot on. üí•üí•üí•üí•üí• I was a bit surprised how long it took for our food to arrive, especially the place wasn‚Äôt full (a lot of delivery orders tho) We ordered:  Chicken Corndue üí•üí• arrived after 37min Cheese tasted a little flat and the fact that the cheese arrived 5min later than the chicken, didn‚Äôt make it better as the chicken wings were cold then. Also, I wish they would serve a couple of chicken tenders instead of a few chicken wings.  Japchae mandu üí•üí•üí•üí• very crispy and nicely flavoured outside but the filling tasted blunt. Arrived after 45 min.  Crispy chicken burger üí•üí•üí•üí•üí• my personal highlight but took almost an hour to get served. Loved the fact that the chicken was super hot and crispy and the coleslaw came fresh out of the fridge.  Service could have been a little more attentive but was for kind and helpful. Four stars only because I know their boneless chicken is one the best‚Ä¶
The best chickeeeen!!!
Good food, service and atmosphere!
Delicous korean chicken place

We had a party of 5 on a Saturday night and staff were able to provide us with a small table without a prior booking.  Food was well made and arrived at the table in good intervals.  Staff were friendly and accommodating.  Please excuse the half eaten dinner üòÖ forgot to take a before photo.

This place used to be very good but it has clearly gone down the hill and today‚Äôs meal was a complete disappointment! The potato haven was undercooked, tasted terrible and had some tomato sauce all over it! The chicken was also very average so we won‚Äôt be returning‚Ä¶
Best for dine in and take always. So good chickenü•∞ü•∞ ‚Ä¶
Great burger!
Staff were lovely. The soy/garlic chicken was top of our list after trying it last time in Melbourne and mozzarella sticks topped it off nicely.
Great food
Good service and fantastic food hidden in the alleyway Strongly recommend the steaks and ribs on the menu.
You need to try the deep fried onions
Excellent Ribeye.
Great food and awesome staff
Nobody picking up the phone for a booking. Is this place still open? Will book elsewhere. Sorry.
Good steak, wine is too expensive
Good service, ribs and sauces. Very simple menu but no much can go wrong. Beef ribs are a must.

The cuts of steak are nice and tasty. But you can't say when a clearly very rare steak (that is meant to be medium rare) is requested to be cooked as you asked 'our medium rare is a little under what others are'. That's just not how steak is done. Steak should be cooked the way steak is cooked. There is a standard
Perfect day, great company,  amazing food, brilliant service Jenny Lauren

Worth dining in this restaurant. Totally satisfying peaceful environment. We had made prior bookings for a table as essondon was full at the time we wanted. Staff was very friendly & attentive. We had ordered salmon which was very soft and juicy, porterhouse, beef burger. All tasted amazing and delicious.
Live coming here for steak n chips with there mushroom sauce. Been back many times since
Staff friendly, food and price are all good!!!

I used to work here as a Head Chef around 2006 to 2007, man they have the best a graded mouth watering cut of meat  and slow poached cooked for a day pork ribs with their special  Lino's ( first owner of the first shop at south yarra) secret baste marinade for two weeks, oh the eye fillet melts in my mouth, i still remember the taste of it. After working there i couldn't just eat any stake bought from supermarket for few years after i worked there. My review is based on how it was ten years ago though.
Was amazing best choice to go to for a tender juicy steak with good service and friendly staff food time was exceptional and flavour was awesome will be my new favourite in melbourne CBD

Tired looking restaurant. Rude staff member who actually argued with my wife while trying to order her meal. How difficult is it to remove chips and salad and replace with broccoli? We were just about to get up and leave and another staff member came over as he saw there was a problem. The food was amazing. Shame it was spoiled by poor waitress service. The gents urinals were both blocked and rest room quite grubby. Will not return to this particular branch as our experience in South Yarra Squires Loft was so much better.
Steak was well cooked and delicious.
Love my soy mocha and Shashuka. Very tasty and reasonable price. Shop was so busy but the service was quick.
This place is very warm and welcoming. The owner really cares about his customers. Their sandwiches and coffee are among the best I have tried.
Delicious, best sandwich in Melbourne (and it was GF!). Highly recommend.
Grabbed a tall latte with a few pumps of vanilla. Great taste, and nice and hot. üëå
Delicious and reasonably priced!
Great coffee. Great eggs. Great service. Great vibe. I really am happy I found you guys.

Came to Workers Food Room today for group dine in. Grabbed a chai latte and a Cauliflower and Halloumi wrap toasted. The wrap was divine! Great flavours, fresh, and well toasted. Chai was great. The rest of the table was happy with their fried chicken flatbreads. Prices were pretty reasonable at $12.90 for a dine in wrap.  Only notes: - Sandwiches and salads all appeared to be pre made and catered more toward take away patrons - I don't doubt they are made same day as this cafe is very popular - Table service is available however this is difficult without a menu - you're advised to choose your wrap or salad from the front counter - Menu selections rotate so don't rely on what is on the website  Overall a nice place for grab and go pre made salads and wraps. Be mindful that dine in is very casual and there is no menu with access to freshly made dishes.
Great place, has a fire place and the staff and coffee are fantastic üëèüëèüëè ‚Ä¶
Lovely lamb flatbread. Great price too.
All round favourite. Coffee and food are consistently great!

Been a couple of times now. The salads are food for people who want to say they ate salad but just wanted a pile of greesy, salty, goopy food which was more like a cold home cooked weeknight meal and not something fresh. I also got a wrap a few weeks ago..This was meh and lacked flavour. I gave two stars because it's convenient if you work near by.

This is a wonderful place. Food, Fireplace, coffee, staff and even the music are all above par. They open 5:30 am every morning and you can get one of the best coffees in Melbourne served to you in the morning.  This is truly a place to be for an early morning coffee by the fire, or an afternoon lunch with all the positive vibes.
Friendly service and good food.  The house pickled carrot served as a garnish today was a taste sensation.
Great find on a cold morning. Eggs perfect.
A buzzy lunch venue. Great food. Staff coped well with the lunchtime rush. Good coffee. Amazing pumpkin bread.

Great coffee and quick service if you want a to go coffee. Depends who does the ordering for you. Most of them are very nice with their customers, but sometimes the casual staff can be snippy and impatient. Only rated 3/5 because of the one particular staff that was obviously not in the mood to do the job he signed up, but the other staffs are a 10/10.
Good.
Welcoming service with delicious coffee
Good food I still love the lane way seating
Nice coffee & delicious breakfast, super fresh. Everything was perfectly cooked. The service was nice. This cosy cafe has a warm ambience.

The Workers Cafe serving locally sourced breakfast and lunch fare, with a rotating menu of Middle Eastern inspired dishes of salads, Turkish flatbreads and artisan sandwiches. ‚Äú Working Hard or Hardly Working? ‚Äú The workers wood oven will have something that works for you. We had been to the Russell St shop previously and it was good. This time we came to the Lonsdale one and we were served Samgyaetang (ginseng chicken soup) with FROZEN rice stuffing - using precooked frozen chicken is fine but really need to do a proper defrost before you put it into a soup.  We returned the chicken that was cut open to the kitchen and 10 minutes later the same pot came back... the chicken soup was just boiled on the stove again. But the rice had now spilled out of the chicken, the rice noodle and rice cake started to disintegrate, and the whole soup turned into a mess.  Got a refund for the soup and left. Really need to look at how the food is handled here because it's also a potential hygiene risk serving unthawed food...!

1)Without a doubt the best HSP in the city. Ended up going two nights in a row. Serving sizes are reasonable and generous. The large is a large (2x burger box), none of this round container of sadness BS, they‚Äôll even wrap it in foil for you, a surprising benefit as the cheese properly melts by the time you get it home. Meat to chips ratio is exactly what you want. The chips are correctly salted and crispy and the meat is similar to what you get at other places but they actually cook it properly and it comes out juicy and tender. Oh, and they don‚Äôt charge extra for cheese, because that would be sociopathic. The star is absolutely the garlic sauce though. It‚Äôs obvious they make it themselves and it‚Äôs a damn good recipe, light, refreshing and tangy, cuts through the heft perfectly. If I were to sum it up, it‚Äôs all the ingredients you know and love, but it‚Äôs prepared and arranged perfectly which makes it the best. If it were up to me, his would be the HSP specimen I would choose to put in the royal archives

Taketori has been around for quite a while I reckon, I came across this place multiple times on social media and finally decided to try it yesterday night.  First of all, booking system is very weird. There is a Quandoo built in on their website, only which doesn‚Äôt seem to work at all. So I rang the restaurant multiple times and nobody answered the phone. Then moments later, a random phone number called back, with no introduction at all, the lady on the phone asked me in Chinese whether I‚Äôm trying to make a reservation. Confused with how they figured out that I am indeed a chinese speaking person and confirming whether she is calling from Taketori, I successfully secured myself a table.  Now I will focus on my experience at Taketori. Unagi three ways is highly recommended. The unagi was so soft and goes extremely well with the tea broth (chazuke). The sukiyaki was pretty solid, a lot of ingredients and some decent quality beef slices for only $60.  The lobster maki took almost forever to come out, it was served by the end of our meal. Which I was quite surprised as maki roll is something quite quick and easy to make. The lobster maki did not tasted good and is definitely not worth $30. There was a generous chunk of lobster within the roll indeed, however, it tasted very salty, I assume that it has been bathed in salt water earlier to preserve it‚Äôs freshness. Otherwise, they are using some sort of canned/prepackaged lobster meat. Not to mention that it had a tough and old texture.  For desserts, we ordered a matcha crepe cake but was served a yuzu crepe cake + a scoop of matcha icecream instead. We were only looking at the photos on the menu when ordering the cake, and an image of a matcha crepe cake was clearly printed on the menu. So we thought that‚Äôs what we would get. We double checked with the waitress and she first answered that they sold out on matcha crepe cake today. Given the circumstances, we tried the eat the yuzu crepe cake, and it was not nice at all. The yuzu cream was quite sour, which I think the sourness dominated the yuzu aroma completely. Tasted a bit like cream that have turned bad if you ask me. We approached the waitress again to see whether if we can get something else instead (at this point we still thought it was their mistake for not telling us matcha crepe cake is not available today). Then the waitress started telling us that the menu did say yuzu cake with matcha icecream, and showed us the menu to proof it. She was right, it‚Äôs just that the image and text on the menu didn‚Äôt match up. We took it as our mistake for not reading the menu details carefully though. But when we got our bill, it prints matcha crepe cake, so this leaves me with many questions in my head.  Service was attentive, but the waitress who served us looked angry the entire night. I just read another review posted a month ago mentioning the same issue. Not sure what makes her so angry.

My friend and I had just arrived in Melbourne CBD in the late evening and we were looking for a place to eat at 11pm. We saw that Sool Tong closes at 3am, so we decided to give it a try. And we are so glad that we did!  We ordered the spicy chicken feet and the Korean-style beef short ribs.  The spicy chicken feet was cooked perfectly so the meat fell off the bones with ease, and the spicy flavor was really addicting.  The Korean-style beef short ribs were definitely one of the best I've ever had. Again, it was cooked perfectly. Enough to be tender, but not so much that it was tough. On top of that, the flavor was also amazing.  tl;dr: Really authentic hole-in-the-wall Korean restaurant. The food was really fantastic. You gotta come try it at night!

If you're looking for a unique dining experience in Melbourne, look no further than 215 Queen's Restaurant and Bar. This hidden gem offers a fusion of Italian and Australian cuisine, with a focus on fresh, seasonal ingredients.  The menu is constantly changing, but you can always expect to find creative dishes that are both delicious and visually stunning. The pizzas are particularly good, and the pasta dishes are made with house-made pasta.  The service at 215 Queen's is also top-notch. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, and they're always happy to make recommendations.  The atmosphere at 215 Queen's is warm and inviting. The dining room is spacious and well-lit, and the bar area is a great place to relax and have a drink.  If you're looking for a special place to celebrate a special occasion, or simply want to enjoy a delicious meal with friends or family, 215 Queen's Restaurant and Bar is the perfect choice. You won't be disappointed.

We had a wonderful dining experience at 215 Queen's Restaurant and Bar Melbourne. The food was delicious, the service was excellent, and the atmosphere was perfect.  We started with the antipasto platter, which was a great way to share a variety of flavors. The pizzas were cooked to perfection, and the pasta dishes were packed with flavor. We also had the tiramisu for dessert, which was the perfect way to end our meal.  Our server was attentive and knowledgeable, and he made sure that we had everything we needed. He also gave us great recommendations for dishes to try.  The atmosphere at 215 Queen's is warm and inviting. The dining room is spacious and well-lit, and the bar area is a great place to relax and have a drink.  We would highly recommend 215 Queen's Restaurant and Bar Melbourne to anyone looking for a delicious meal and a great dining experience.

I had to pay an extra $2 to have the Schnitzel pan-fried in butter - but the result tasted more as having been deep-fried. The Potato Salad looked brownish and did not resemble anything I had eaten in Austria as Potato Salad (Erdapfelsalat). I also ordered the Beansalad for $20 as it stated it was prepared with Pumpkin Seed Oil which I love - but I could not taste the oil at all. I tasted the Sauerkraut from my companions plate and it was far too salty and her Schweinsbraten was far too fatty (as they use Porkbelly instead of Neck or Shoulder). So she had hardly any meat on her piece....expensive for $38. Only two Austrian white wines to choose from and the Veltliner was out of stock?! The staff were stressed; and did not really understand the dishes. Real pity - the Austrian cuisine is so famous; but not really demonstrated at the Gasthaus.

Ordered a meatlover pizza which took 45 mins and the base was burnt and even though the menu show the price as $18 the actual charge was $22. Everyone in the group was overcharged. Totally understand why the place was quiet during the lunch rush.
Enjoyed drinks and lunch. Excellent service.
Good music plenty of banter from the waiter
Food was good. Waiter entertaining. Unfortunately we were pushed for time. Next time hopefully a bit more time spent enjoying it all.
Really good food, like it

Before booking we read the reviews and quite honestly the owner and his staff must write them themselves! The place was cruby, the toilets atrocious. The toilet looked that they had not been cleaned pre covid! I'm not kidding. A real indication that the health department is completely non exsiatant!! I ordered a simple dish grilled samon with chips. My samon was raw and the chips hard and oily! I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. I'm surprised that we didn't get food poisoning. I am giving it a well deserved 2 out of 5 because the man who served us was very accomodating in contrast to the lady waitress who was pretty in different and almost dismissive! Please guys give the venue a good clean especially your toilets!!!!! I'm still trumatised!

David provided some of the best service I've ever had at a restaurant. He's quite humorous, knowledgeable, and extremely good at what he loves. The meal was awesome the vibe was immaculate and I will be back again!
The location and service was the best part of the night Food definitely not worth eating
the mill burger gave me food poisoning. also, the cutlery i was given was still dirty :(

If we could give The Mill and Charlie‚Äôs Bar a 20000 stars we would as they made our night out fantastic. The laneway was pumping with people eating outside and in at the many restaurants. I had chosen The Mill to celebrate my partners 50th and the staff made all attempts to make it special. Lovely staff, balcony table for two to take in the laneway environment. The menu was packed with so many choices, we had bruschetta to share, seafood linguine and a gorgeous mustard chicken breast with mash and veggies which was to die for. On my asking they brought out their brownie with a candle. The staff constantly checked on us and the lovely manager offered my partner a shot on the house for his birthday and when we went downstairs to the bar he made us both a gorgeous unique cocktail which was delicious. We will definitely be back and encourage others to do the same . Katherine and Chris

I stopped into The Mill Restaurant to grab some lunch and a drink, I was met by a lovely and welcoming man named David behind the bar in which I believe is the manager. I had an eye fillet cooked to perfection and walked out of there very satisfied. The restaurant itself plus Charlie's bar was an amazing warm atmosphere that made me feel as though I was elsewhere in the world. Between David, the food and the restaurant/ bar they deserve every single star that I have given them and i will certainly be returning

Went there on the 25/03, we came early to a booking just happy to have a few drinks while we waited for our booking. We were welcomed with with 110% service. We got a beautiful seat next to the window over looking the laneway. The owner/manager was cracking great jokes and just made us feel welcome. The food was delicious and the drinks went down nicely! Highly recommend and will go back again when we visit the city.
Close at 11pm, called 9:38pm fot take-away, hear the kitchen is closed
One of the best meals I have ever eaten! Amazing flavour and my chicken was cooked to perfection! Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. Just the absolute best in a cosy romantic setting ‚ù§
Great cocktails

Staff were friendly, service and food was very quick and nice. The spot was quite nice, we went on a Saturday so it was busy everywhere, this restaurant wasn't as busy though. When we went to pay the owner fixed us up and suggested a shot, he let us try some and then we bought another. Owner and staff were great. Would recommend:)

Wonderful location - bustling, interesting and ever so metropolitan.  Wait staff were excellent - so attentive, friendly, professional and knowledgeable about the menu.  Meals were substantive, presented beautifully and extremely tasty.  Will definitely be returning here, and recommending it to friends.

The best local cuisine I've ever had. A variety of dishes that feel contemporary and fresh and have the restaurant's unique spin on them, not to mention that they are cooked to perfection. Although the menu is fairly small, it is well-formed. This restaurant exuded the friendliest, most welcome vibe. The service provided was excellent. Highly recommend!
Had the Bruschetta and the pizza Margherita and it tasted delicious...  Friendly staff members!  Thank you...

An amazing place hidden in Hardware Lane. The atmosphere was fantastic with excellent table service and even better food. We had Eye Fillets with Pear and Rocket salad, we could not fault what was served. This place is highly recommended üôèüèº

Wow just wow we ate here today for my hubby‚Äôs birthday and the food was amazing Hubby had the steak and I had the prawns the prawns were full of beautiful flavour succulent prawns creamy soft mash wow highly recommend the prawns here.
Great food! Sam was really accomodating and helped make it such a great experience.
Great food and Sam is the best
The service was great and the food was awesome, everything was cooked to perfection. The steaks and the chocolate mousse were especially good
Got to taste kangaroo meat here! Good ambience and good food. A bit pricey but the quality of food do not disappoint.

Food ‚≠êÔ∏è 1/5 The quality of the food at the restaurant was below average. The chips were both dry and in meager quantity. The steak was difficult to chew, cold, and tough. While the pasta was acceptable, it had an excessive amount of ham and was overcooked.  Service ‚≠êÔ∏è 1/5 Regrettably, the restaurant appears to be biased towards certain groups of customers. For instance, if you are dining alone or happen to be Asian, you will be directed to the outdoor seating area immediately. This was evident when two Caucasian gentlemen in front of us arrived without a reservation and were promptly seated inside. However, when it was our turn, the host did not greet us, check for empty tables inside, or make small talk. Instead, she simply told us to find someone outside to assist us with seating, despite there being available tables inside at the time. It was not until later, when I went to pay at the cashier, that I noticed that most of the customers seated inside were Caucasian or part of their group, and only Asians and solo diners are seated outside.  Moreover, our elderly waiter made us feel uncomfortable by constantly hovering near our table and watching us. As soon as we were seated and began to look at the menu, he returned to inform us that the kitchen would close in just four minutes, and we needed to order now. It was perplexing why no one had informed us about the kitchen's closing time beforehand. Additionally, no one explained the menu or the day's specials, making us feel unwelcome.  I like Hardware Ln and it‚Äôs lively vibe, but I‚Äôm very sure that I won‚Äôt come back to this place‚Ä¶

If I could give this zero star I cloud. Steak taste really bad, I‚Äôm not even finish my ice chocolate yet they don‚Äôt even ask me anything some white girl just took it away. don‚Äôt waste your time and money from here. Waitress are so rude. U should hire some more friendly people that really want to work this job.
The staff were absolutely lovely and the kangaroo was soooooooo good!  Top notch service and fantastic food for a good price. Will be back again and again!

Beautiful place with a delicious food, friendly staff and excellent service. As the group of 8 we enjoyed every meal we ordered, starting from lovely fresh oysters, moving to perfectly done steaks and seafood pastas, then finishing with a delicious dessert, definitely will be back ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Had a lovely meal here. Food was satisfying and the service was excellent, especially Sam! Thank you.
Friendly welcome, we had the kangaroo, excellent, with finally some vegetables, would have deserved to be a little warmer.
Cosy place with great food. The steak with blue cheese butter is perfectly done!
There are better places

Here is the hot tip friends. Whatever Sam - our concierge at this beautiful restaurant - reccomends - TRUST!  His reccomendation of the passionfruit sorbet and the panacotta - might be the very best I've ever had.  The rest of the menu and the dishes we watched pass us - had our mouths totally watering. We are already booking in our next visit and may not eat all day so we can eat several different things here. YUMMM

Not overly impressed. Both of our coffees came out at 50¬∞. Even when one was supposed to be 100¬∞. The barista remade one coffee and when it came back to us it still wasn't over 80¬∞, it also wasn't strong like we had asked. Couldn't be bothered sending it back a second time. The Parma was ok. It really could have benefited from some ham. The sauce was a bit lack luster. Nothing very flavoursome. The service was great though. Both servers were very attentive and had professional mannerisms.

All the staff members provided good service. Among them, I became a fan of the old waiter. It's a pity that it was forgotten because they were busy ordering drinks, but they quickly recovered. Came here to try the kangaroo steak. It was well cooked and delicious. The table was also properly disinfected.

Pork Belly was soft with no crispyness... this may be the way the dish is but it wasn't described that way. Also.... Thought our options on a public holiday were limited. How wrong we were. The food was delicious, wine smooth and delightful. Friendly staff were the veritable icing on the cake. Would love to visit again üòã
Excellent service, food was that of italian quality (perfection)  In my opinion, best breakfast - lunch cafe in Melbourne for young people.

We were looking for a good steakhouse to have dinner at and checked Rare Steakhouse based on the reviews. It certainly did not disappoint! The tomahawk was delicious, as was the fillet and kangaroo skewers. Thoroughly enjoyed the oyster shooters and fresh oysters too. Definitely worth checking out.

Our dinner was delicious and given the quality of ingredients, it was reasonably priced too. I now find a decent steak restaurant in the CBD that has allowed me to have a great meal without taking up another mortgage. We‚Äôll be back!

Warm rustic inviting venue whilst still retaining sofistication, customer service is second to none and of course the food more so was the best I've had from a venue of this size anywhere in the area. Amazing atmosphere staff were so wonderful and attentive, meals were incredible and came out pretty quickly even though they were so busy. Definitely will be back.
Food was amazingingly good service staff were friendly and professional.
Great food & Great Service! Will definitely be back.

Had a fantastic dinner over here with a colleague. The food was delicious, they had great wine selection, and most importantly the staff were friendly and courteous. It‚Äôs is my second time here and I‚Äôm glad to be back after the covid mayhem. Cheers!
First time coming. Nice staff Warm welcome, a very good steak, and reasonable price.

The food is delicious! The spicy seafood soup is amazing! The cartilage rice balls and fried chicken are also delicious üëçThe disadvantage is that the alcohol is expensive It‚Äôs good to just eat. If you want to drink with friends, you can go to other cheap places.

Yes, you heard me, there‚Äôs no restrooms inside the restaurant. They would give you a key tag to go to another building with a hidden restroom behind a big screen. You have to tap the key tag SO MANY times. It was like an endless maze. For the males‚Äô toilets, it was only one tap to get in. For the females‚Äô toilets, it was two taps to get in.
