Service is ever so friendly and efficient, just remember to ask for cutlery should you need a spoon for the rice.

Unfortunately I did not have a good experience at Grab a yabby,my wife ordered a crab,when it was brought to the table my wife found a long hair embedded in the crab. We informed the waitress of this,instead of resolving the issue right on the spot she informed us that she had to contact her boss to get a result,after waiting for 15 minutes she came back and said that it wasn't any of the chefs,s the waitress insinuated that the hair must've come from my wife. I found that very insulting towards my wife,the owner of the restaurant should have a good hard look at his/her staff.

terrible service ! my friend pulled out a long hair from the alaska crab legs. she showed that to waitress. then waitress returned and told her all the waitresses serve outside not nearby kitchen, and their chef has short hair :) well, my friend has long hair but tied up, feel like they consult that hair belongs to my friend. very irresponsible. check the cctv then you will see where the hair comes from! wont ever come back there again

Bad service with food was not delicious and a bit pricing. We found a long hair stick around crab foot. We told them about the hair. 20 mins later, they told us :" all the chef had short hair and they wear hair net. You was nearly finished the dishes so we will give you 15% discount of that dish, the one with hair inside." ... they mean the hair belong to us. It s our fault !!! It s such a very very bad services !!!!
All day breakfast was ok but little bit pricy. The service was good.

This place was a hidden gem when I stumbled upon this place. Coming in late, they told me when the kitchen closed and when I asked if ordering the rib was reasonable. They said it was no problem and told me to come in. It was a small restaurant no more than 50 seats capacity inside. I ordered the rib and was told I had to wait 20 mins. Ordering the rib 20 min wait time was very reasonable so I patiently waited and it was very worth the wait. Rib‚Äôs sauce was perfect as well as the amount of meat on the rib was good. Service was very excellent and very attentive. Came back 2 days later with my friend and ordered a yabby and a lobster linguini and it was so good. The sauce with the yabby was very tasty and it went very well with the rice it came along with it. Once I come back to Melbourne. Im sure this is one of the place I will be looking forward to come back to

Meat is dry and bland, most likely due to being cooked twice. Mild is Spicy, obviously they need a mild option that is actually mild. Everything is overpriced for what it is. A VB is $9 and a Peroni/asahi is the same price. Wouldn‚Äôt visit twice

King Crab, mussels and lobster tail were delicious- the singaporian sauce (which is not on the menu) is to die for! We ordered it in mild and it was perfectly spiced and we dipped up every little bit of it! Don't be fooled by the red plastic table cloth when walking in. Staff were super friendly and informative, looked after us with exceptional service!

*No Yabbies for the 2nd time. *No Oysters: Oysters are to be ordered (over the phone with your booking) a few days in advanced so they can run down to Safeway and get them for you. *Premium price for frozen Bay Bugs - sigh *No Crabs in stock, but they have chicken!  Don't waste your time!

Totally unexpected down to earth great seafood dining experience. It is back to basics approach: 1 - Fresh and good seafood, 2 - Totally tasty sauces and 3 - Turn up the spice heat. We had Prawns in XO, Marrons in Singapore Chilli and Clams Sphaghetti. There were delicious.  The only reason for not giving five star is the excessive use of plastics - plastic table cloth, plastic bibs and plastic gloves. Surely we can clean our hands under a tap.

We had 1 crab leg, 1 tiny yabby and 5 pippies each with a soft drink...$50 pp..I‚Äôm all about spending money on food, but seafood wasn‚Äôt fresh, they tried to cover up how low quality the seafood is with sauce (no option to have it plain as seafood ISNT FRESH). Garlic sauce is terrible and taste like old oil. Don‚Äôt want to sound mean, but one of the worst restaurants that I‚Äôve eaten at. Not to mention the amount of money you pay and get charged for a lemon wedge to eat with your seafood. Definitely do not recommend unless you‚Äôre happy to throw your money away
Once fresh food and good service

What an atrocious dining experience. I ordered the lobster pasta and it was clearly unfresh. Both lobster and pasta was overcooked and had no flavour. Lobster texture was rubbery and I still have a sickly aftertaste from it an hour later.
Pretty good food
The waiters were nice, i tried the Australian shrimp, it was good, the amount was not to much compared with the price
Great food and service .Thanks you so much

Food was good.. Not amazing but good. First time i have had yabby. I give it a 3 because it was ridiculously over priced!! I could of bought 10 times the amount of seafood from springvale and cooked it myself for what we paid. Service was friendly :)

Best food, Best experience! Staff are all super friendly and the food is just amazing! Have visited once and will definitely be back. Don‚Äôt be scared to get messy, make sure to dip the crab meat in whatever sauce you got - it is like seafood heaven in your mouth!

Fun and new experience.  Eat and play coming together. Don't be afraid to get messy.  My honest review is everything that we order was extremely delicious. Customer service is exceptional, informative and consistence.  Obviously with all seafood unless frozen are expensive (to each their own). As someone who eats regularly at home and dines here and there, this is definitely a higher end for the average Joe. But then again, it depends on how big of an appetite you have. I will say a dinner for two here including two wines cost me roughly $120. You can see from my previous reviews that we spend roughly $30-$60 for a dinner for two. This is 2-4 times more than the usual. But it was a celebration dinner nonetheless.  The seafood you can definitely tell is fresh.  They even provide wet wipes after you're finished !!  I would definitely recommend this to someone with a desire for fresh seafood.  I am definitely coming here again !
Food quality is amazing and super fun design when served. Cocktails are delicious as well. The overall atmosphere is such a cute vibe. Perfect location for a girls day night and brunch.
Food and service was just ok PINK restaurant is really very pink. üôÇüôÇüôÇ ‚Ä¶

This is the worst restaurant I‚Äôve ever eaten in. I wish I could give it zero stars. We went for a friends birthday on the weekend and had to choose from a set menu which has 3 entree options and 2 main options. The entrees all arrived cold and staggered, the calamari was just two frozen calamari rings cut into small pieces. The mains were a vegetable tempeh curry or ribs and Asian green vegetables. The curry had what looked like roast vegetables in there and didn‚Äôt have the tempeh, nor did it come served with rice. The ribs were just over cooked hunks of fatty meat that couldn‚Äôt be cut, smelled awful kind of like liquorice, and the meal was served without and vegetables. They also missed an order in our group so we were short an entree and a main. While we were there someone was renting the space upstairs for an event and had come down 4 times to complain about the service and food. No one could eat the mains, they were inedible and we sent them back. When it came to paying the guy serving us wouldn‚Äôt have a bar and we all had to argue about the service and the quality of the food to even get a lousy discount, he wouldn‚Äôt let us just pay for drinks only, which was all any of us had. Despite only having one cocktail and not eating any food I was still charged $40. Don‚Äôt ever go here, it‚Äôs horrific. Nothing came at the same time and the food was such low quality, matches the decor of the interior.
Terrible and rude customer service. Outdated website. Waste of time.
1 bartender serving 30+ people cocktails then disappearing, food taking forever to come out & not enough for everyone, too slow clearing plates very disappointing for the money spent.

Our visit at this restaurant to say the least is very underwhelming. Yes the decor is fun and cute but apart from that, everything else did not hit the mark. We were greeted by I‚Äôm assuming the manager with the least accommodating vibe and when it was time to order, we were asking the staff member for some recommendations on the menu since you would assume they‚Äôd know what is good. It‚Äôs quite a surprise to me when the staff member herself said ‚Äúumm‚Ä¶ I really don‚Äôt know cause I don‚Äôt like the food here.‚Äù Although that was already a bit disappointing we still gave the restaurant a chance. The cocktails tasted nice but the food was definitely not worth the price. The tacos were smaller than the size of my hand and the beans were really tough so I‚Äôm assuming it wasn‚Äôt even cooked and there was very minimal meat in the dish. This place could use some improvement.
Cute pink place. Staff attentive and friendly.
Pretty setting, very small servings.

don‚Äôt bother. The aesthetics of this place are nice, but you can get better pics in a random ally way tbh.  The food : we got a bowl of chips and calamari. The chips were COLD and soggy after waiting 40 min for it. The calamari wasn‚Äôt even cooked and Fridge cold (it‚Äôs still swimming as we speak).  Also I forgot that I wasn‚Äôt at Karen‚Äôs diner :)

Great pink aesthetic but shocking service and food. Proportions were small for price, cold and stale. Even drinks weren‚Äôt made properly whether they‚Äôre were cocktails or coffee. The coffees had white particles in them.
The place it‚Äôs nice, different from other place‚Ä¶ the cocktail are very cool but the menu it‚Äôs really poor‚Ä¶

The first time I came here it was nice, but the last time I visited it was not a good experience. The staff are nice and the decorations are cute, however, the food, although pretty, is very average and overpriced for what it is. There were only two tables eating in, and the staff just stood around talking; it took an incredibly long time to be served and then for our food to actually be made. There was no communication from the staff about when the kitchen closes, meaning my younger sister missed out on dessert, which she was most excited for. I don‚Äôt normally like to leave negative reviews, however my mum and sister were very excited to visit here, but ended up having a disappointing night.
Nope.

I visited this restaurant excited about the pink decor and a delicious menu. My excitement soon disappeared as I was greeted by a surly waitress who I distracted from folding napkins. The place was fairly quiet, yet I waited over 10 minutes to have my order taken. The food was average and took far too long to be served. Unfortunately for the whole girl power theme, the female staff are unfriendly at best (and completely unattentive). A shame, as the novel restaurant concept could have been a lovely experience.
Service and food delivery was very slow, made up by the atmosphere, decor and company. Fast alcohol delivery

This place is absolutely abysmal as a restaurant. We had an awful experience here a few weeks ago. We book a table for 12 for a friends birthday and it took 2 hours for us to receive our meals. Despite us flagging down the waitress several times and asking we were unable to get a second round of drinks. The meals were sub par at best, as we were a large group we had to order of a specific menu. The tofu started was dry and tasteless with no greens at all. The beef main was mostly fat and had no rice or greens, just the meat. There were not dessert options at all. When we left they would not offer us a discount at all dispute the terrible service, terrible food and the time it took. In fact they ended up double charging me and after I call they and the manager said they would refund me, they have not. The venue was much older and dirtier than we expected, the foam mirrors in the bathroom were broken, flowers were missing from the flower wall, pictures on the pictures on the walls were ripped.

HOW HAS THIS PLACE NOT BEEN SHUT DOWN? This is the worst restaurant I have ever been to. I was given a specific menu that I had to order one entre, one main, and one cocktail from. For the entree and main there is only 2 or 3 options, the cocktail list seemed better but - the restaurant never bought me my cocktail. I ordered it with the waiter and then flagged down the staff and asked where my drink was 4 seperate times, and after 2 hours I gave up. The entree was gross and the main was inedible. Literally the worst dining experience of my life. When it was time to pay the bill I explained that I never received my cocktail that I paid for, and asked for a refund. I was denied. What an actual joke this place is.

Went to Pink the Restaurant last Sunday for my friends birthday and we had the WORST experience! We were booked in for the 2 hour bottomless brunch and not only did they not have anything on the menu avaliable at peak time on the weekend, they also didn‚Äôt serve us our first drinks until an hour in. The cocktail jugs and food were different to the descriptions on the menu and we had to ask for extra food when they brought out our ‚Äòmains‚Äô as entree sizes cause they didn‚Äôt have all the ingredients. Free flowing prosecco was also part of the bottomless deal which took 30 minutes from ordering to be brought to the table. Aside from this the staff were useless and seemed to not know what was going on or just standing around. We left hungry, thirsty and disappointed. Do not go here, it‚Äôs a scam decorated in pink.

My friend and I were visiting from Adelaide and decided to book for dinner here on a Friday night. We even received email confirmation of our booking. However when we turned up to the adjoining pizza bar, we were told Pink is no longer open on Fridays. We understand that opening days/hours can change, however, we were not notified of this change and that our booking would be cancelled. It wasn‚Äôt even posted on Pink‚Äôs social media. We were quite disappointed and had to wander the city in search of somewhere else for dinner.  In saying this, we decided to give them a go on Sunday and enjoyed a cocktail each. The decor was lovely, very pink! And our cocktails were quite nice. To make up for Friday‚Äôs inconvenience, the staff member did not make us pay for our drinks, which was lovely of him.

Not overly happy. My first and second choices were both unavailable. Ended up ordering avo toast and very disappointing considering the price. The eggs were cold and the toast was just basic bread. Don‚Äôt understand how it‚Äôs ‚Äúworth‚Äù $23 (plus the Sunday 10% surcharge).  The service was also very very slow. Waited 30 minutes alone for the 1 mocktail.  The venue itself is cute but that‚Äôs about it.

As a lover of all things pink, this place was a magenta filled disappointment. My partner and I came with the intention of enjoying a few drinks ahead of a midday theatre show, but after waiting for over 30 minutes for a glass of bubbles, our experience was quickly soured. We watched patiently as the table beside us got served their food before any drinks. I swear I could hear the cocktail filled tray sitting on the bar calling out for someone to pick it up and get it to the thirsty patrons' lips. A mum and daughter at a table behind us had their dream of filling their bellies with pink flavoured fare shattered when it arrived at their table cold and messy. With no sign of wine in sight, we stepped away from our rose coloured seats. I walked my fresh pink bob swiftly out of the door and vow never to return again.

As a lover of pink üíó and flowers üå∏ this restaurant was my complete vibe. The interior of this restaurant is so pretty and love that they have cute pink cocktails. They also have a flower wall and when you head upstairs you will see the ‚Äúpink vibes only‚Äù area.  The menu also has the cutest names and play on words. We had pork boa buns, braised lamb with lentils, calamari choy bow and yellow vegetable curry with roti and rice. All dishes were flawless and packed full of flavour.  Definitely give them a visit and consider this restaurant for a girls night out!

NOT WORTH IT!! Visited this place with a group of 12 for a friends birthday. We were told we had to have the set menu at $65pp which was okay with us. We arrived at 6pm ordered food by 6:20pm. Entrees came out reasonable, none of the wait staff checked back to see if the food was okay or if we wanted more drinks. Two guests ended up waiting 40 mins for a mocktail each. By 7:50pm we had still not received any of our main meals and one of our guests had to leave. I informed the wait staff that we hadn‚Äôt received our mains or any other drinks and she just huffed at me and sighed. In the end about 8:30pm mains arrived and they were average to say the least. When paying for the bill the wait staff insisted the guest that left did not pay (which she most definitely did as she paid only for entree and drink rather than $65) and added an extra charge onto the main guests card - charging for an extra two people. Overall the experience was beyond average. The place is pink yes and maybe good for photos but nothing else. You also have to walk through a dingy pizza place, out the back and up the stairs.  Would NOT recommend and will not be going back ever!!!
If you like eating at a place where the overpriced dish looks like a pile of scraps, the drink taste like cough medicine, accompanied by dead flies and dirty decors, this is your place.
Really great food and perfect table service! Love the brownies and ice cream! The watermelon cocktail was really good as well
Nice egg benedict, although the sourdough was a bit hard to chew.
Pizza isn‚Äôt the best. Same standard as a store bought pizza base
Delicious large size pizza for an affordable price range.
Yesterday we had a large pizza. The guy told that we can have 2 choices so we had meatlovers and Hawaiian. Both were great, tasty, with loads of toppings.
Pasta is bad. I had the veggie one - so clumpy
GOATED PIZZA SLICE RESTAURANT

High quality pizza slices that have a range to choose from depending on your dietary needs. I always stuck with the classic Hawaii & meat lovers as the price you can snag a slice for was amazing.  The staff are friendly and the aroma of freshly cooked pizza, makes the senses crave it.
Poor experience. Expensive and not a pizza I can recommend. 5 star "reviews" from local guides are paid reviews by the way. Avoid the place and the owner
Pizza for people who don't know what a real pizza looks like. Sad
Top notch pizza, cool atmosphere, good music, no frills late night tucker. Always true to their slogan, Get sliced, ya dog!  Top stuff.

I got this pizza on Saturday afternoon Literally the best pizza i‚Äôve ever had in Melbourne. Hate that it took me so long to try one from here but I‚Äôm going here everytime i crave pizza. chefs kiss üòôü§åüèΩ
One of the best pizza ever!
Super cheap quick pizza and pasta. Pizza is delicious but pasta is so so. Definitely grab a slice of pizza
I ordered a slice of pizza Margherita on both Rozzi places on Swanson Street.  The pizza üçï slices were still warm and tasty! Highly recommend Rossi's if you like pizza. Prices are relatively good.

possibly the best pizza i‚Äôve ever had at 11pm, i cried the first time i took a bite out of this angelic slice of pepperoni pizza. reminds me of when i was a young boy, in the streets of rome (italy) (the boot shaped country) and i had a real pizza. i wish it was open right now‚Ä¶ (it‚Äôs 12:50am)

Very bad, because I bought one slice of pizza which priced only 5 dollars, but they charged me 6.5, that‚Äôs why they put there machine so high, people won‚Äôt be able to see how much they charged. That‚Äôs illegal! Greedy people!
F‚Äôn incredible pizza. So different. So spot on. Try the sweet chilli chicken.
Great pizza
Service is very fast and efficient, which is very handy for on the go slices. Though I will say $5 for a slice is quite expensive. I would like to see some gluten free options!
Fantastic pizza ...plenty of topping couldn't fault it üëç
Had a great night at ARU!!! Food n service was perfect. Thanks

Food was incredible - we ordered the pate en croute, duck sausage sanga and clay pot rice. It was a shame we felt rushed the whole time. As soon as the mains were served, the waiter asked if we wanted dessert. Understand we had a two hour seating but we had at least 45 mins to go for our booking and constantly being asked if we wanted dessert and all the friendly reminders that we only had our table till 8 (when it was meant to be 8:15) really ruined the experience for a high end restaurant
Decent food & service.
Delicious food and lovely service with a gorgeous venue
What makes Melbourne a great dining destination and culinary epic centre

The restaurant is fine. I found the food to be underwhelming and overly hyped. For how the menu and staff presented the food, I expected something exceptional. For example, I've had much better broken rice meals, which wasn't even prepared in a fine dining setting. Same applies to the salmon dish, duck sanga and scallops. I genuinely think the restaurant and its staff have the capacity to deliver much better food that represents its fine dining stature.
Everything we had here is way too good & the dry aged duck is mind blowing! Very obsessed with them.

Loved everything about this experience. The intensity of the flavours imparted in the dishes is mind blowing. The oyster left such a lovely savoury, lingering flavour. It was my favourite. The presentation of all the dishes was perfect. We sat at the bar and I really enjoyed watching the preparation of the food with my partner. I probably wouldn‚Äôt order the chicken again as the flavours accompanying the chicken were a bit too intense (salty?) and probably should have had something bland (like white rice) to subdue it. Plus the duck has amazing reviews so I can‚Äôt wait to come back and try it, along with many other dishes.

Was looking forward to writing a positive review, however the delicious food was ruined by arrogant service. The maitre d unfortunately ruined the whole evening with his sassy attitude and lack of understanding of what customer service is.  However, the warmed oysters and and clay pot broken rice were delicious. Don't recommend the duck sausage as you can't tell the difference between that and a Bunnings sausage! Recommend not sitting at a high table as they have been designed for giants. It's a shame when good food from skillful chefs, who put on a masterclass show in the open kitchen, have their hardwork ruined by average wait staff.
Everything was just superbüëå
Duck and pate en croute show-stopping good as usual.

Instantly became one of my top fancy dining experience in Melbourne. The Asian Australian fusion provides a great range and shows a very modern and local take on Asian dining. The wine list is also pretty good as well as an interesting cocktail menu. Will come back.

Overall a great experience. Great ambience and nice service too. Great selection of drinks list too. These were the standouts! - Dry aged duck - Claypot rice again - duck sausage - Kaya waffles  The entrees and small plates - scallop, raw wagyu, bone marrow, bahn mi were alright. Some dishes were very salty though especially the bone marrow and bahn mi (especially the soy bean jelly in it)  The papaya salad would‚Äôve been nicer if it had more of the Thai flavour, more tangy and less mint.  Overall I was satisfied, and would go back.

Aru lived up to it's accolades and is now one of our favourite restaurants in Melbourne. Asian fusion food, delicately prepared that showcases fresh local ingredients and flavours. The sourdough bread is amazing (we would buy a whole loaf if we could). The warmed oysters were beautiful, as was the raw beef on betel leaf with marrow. We couldn't resist ordering the 2 rice dishes - claypot and fried rice. Both were excellent! The pipis (special on the day) were beautiful too. Kaya waffle was ü§§ with the tang of raspberry cutting through. Scorched pavlova wasn't overly sweet and was so light. Wattleseed cake was like an elevated spice cake. We can't fault Aru and can't wait to be back!  Wait staff were so attentive and helpful!
Awesome birthday dinner
Excellent duck. Heavily Asian influenced dishes and all full packed with flavors
incredible experience at Aru, would highly recommend. outstanding service, impressive wine selection & food that'll wow your socks off.
Everything was amazing. Listen to the wait staff, every recommendation was bang on, the only misstep of the night was when we didn't listen to them.
Brilliant on all levels ... except not cheap
Absolutely stunning menu, the food was to die for, the customer service was fantastic and the atmosphere was great. Simply can't go wrong üëå

The staff are very attentive and great at what they do. Highly recommend the duck dish, great tasting and cooked to perfection. The noodles was a close second. No need to order the fried rice, crab meat didn‚Äôt really make the dish any nicer. Had 2x tapas, a small plate, a large plate, a noodle, a rice and two cocktails for $300.

Pasta texture is absolutely criminal. It tastes old, microwaved, and the biting into it feels like biting into wet toilet paper. I prefer canned spaghetti from Coles. At least the garlic bread was crispy but I would rather eat wood than that pasta again. I only finished it because I am 6 ft but weigh less than 70kg so I will eat anything that has any form of protein in it. Feeling burned as I spent 34 dollars altogether. You have been warned. Avoid at all costs.

I ordered the meat pomodoro. Could not finish my food. Pasta was overcooked, strands were clumped together as if the pasta had been sitting there for a while. Pasta sauce was okay. Meatballs were great though.

Had lunch here, decor was nice. Pesto pizza was burnt on the bottom and the tomato was the best part, too bad there was 4 small slices on the entire pizza. Without the tomato it was well over powering flavour.  Had the beef cheek ragu. Beef was well over cooked and very watery. Pasta was doughy and chewy. Aldi frozen ragu is honestly better.  Wouldn‚Äôt recommend. One staff member was nice, the other wants to dispatch your food, mumble something and get out quick smart.

Don‚Äôt come here. There are so many amazing Italian pasta and pizza restaurants in Melbourne and this is definitely not one of them. We had the meatballs and bruschetta for starters and beef cheek Ragu and chicken Alfredo for mains. I had the home made lemonade and my partner had Coke Zero.  Every dish was bland. The meatballs were terrible and the bruschetta smelled awful. The pasta dishes were not good, everything tasted like it had just been microwaved or pre made days in advance and frozen.  Unfortunate because the restaurant itself seems inviting and cosy. Very disappointed.
I have pasta and was so bad. Pasta was undercooked. Not recommended to go there...
Great service, delicious food with amazing cocktails ..
The pasta was under cooked, plus the system was down from ordering from the code in the table, i didn't ask for the drinks while waiting 25mins, they wouldn't of known about not receiving the order.
The place is quite big but it wasn't busy at all when were there. Food was good, nothing special or distinct but just as expected.
Amazing food, atmosphere. Lovely staff! Highly reccomend

Very nice tasting bacon and pulled chicken Pizza for a decent price of $26!  The service was good as well. The only thing I dislike is ordering through a QR Code, prefer old school menus, could offer this on walk in?
Garlic bread was served cold. 1 main served with the garlic bread, other main 10 mins later. Not great flavours. Nice looking restaurant and bar area.

Lacked atmosphere, no music, very quiet, and staff didn't really interact. The food was not very good. I ordered the ragu, which was barely warm with the sauce being very mushy with not much 'sauciness' about it. The pasta was also overcooked and very gelatinous/ claggy, which was not very enjoyable at all. I paid extra and added cherry tomatoes, thinking they'd be cooked in the sauce, but I was wrong. There were just 4 cold, raw tomatoes dumped in the bowl. My husband ordered the prawn pasta dish, and this only had 5 prawns with not much sauce, and the pasta was again overcooked. We ordered through the app at the table, and my scotch and dry came out as a scotch and coke, which was swapped over quickly but shouldn't have needed to be if the order was read correctly. It was very quiet in the restaurant, and the bartender had plenty of time. We will not be returning.

Long time lover of vapianos but unfortunately this experience was very bad. We ordered at the bar and didn‚Äôt receive drinks until our starters arrived (knew there was a wait but a long time for 2 lemonade, 1 wine and a pre-made frozen margarita) then our starters were almost delivered to the wrong table. Garlic pizza and salad were really good, however the bruschetta was one small piece of bread cut in half - very abysmal - the servings are usually much bigger. The tomato was so soggy and old, ate the bread as we were hungry. The real disappointment were the three pastas we ordered as mains, inedible. Spaghetti was so over cooked it was like glue. Staff only gave the option to have food recooked, have some drinks or an option of a $25 voucher for $90 worth of food that we couldn‚Äôt eat. Not even an apology and told that no one else had complained. had to push for a refund on the pastas as we just wanted leave at that point  Used to be a favourite of mine for an easy Italian dinner, I won‚Äôt be back.
Great Italian food and cocktails in a funky lounge setting. Try and grab a comfy booth by the back if you can.

Visiting from Sydney I was expecting Melbourne to deliver on its high reputation for its Italian cuisine. Sadly Vapiano provided a poor culinary experience when it came to my pasta dish. I had spaghetti Bolognese. The pasta was well overcooked and gluggy and the sauce was thin, not rich and tasted more like a cheap Woolworths brand microwave dinner. It was easter long weekend and they seemed understaffed and sadly it took over 1 hour to receive the meal which is also overpriced for a microwave tasting meal.  Sorry Vapiano, but overall a seriously bad experience.
My partner‚Äôs food arrived after I had finished mine. Disappointing

I haven't eaten such terrible food in a long time. It wasn't just the food that was terrible. We ordered Crema Di Funghi, Bolognese, Arbos Chianti Tuscany Italy. The wine was brought in half an hour later. The volume and quality did not match at all. The food was delivered within an hour. The crema di funghi pasta was overcooked, there were so few mushrooms that the taste was not felt at all. And most importantly, that sauce was terrible. Most likely starch was used to thicken the sauce. There was no creamy taste. There was a feeling that you were eating a digestive paste with glue. The bolognese was also terrible. There was almost no meat, the sauce was disgusting. I really regret wasting my money and time. Plus discomfort in the stomach, although I ate no more than a quarter of this dish.

We had lunch here while in the city for the day, amazing food and lovely big restaurant and bar, wasn't to busy while we were there fortunately. Only critique would be they don't accept cash which we had at the time, disappointed about thatüòß I don't like when you don't get the choice.

Food ok, no service, do it yourself by QR code which had the nerve to ask for a tip ??. For someone to drop a plate on your table and walk off. Missed one meal which to 15-30min to sort after everyone else had there meals

First time trying this place on Sunday and was thoroughly disappointed! Firstly, the group I came with made a reservation and yet when we showed-up, there was no table reserved for us and we had to sit on bar stools as all the booths and window seats were taken. Can I ask what is the point of booking then? When we eventually did find a table, no one told us where to get water for the table or how anything worked, the wait staff couldn‚Äôt have cared less.  Secondly, we waited close to 45mins for our food to be brought out to the table, only to take a bite into undercooked pasta in a lukewarm sauce. The wait staff didn‚Äôt check-up on us at all so I had to chase down someone to send my food back. The waiter did not apologise for the undercooked pasta and if anything seemed annoyed that I created extra work for her. Tim Ho Wan is a popular dim sum restaurant located in the bustling heart of Melbourne's CBD on Bourke Street. Despite its casual atmosphere, the restaurant has an air of sophistication, with sleek wooden tables, minimalist d√©cor, and large windows that let in plenty of natural light. The menu at Tim Ho Wan features an extensive range of dim sum dishes, including siu mai, har gow, and char siu bao. The standout dish is the famous BBQ pork buns, which are soft and fluffy on the outside, with a sweet and savoury filling that's bursting with flavour. Other popular dishes include the pan-fried turnip cake, the sticky rice with chicken wrapped in lotus leaves, and the steamed beef balls. One of the things that sets Tim Ho Wan apart is their commitment to using high-quality ingredients and traditional cooking techniques. The chefs at Tim Ho Wan take great care to prepare each dish to perfection, resulting in dim sum that's not only delicious but also visually appealing. The prices at Tim Ho Wan are very reasonable, especially given the quality of the food and the generous portion sizes. However, the restaurant can get quite busy, so it's a good idea to arrive early or be prepared to wait for a table. The atmosphere at Tim Ho Wan is lively and bustling, with a mix of locals and tourists enjoying the food and the atmosphere. The service is also excellent, with friendly and attentive staff who are always happy to make recommendations or accommodate special requests. Overall, Tim Ho Wan is a fantastic dim sum restaurant that's well worth a visit for anyone who loves traditional and flavourful Cantonese cuisine. Whether you're a fan of dim sum or just looking to try something new, Tim Ho Wan on Bourke Street is sure to impress.

I give this restaurant two thumbs up! It is a jewel among the Chinese restaurants buried in the hustling and bustling of Melbourne‚Äôs uptown area. My wife and I are spending a five day vacation here and craving for a hearty Chinese dinner after a day trip to Sovereign Hills Gold Mine. I searched on Google and decided to come here for dinner. The hostess helped secure a table on the corner of the restaurant intended for walk-ins. We choose three common dishes to my wife‚Äôs liking. The service was fast and the quality of dishes were beyond our expectations. A vegetarian dish, a spicy pork dish and a fish fillet in a hot pot. They were genuine Sichuan style cuisine. We savored every bit of the dishes we ordered. People are warm and hospitable. When traveling far away from home, what can one ask more than a hearty meal! This eatery deserves a five star rating for the food they serve. üëç

China Chilli is a popular Sichuan restaurant located in the heart of Chinatown in Melbourne. The restaurant has a traditional decor, with red lanterns, wooden tables and chairs, and Chinese art on the walls, creating an authentic atmosphere that adds to the dining experience. The menu at China Chilli is extensive and offers a range of Sichuan dishes, including spicy hotpots, dumplings, and noodle dishes. The standout dish is the Mapo Tofu, a classic Sichuan dish made with soft tofu, minced pork, and a spicy bean sauce that's packed with flavor and heat. The Kung Pao chicken is also a must-try, with tender pieces of chicken and crunchy peanuts in a spicy sauce. One of the things that sets China Chilli apart is their commitment to authenticity. The chefs use traditional Sichuan ingredients and techniques to create dishes that are true to their origins. The dishes are also consistently excellent, with bold flavors and just the right amount of heat. The service at China Chilli is efficient and friendly, with staff who are happy to make recommendations and accommodate special requests. The prices are also very reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food and the generous portion sizes. The atmosphere at China Chilli is bustling and lively, with a mix of locals and tourists enjoying the food and the atmosphere. The restaurant can get busy, especially on weekends, so it's a good idea to book ahead or arrive early to avoid a wait. Overall, China Chilli is a fantastic Sichuan restaurant that's well worth a visit for anyone who loves spicy, flavorful food. Whether you're a fan of traditional Sichuan dishes or just looking to try something new, China Chilli is sure to impress.
