How can you not have fun with a bucket-sized margarita! The restaurant has a great vibe and we really enjoyed our food.  We'll be back!
Cute little restaurant with authentic food. Quick kind service. Delicious food that didn't leave you feeling heavy or hungry. We were still raving about hours later.
Tasty food,nice vibes
Very nice environment and food with amazing service.

Food 3.5, cleanliness 1; We were once turned back just after 12 by the staff saying they were not yet open (though the timings are 12 onwards). Second time there were some deliveries sitting at the entrance thawing in a puddle when we got there. Barring these, food was good and nice ambience. Vegetarian taco option was not great but fish was delish. Only men‚Äôs loo was open. Ladies was locked. Up a flight of stairs, so not easily accessible.
Good place to have Mexican food in the town. #hidden place
Perfect.
The guy who took our order forgot about our food until we complained to him.
Very good food with generous portions
Food great, service great. Space!! A bit tight but thats the only complaint i have otherwise very yummy food
The food very rich. I recommend the nachos and "the combination". There were a lot of people so we had to wait a bit for the food but it was worth it. The staff very friendly.

Taco Bill may not be a particularly ‚Äòfoodie‚Äô type restaurant but you have to hand it to them for having so many of these venues all over Melbourne for such a long period of time considering they aren‚Äôt particularly cheap for what you get. I always enjoy my meal while noting that the fare is not reminiscent of what I ate in Mexico. I recommend the chicken flautas with a side of sour cream. Not on the menu anymore but they‚Äôll still make it if you ask  Update Back we came to use the tokens (great marketing tactic) alas we left them at home so we will back yet again. Enjoyed the complimentary chips and salsa. This used to be standard but I‚Äôve noticed other chains have abandoned it of late. Delicious nachos every time  Original review I would not be exaggerating in the slightest to say I've been to Taco Bill 50 times over the past ten plus years but I just wanted to commend this branch on their service. After an enjoyable catch up with a girlfriend for dinner the staff gave us a free sombrero and complimentary margarita tokens to use next time. Like I needed a reason to go back for more mango tequila goodness. Yum

Not expecting the world, but when you walk into a fire trap - base of stairs crowded with full gas canisters, irony not lost as they also blocked access to fire hose reel and main riser/hydrant. You do not have to be a brain surgeon to know that is the start of serious news story. Climb up the stairs fine, then pleasant welcoming of nod of head, no real words. Sat at table where table should not be. I was directly next to the "pass" and everytime the food was ready my right ear was assaulted with the lound ring of the bell. That was quickly followed by my chair being kicked as the serving staff came to pick up the food. That along with if I learnt back my head and shoulder hit the shelf of the pass. It was busy and so some delays were to be expected, but being left in the corner, I think we were ignored, now unlike no-one putting baby in a corner, I ain't no baby, so 110kg hard to miss, but missed we were. At least I was kept entertained by the arguments between the kitchen and the servers as order mistakes or confusion increased delays and therefore pressure. I noted to other tables sat after us, get drinks, mains and one table even finished. The meals came out after 45 minutes or so, but no drinks. Eventually, the server apologised as the frozen margaritas had run out so more had to be made. When ours arrived, yes you've guessed it, not frozen - slushy machines are like that - you need to let the machine do its job, otherwise it's just a vaguely cool mango puree squash drink. Maybe my body language, or at least the slipped discs in my neck from having to sit all cockeyed, but when the bill was asked for, the server asked if I was angry. I choose not to answer as none of the experience tonight was her fault. The owner needs to stop and have a look at what service actually looks like. Wanting to get out before being caught in a blazing inferno, I didn't have the time or courage to use the toilet. Initial views were, as the rest of the restaurant not promising. Broken door, broken bins, broken tiles and paper towels strewn over the floor. So, if you want an experience of 3rd world Mexican based food, go to a bario in Mexico. The risk of kidnapping and ransoming much less than the migraine inducing posture requirements and time delays at minimum, this establishment will give. Seriously sort out the fire hazard.
Good mexican food, but the atmosphere is compact and somewhat noisy. There is Halal sign outside, but be warned the place serves alcohol. The staff are nice.
The place is very colorful and I feels like I‚Äôm in Mexico at the moment. All the tacos was amazing I couldn‚Äôt stop to order
Great food, but the interior looks a bit run down
Great food,  friendly service
This place has very tasty burgers they did say their meat is halal for the halal eaters but also serve pork, they did say that is cooked on different appliances.
I went in after very high praises from my friend. Cant say that i have ever faced bigger disappointment. Spent 17$ each for burgers which didnt even seem worth 4$. It was the worst.

Simpson's Burgers are to die for.  First time trying them the burgers are amazing you can taste the freshenss and the flavours of the food. The chips dn't get me started on the chips they sooooo delicious and crispy üòã üëå üòç and that place people line up outside the door.
Best burger I have ever had. Highly recommend.
The burger I‚Äôve been looking for over a decade !!! Juicy and fresh!

Burgers are made to order, fantastic flavour, juicy and succulent, buns are actually toasted unlike most burger joints and the chips are always hot and crispy. Fantastic. Only minor complaint is that the interior of the joint is terribly smoky, I reckon the fume hood isn't up to scratch. Excellent burgs though.
Burger is good, but not great.

Great spot to get lunch in the city. Food is out quick and tastes great. Weirdly their fish and chips are absolutely amazing, I always get it when I go. Portion sizes are also fantastic, seriously, can't recommend the place enough.
Nice chips and juicy burger

I search up good burgers in the city. Had to scroll down a bit but ended up finding this gem!! Absolutely amazing burgers, so juicy and full of flavour!!! Also the chips are to die for, and I don‚Äôt usually eat fried chips!!! üòçüòçüòçüòç
Yummy Borgor

Look, it's just a scruffy little cafe. But you can smell that meat being burnt from right up the street. These are the BEST burgers I've found in the CBD so far, and believe me, I've been trying hard. The staff are also lovely. üòä
Just the best spicy burgers in Melbs
Dont let the look of this place put you off...this place has the BEST burgers I've tasted in a long time! Also, I had the fish & chips and onion rings - so delicious...highly recommend this place!!!

Very rude staff, arrogant and childish. Ordered a meal asking for extra sauce and pickles. Heard the guy at the back laugh and whisper "like she needs any extra" I then said excuse me and he laughed directly in my face. Told them I will leave this review and walked out. Worst experience I've ever had. Laughing at my weight obesity is no joke.
Disgusting food. Saw 2 cockroaches around the table I was dining at and the entrance. Should be shut down.
Amazing taste!!!

Could have been a 5 star rating as the burger bun and Pattie were top notch but the bacon was salty and overpowered the taste. I removed the bacon and ate the rest of my burger which was then delicious. I tried eating the bacon on it's own but it was definitely too salty. I would absolutely eat here again.

I recently visited Simpson Burgers for lunch and I'm so glad I did! The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, and the staff were so friendly and attentive. I had the 'Spicy Fries', and I have to say, it was the best burger I have ever tasted! The bun was fresh and fluffy, the cheese melted just perfectly and the special Simpson Burger sauce gave the burger the most amazing flavour. Overall, I would highly recommend Simpson Burgers - they're definitely my favourite burger joint!

The burger here was sensational üòä, clearly the best burger joint in all of the Melbourne CBD area, the $14 or $15 I paid for just one burger, completely justified, the meat was cooked perfectly, the special sauce tasted amazing and the other ingredients just complemented each other beautifully üòç, the only negatives I can think of is the burger probably just needs a stick in it to hold it together and some of the lettuce just came out a bit, but overall definitely worth the mess though, you will definitely not be disappointed with these burgers üòã
American Burger was 7/10 for me. Tasted like a good homemade burger.

Simpsons burgers have some of the best food I‚Äôve tasted in a very long time! Great range of burgers and sides, at a very affordable price. Exquisite flavour combinations, and everything is freshly made. Customer service is brilliant staff are all lovely and even remembered names of customers. Greatly recommend this place, they are extraordinary.

One word can describe simpsons chips and burgers, Astonishing. I tried the simpsons burger and it was fabulous. The patty and cheese combination was a thrilling combination of flavours and really blended well into my diverse pallet. Throughout my time at simpsons burgers I was able to try the loaded fries, Now when I tell you that my mouth had a shaking orgasam as the sause dropped into my taste buds. The combination of the spices from the jalape√±o and saltiness of the chips. The customer service was also a 10/10 the staff were lovley and learnt our names as we kept coming back for more of their delectable confectionery goods.
Great food, great service, flavours are thrilling and food is not too oily or greasy, couldn‚Äôt ask for much more

The lighting in the restaurant is extremely dim, it is difficult to see the texture of the dishes and the menu, and the dining experience is not satisfactory. The prices of the dishes are extremely expensive, and the quality of cooking does not match the price. Although the pictures of the dishes look good, the taste is not satisfactory.
If I was sentenced to death and could choose any meal I want, I would probably order from this restaurant. Incredibly good food.
Wonderful food, lovely staff and super cosy atmosphere...would recommend

A wonderful dining experience with fine food, beverages and excellent service. I highly recommend people consider a night out at Sezar to sample the dishes from Armenia. I recommend you book early and catch an Uber or Taxi to the venue. Parking in this area of town as melbournites should know, can be expensive and sparse.
The food here is fabulous every time, the atmosphere and staff are lovely. A must try is the Kataifi wrapped lamb but every dish is delicious. Highly recommend.
Great service. Good food. Nice place for some different style of cuisine.

I had quite high expectations for Sezar as had heard some great things. On the plus side, the service was friendly and attentive. The food was super tasty - really interesting flavours and nicely presented. On the down side, although we had booked 10 days prior and the restaurant wasn't full when we arrived, we were firstly offered a really terrible table - right near the service desk, front door and the route from the dining area to the toilet. Thankfully we spotted a better table ourselves and the waiter was happy for us to take that. Second issue (and perhaps it was just our table) the lighting was terrible. It was so dark we had to use the torches on our phones to read the menu. Last issue the portion sizes are tiny. $44 for a beef main that was perhaps 100g of meat. Just meat and and sauce. $17 for a pumpkin side that was delicious, but just three small slices of pumpkin and its topping.  The lamb rib starter was superb but two lamb ribs each perhaps a mouthful was a bit steep at $20 something. The food was great but these few issues did detract from our visit.
Amazing. Food was spectacular but the service was even better. Highly recommend üòã
Amazing experience! Food was delicious! Loved everything about this restaurant

all the food was divine, perfect temperature and taste and such nicely proportioned. the service was lovely, if you have Dom as your server, you are in luck, she is so kind and bubbly and has very good vibes, also dresses well. the service is so impeccable, you wont see an empty water glass, they‚Äôll fill it back up before it‚Äôs empty.

Probably the best food I‚Äôve ever eaten at that price point. Highlights were the broccoli skewers, the hummus, and the baklava ice cream. My only complaint is that there was too much food and I have no self-control.
Came back again for a second time, and amazing food experience! Literally took no photos of the food as we couldn't get over how good it was, thanks to Dom our hostess, she was awesome too!

Went with some friends to try Armenian food for the first time and was not disappointed. The flavours are phenomenal and the portions are generous. The wine was beyond our expectations, and the staff there were extremely knowledgeable on not only the wines flavours, but on the vineyards themselves. Couldn‚Äôt fault the service, it was attentive and warm, we felt well looked after and had a great laugh with them as well. You have to come and try it out, there‚Äôs no better fine dining venue with a wholesome family touch.
The second time we have dined at Sezar and both times, it has been exceptional. The service and food are fantastic.

Sensational dinner at SEZAR Melbourne.  Fine dining food with the warmest, welcoming service. Couldn't fault a thing.  We ate:  HOMMUS | chickpeas, brown butter, toasted lavash KATAIFI WRAPPED LAMB | sesame aioli PALM SUGAR & SUMAC CHICKEN| sous-vide, pomegranate honey, pickled onion, herbs = softest chicken I've ever had. ROAST HAPUKA | pumpkin & lentil fatteh, sweet potato kataifi, yogurt - A white fish, divine NEW STYLE BAKLAVA | walnut toffee ice cream, salted caramel OMG
Good vibe.. not my taste in food but good quality
Our party of 4 dined on the 4 course Chef's selection and we highly recommend it. Wonderfully professional staff which enhanced our dining experience.
Good

Really tasty food. Def go the chefs selection. Three course was plenty. Service was good but the staff definitely aren‚Äôt hospo veterans but such is the current staffing climate. Only 3 stars because the place is bloody filthy. Walls, doors and toilets all disgusting, and it‚Äôs a dark venue‚Ä¶..I‚Äôd hate to see it in the light of day.

Tried Armenian food for the first time and we loved it!  The hummus had some brown butter mixed in (divine), the lamb ribs are umami bombs, the skewers perfectly charred, and the basmati fried rice with crispy onions hit the spot. üòã The chips were good too.  The crab manti was only okay though. There is also a credit card surcharge. If you book for more than 6 people, you need to get the set menu which is a bummer.
Lovely place to spend time with your loved ones.
Really lovely experience at the restaurant.The food was flavorful and well presented.The service was prompt and attentive .
Would give it a zero if I could. The manager was rude, I really disappointed for that. Hospitable hosts, delicious dishes, beautiful presentation, waitress was amazing.

Didn't expect one of my favorite Japanese franchise would become like this... Sub par food quality and table service. Chawanmushi is over cooked and has less ingredients now. There used to be mushrooms and chicken pieces in the chawanmushi, and there's only edamame now. Sashimi is not top quality fresh. I can get same quality nigiri from sushi train for half of the price. My glass was empty for 20 mins and no one came to fill up the water. I also couldn't get any waiters attention because no one walked past my area... Food price has also gone up quite a bit but the quality of food has gotten worse. I had so much good memories dining at wagaya over the past years. Unfortunately will not return to eat here again after today.

I love sukiyaki so much that I have visited this restaurant 5 times. But today was the worst meal ever.  When I brought my Japanese and Thai friends to this restaurant, I only had good memories, so I brought other friends after a long time. We ordered 3 highballs, Beef Sukiyaki Hot Pot,  Stir Fried Noodles, Chicken Yakitori, Eel Skewers, Wagyu Beef Skewers.  At first, the high ball came out, so I started drinking with excitement But the highball flavor was bland and there was no sparkling. The taste of highball was the worst compared to other restaurants There was only a slight taste of whiskey and lemon, but it was just lemon water. There was no carbonation. One out of three really tasted like water, so I talked to a female manager and asked him to change it. And I asked him to bring me water, so I said okay, but he didn‚Äòt give me water even after waiting for 10 minutes, so I asked if I could water another employee again.  Second, Sukiyaki came out and the meat was too big to share, so I asked if I could cut it in half, so the female manager went into the kitchen with the meat, saying okay, but the meat was not coming out again no matter how long I waited. At first, I thought it was because I was busy, so I waited, but 20 minutes passed, but the meat didn't come. So I called another employee to explain the situation.  he third side menu and stir-fried noodles began to come out, and the food was served very slowly, and all the hot foods were served cold.  I wouldn't have been this disappointed if I had eaten it for the first time in this restaurant. But it was a good restaurant, so I was really sad that it changed.  Last, An hour after ordering, Wagyu Beef Skewers didn‚Äôt come out to the end. So we didn‚Äòt have enough time, so we eventually called in the manager and asked for cancellation.

Tried to walk in but got stopped by the manager Daniel starting that they are 'fully booked' due to a promotion 50% when you book on 4th April. I then went onto the website the fork and saw that the restaurant has tables available at all time slots (30minutes). Ended up booking the table (no promotion) and went back to face a disgruntled Daniel. Requested to change to a booth table but was refused by Daniel saying that table had been booked by others, but finished my dinner in an hour and a half and the booth table is still empty. Sat down at the table for 15 minutes and no one to take our order so I had to walk up to the front and grab attention of the staff but I found that there were only 2 waiters busy with other tables. Food was mediocre at best and serving portions of meat were quite miserable. Got the tofu teriyaki but the outer crumbs were soggy. Wagyu hot plate had a tad of odour, and it was cooked with Brussel sprout a very odd pair of combination. The mackerel was good but the bottom bit got burnt making the fish taste quite bitter. The only redeeming factor was the scallops sashimi, it had a sweet taste to it showing it freshness. The beef tataki taste is pretty bland the sauce combination and the amount given is inadequate. This is a place I would not go in future even if it was 50% off, even worse I paid in full that day. 112 dollars for those dishes. Disappointing

I went on Saturday evening with a booking, with a friend. We were greeted by a nice male staff. When we queried what happened to the ipad ordering system they used to have we were informed that he is filling in as they are short staffed. We then had to use the scan link and use our smart phone to make an order. It was a bit difficult to this over the phone and the website automatically adds a tip without us being able to remove it. Second red flag right there. Order once placed we waited for someone to bring us water, 10 min later no water so we had to find someone to ask for it. 20min after the order we got a 5 piece sushi dish when it was labelled as a 6-piece sushi dish in the menu. When we asked about this we did get an apology and they brought us the additional one. We also ordered the beef skewers which were ALL FAT, we commented on that and we got another sorry. Clearly you can see the fat before cooking the meat. This was unacceptable. The gyoza came cold. The only good and hot dish we got was the fried chicken. Well you can guess that by now we just wanted to finish eating and get out of there. I WILL NEVER GO BACK THERE AGAIN. Maybe they want to close it down. If I could put zero stars I would.

Disappointed is the only word I can use to describe this restaurant now. After being a frequent diner here for 10 years, the new management have absolutely ruined this restaurant by hiking up the prices by nearly double on some dishes whilst keeping the same portion sizes and removing the ordering tablets from tables that made this restaurant unique.  The new system requires a QR code on a smartphone which opens a clunky menu that requires a payment every single time you order. This automatically also applies a tip and a ‚Äúservice fee‚Äù which is a percentage of your total order price. Service fee for what? Your customers are doing all the work for you. You must be dreaming.  New wait staff are absolutely useless, we didn‚Äôt even get a table water at all through the night, something that you used to be able to order through the old tablet system.  It‚Äôs a shame to see what was once my favourite restaurant in Melbourne become easily one of my most disliked. The new management have taken this place downhill and you can tell they don‚Äôt have a single care, since they only reply to positive reviews. Should say enough.  Avoid at all costs and find somewhere better. That won‚Äôt be hard at all, since Wagaya has now set the bar that low.

What was once a pretty reliable place for affordable Japanese food with decent ambience is no longer. A change of management has resulted in a hike in prices, under trained staff, and a decline in food quality. New owner plans to turn the venue into a fine dining spot. We ordered a wagyu tataki that was chewy, thick, and didn‚Äôt even meet casual dining standards. A fine dining endeavour seems ambitious, if not, delusional. Music was obnoxiously loud and the playlist spanned commercial dance to 70‚Äôs. The iPad ordering system is gone and is replaced with a QR code to a very buggy Squarespace menu.  Other highlights:  - Mains came before entrees - Tempura came without tempura sauce - Salmon nigiri came without wasabi  Staff at the front were kind despite the circumstances. This seems to be a top-down issue by this new change of hands. „Åæ„Åü„Å≠„ÄÅ„ÉØ„Ç¨„É§ üëã
For me, i think it is the right choice to dining here. Food is truly delicious, well-decorated with reasonable price. Moreover, staffs are friendly and helpful whenever i need them. Recommended

Do not recommend anymore. Poor quality food, not worth the price, go else where for Japanese.  Was a fantastic place but in 2023 there's been some sort of change, perhaps management, and overall the restaurant has just plummeted. Touch screens used to order food from are gone, replace with a buggy and sluggish QR order on phone system.  Menu range has been slashed drastically and prices have shot up. Regular items eg chicken skewers, which I would get multiple of, now I can literally count the dollars per bite.  Quality of the food itself has dropped. Eg friend noodles, basically clumped together and flavourless instant noodles.  You'd get better flavour and quality with a packet of instant noodles from the supermarket.  Sushi and sashimi was fish you could tell was old, and again rice that was old, dry and very under seasoned.  The final straw was the service. Understaffed and very confusing. I booked well in advanced and was emailed a confirmation to have a booth but instead I placed on a table with the sun literally in our face. Staff literally opened up my booking request in front of me and ignored it.

The food experience was good no complains, but I remember the ordering experience use to be better, relaying on your own mobile kinda sucks and if people order from different devices the waiters get the very confuse, not he same nice memory. Other reason why the 2 stars, the restaurant was stupidly under staff in the floor , they where only 2 waiters running like headless chickens, why are u trying to save money on staff?.

The music was so loud you could hardly hear each other speak, we asked forbit to be turned down but staff said theybwerent allowed as noisy music was their policy. You have to order off your phone which is not easy to see the menu and you have to pay each time you order something before the order is sent to the kitchen. Some of the items say "sold out" but you can get them by asking the staff... and paying for them separately at the end...  Food was pretty good and seemed to be prepared by Japanese chefs and it came quickly once we had figured out the system.. They dont make things easy.
Good atmosphere and decent food.

Quite difficult to find and place is a little old with the worn down benches and damp smelling private rooms but the food came out very fast and it was very delicious. Soft, fresh sashimi and wagyu hot plate was so fatty.

The food as always is great, I've been coming here for years. The only let down is that the tablets you order from are now gone and you have to use a QR code, when dining with a group it makes ordering a nightmare. Staff are great but not the original. Prices have gone up also. Booking a table has gotten easier though
Food was horrid. We got a sashimi platter and the prawn & other items were spoiled. In the end they had to refund us. Never coming back
Worst ever. Quality was seriously lacking. Regretting ever coming here while eating‚Ä¶ not a feeling you want to have while dining. Do not recommend.
Worst everü•≤not only hard to find but also hard to eat happily here ü•≤poor quality high price. Save ur money,Don‚Äôt come. ‚Ä¶

Anti-referrence: After enjoying and supporting dining at Wagaya for the last 7 years, new management and their concept of "trying something new" have been able to quickly end our interest in attending there ever again. And they were able to achieve this in one sitting! No more electric menu on the wall with easy push-button options (which used to include calling a staff member to help). Only now able to use a QR-code with your phone to navigate through a slow tricky app by the way!  No hard-copy menus either...so heaven help the elderly who may not be into mobile phones!! Prices all increased to compliment much smaller portions and sizes of platters. My Californian Roll looked more the size of a Spring Roll! Very average food too. One of our orders reached the kitchen, but the staff accidentally ticked it that it was completed and sent. Thus 3 out of 4 at our table had meals, whilst our 4th person missed-out. After flagging down one of the managers about this, he asked to borrow my partner's phone and take it to the kitchen to suss-out the issue! My partner wasn't impressed and insisted on accompanying this guy with the phone! After the error was discovered, the 4th meal arrived and all of us could watch our friend eat it, as we'd all finished our entre-sized main courses 30 minutes before that. We hinted to a semi-apologetic management if we could be compensated in any way for this...and they uncomfortably declined. Sorry Wagaya, you were good while you lasted, won't be back! SAYONARA!

Restaurant was "moody" (read: dimly lit) Staff seemed inexperienced and could only provide basic service. Squarespace online ordering was bug-ridden, difficult to use and slow to load any of the pages. Checkout process was manual, drawn out and clunky. But at least the food came out quickly (took less time to cook than it took to submit an order!) and it was tasty....altho we were starving by the time we finally got orders into the system so we would have eaten whatever they brought us. Portions were Japanese-size (tiny) so we ended up having to painfully submit a second order. Would not return - it's not worth the hassle.

No more physical menus or tablets to order dishes anymore. You have to scan a QR code on your phone to access the menu. After pressing on an item, you'll have to wait about 10 seconds for the next page to load. No more gluten free options either. Oh, if you thought by downloading the app would make ordering faster, it doesn't.. They are the same speed. If you need staff service, keep an eye out for them to call them. There is no buttons or call bells to call them either anymore.  I can only hope someone sees this and re-thinks about what they've done. Used to love this place. A pity.  EDIT: Food was initially 3/5 but proportions have significantly decreased too.

Wagaya is Finn‚Äôs favourite Japanese restaurant. But recently they changed their menu and unfortunately, it‚Äôs not for the better.  Seared Salmon Sushi üç£ Fresh, quality salmon topped with salmon roe, Japanese mayo & eel sauce. So far so good.  Pan fried tofu is a downgrade, they replaced the agedashi tofu with this new dish where the pieces are smaller and not as crispy as they used to be. The sauce is good, but the tofu skin was missing some crunch.  Wagaya Salt Base Ramenüçú No change in the recipe. Had a light salty flavour. We liked the noodles, they had a great taste and bite to them. A good bowl of ramen.  Chicken Yakitoriüêî Have shrunk in size, the meat was just cooked, but it was missing some char. It tasted ok but it could‚Äôve been a lot better.  We were a little disappointed with the quality of some of the dishes this time around but we will come back to try other options.  Finn Bites dining experience 3.9/5 ‚≠êÔ∏è $$ üíµ

Used to be a nice place to visit for dinner. Now prices have gone up, changed ordering system to QR code where tips is applied by default.  We ordered 2 pasta, and 2 sushi dishes bringing the total to $70 already. Food quality was alright, but not worth the price.  Loud disco music was playing among mandarin songs and they couldn‚Äôt lower the volume when we asked.

Food was good enough. The cooked dishes was great, fresh raw items could be of better quality for the price.  Service wasn't great (but could also be that they are training new staff which is fair, but still expected more from Wagaya)  But food is good enough for me to come back in the future  to see if service will improve.
Nice Japanese restaurant in CBD. Food are up to standard. The hotpot tastes good!

Last time I dined there, they didn‚Äôt even bother to serve us water. I walked out of the restaurant feeling thirsty. The ordering machine at our table was broken and they refused to switch our table to another table of our choice because we ‚Äúbooked‚Äù for that specific one we sat in apparently. The other table that we wanted to move to had no one there the entire time we dined there. No sure why they wouldn‚Äôt just let us switch over so that we can have a better dining experience. Food was just okay. Some are good, and some are average. Would not go back again.

This used to be one of my favourite places to come for Japanese because of its variety of options and relatively cheap prices. However, recently the management of the place changed (they told us themselves) and the prices have just risen to a level where you are no longer able to get the same experience.  Just to give you an example, 5 pieces of gyoza now cost 14.90 meaning almost $3 per gyoza (they are slightly small too), and a coke costs $6.  Additionally, although I'm not sure if it's a mistake or not, we ordered $81 worth of food, but card payments have a 1.5% surcharge which brought it to $83 on the tab given to us at the table, but I was charged $84 when actually paying.  It seems they are transitioning a bit towards fusion food too. A lot of new menu items in their offerings use western ingredients not commonly seen in Japanese dishes and have combination dishes that I would probably expect out of a western place trying to serve Japanese influenced food. We didn't try any of those so I won't comment on them, but maybe it's an incoming shift that people should be aware of.  All I would say is, if you're a returning customer, be aware it's not the same experience and the prices are much higher than before. If you're a new customer, the food isn't bad, but in my personal opinion it's not worth the price they are charging now (which you'll see reflected in many of the recent reviews of this place).
A fun, cheesy jungle themed decorated bar that does happy hour. Strange choice of outdoor furniture indoors but if you‚Äôre staying at the hotel it‚Äôs very convenient and well priced.

Ordered room service for a booked specified time. Food arrived over an hour early, lukewarm, in a paper box with no condiments. Expensive, poor service and bland. For an upmarket hotel I expected a LOT better and would 100% NOT recommend.
Really underwhelming
Part of the Stamford Hotel. It was a contrast because I liked the hotel, but this place was lifeless like a bad joke.
Stopped in for a G&T. The Jungle theme didn't really deliver! But nice service

Very delicious cocktails that were reasonably priced! The bartender was very friendly and was happy to make what ever I was after! The venue isn‚Äôt too bad but nothing special! Sadly there was a mouse trying to attack me which kind of ruined the moment but overall not too bad!
Bottomless gin was good but music was horrific, think they compiled a play list of all the worst covers ever made and played it on repeat

My family came and stayed at the Stamford Hotel for the Easter weekend and Harry's Jungle was next door. I cannot recommend the bar manager, Kate, as a star employee more highly. She really made my family's stay at the hotel memorable, personable and fun! She is an amazing mixologist and a great bar tender. I hear that she is moving on to another bar soon, and I truly feel bad for your loss as this girl deserves a pay rise. The bar itself is fun, the hotel memorable, but Kate really made our stay worthwhile. Would strongly recommend the $39 all you can drink cocktails for large groups of friends and for functions!

I used to come here with friends years ago. I had fantastic memories of this place: busy and great vibe, packed with people cheerfully chatting, drinking and eating after work on Fridays. I am finally back here to catch up with a friend who works nearby. Thrilled to find the Happy Hour drinks are still delicious and affordable, as well as friendly and speedy service (thank you Marvin for your friendly and professional service). It was a bonus to still get complimentary nibbles. The only thing missing is the crowd: well it is only Tuesday... I know, right? üòÜ Nothing wrong to have an after-work drink early in the week to support your local businesses. üòú I really had a great time üòÉ
Aways enjoy sitting outside enjoying the food and cocktails. Staff are all lovely.
Outrageous price for poor standard of food. The fact that my official complaint to the Stamford plaza has been ignored suggests a lack of interest in their business.
They offer good value daily specials but the service has gone down of late with increased waiting times. I waited 40 mins for my meal.  Not recommended
Clean and friendly atmosphere
Great food, seated without wait. Highly Recommended
Perfect for the quick coffee catchup we had after dinner at another very noisy venue. Staff are very pleasant and professional and service is always quick. A regular go to for me.
Nice place to relax
Amazing staff and food omg
Amazing staff and beautiful good
Enjoyed a really nice traditional Christmas lunch there with the family. Simple delicious and unpretentious. Left fully fed and watered ready for a sleep. Recommend it for a fuss free Xmas day.
Had dinner there on Saturday night.  Food fantastic,service friendly and prompt, ambience relaxed and comfortable.

WOW WOW WOW! My partner and I had been craving some ribs and found this place to be the best from other reviews and it was better than expected! All the staff were so attentive and nice and made the whole experience so seamless. Entrees were fresh and delicious and we could barely even speak to each other while eating the ribs they were that good! Chips were also the perfect crunch on the outside fluffy on the inside. I was tempted but just way too full from the mains to have dessert but I‚Äôm sure they would‚Äôve been just as perfect. Couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better night ü•∞
Tasted incredible. Great service! Maybe some  greens would have been nice but other than that was amazing Thank you
Great steaks- great service üëçüëè& loved the sticky date
Absolutely delicious!
Great steak, great service and great night. Thank you Rare
Lovely experience. Food could‚Äôve been served hotter. Staff wonderful and happy. Great service.

Wonderful experience from beginning to end. We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. Service was polite, efficient, friendly and professional. Our waiter checked on us throughout our visit regularly and was on hand to assist with our requests. So glad we booked a last minute date night! Thank you Rare, we‚Äôll be back!

James our server/host was all smiles throughout the evening and contributed to a relaxed atmosphere. We ordered steak, ribs, onion fries, oysters Kilpatrick and as a lovely surprise were served a complimentary ice cream for my husband's birthday. While on the pricey side, we found it worth every cent..this is a great restaurant for a special event.

My only issue was I got lost trying to find the place. I made a call and the waitress actually came out on to the road to wave me down and escort me to the venue. The exceptional service continued from there and all meals were stunning. Can‚Äôt wait to return and share the experience with our friends.
Great food, very tasty eye fillet, reasonable price, great service
Our go to place for steak and a cocktail. Great decor,  Awesome friendly service, steak, good wine list. Steak. And ribs are awesome. Steak.

Entrees were great, service was fantastic, restaurant awesome, cocktails were good but the steaks were really undercooked and not worth the hype. I did notice two other tables sending there's back but what's the point when I pay good money at a "Steak restaurant". Sadly won't be back and won't recommend to anyone.
Not my first time at Rare, but my first time at their Uptown location. Great restaurant, awesome food and a good location.
Customer service was excellent, accommodated for halal, the food was fantastic all round really enjoyed this place will definitely recommend this place.

Beautiful steaks, restaurant and staff! Highly recommend, we couldn‚Äôt fault the experience. We love Rare and are regulars to the restaurants. Each time the experience is seamless, and fairly priced with good portion sizes.
Went for my wife's 60th birthday. Food and drinks were delicious and the service was superb. Very attentive without being too full on. Would thoroughly recommend.
Gab my name, I know why is called reare stake because that‚Äôs the place to get smaller stake, don‚Äôt go there if u are hungry.

Came here as I was craving some steak and visiting melb at the time (from syd). This steak house was amazing, so tasty and service was immaculate. Prices are alright especially considering the service and steaks are never going to be cheap! Creme brulee was too die for. Also ur welcome to set up shop in Sydney ;)
Great food and service. !
Excellent customer service and fantastic place to meet up with friends.

The steak was good but not phenomenal, and so was the kangaroo tartare. The sticky date pudding was delicious! The staff were very nice but the place was a bit too noisy for our taste. A good experience.
Amazing service and steaks were cooked perfectly

I guess you need to like Mexican food to really enjoy this place! Found is all a little meh but that is possibly a little harsh. No-one did anything wrong - except my first 2 choices of beer were not available.
One if the best Mexican restaurant I have been to . Amazing.
Every dish is delicious! The doneness of the main course was perfect! The service is also very good! When you come to Melbourne, you must come to this Mexican restaurantüëçüèªüëçüèª
Really great food! Will definitely be returning.

Good vibes, yummy food and exceptional margaritas (a must try). Great for people who are gluten free! I would order the tuna p√¢t√© over the guac - it's delicious.  Tacos could do with some flavour improvement (a bit bland and underwhelming), but everything else is tasty.
The Margarita here is the best in a hundred miles üòç The food is great~ The atmosphere is very goodüëç

Mamasita is a solid Mexican restaurant. We enjoyed our meal and the cocktails. The tuna starter was nice but nothing to rave about, the tortilla chips with guac was good too but again not blow your socks off. We enjoyed the fish tacos and the pork belly main, again nice but similarly not the best I've ever had either.  Service was prompt and friendly. Please note that the table bookings are 1.5 hrs and they ensure you stick to it. Again that's fair enough but if you want a longer sitting ensure you ask.

Guacamole to die for, amazing vegan selections and some awesome meat dishes, too!  We went hear before a show and the team were super accommodating asking how long we had to dine and made sure we were taken care of.  Special mention was to the ox tongue tacos which were fantastic with the addition of the green jalapeno hot sauce.
Good food and service, but a bit expensive for what they serve.
Bit overrated in my opinion. Nothing like authentic Mexican food. They're going for more sort of  contemporary and fine dining experience if I may say so. Lamb birria was average!

The worst Mexican restaurant I've ever been. I'm from Mexico City and I've been in Australia 7 years so of course I don't expect much or the real Mexican food, but this was really bad. The taste of the dishes was mediocre and portions too small. Very overrated place. The ceviche has absolutely no flavour, how can you ruin a ceviche?!  I was here in 2015 then 2019 then March this year 2023 , all by invitation and all I can say is try any other Mexican restaurant in Melbourne.

We were made to order the banquet as we were a group of 8. Pretty disappointed as it meant we had little to no choice in what we were served, and when you multiple the pp cost by 8, it's actually pretty expensive for what you get. I don't understand why they're so firm on that, I just want to choose what I'm paying for.  The guac was basically smashed avo with some seeds on top. No taste of lime, no traces of onion, and I counted two tiny pieces of tomato. Ceviche didn't have enough lime juice either.  It's also frustrating when you're paying the bill to get handed an eftpos machine with 3 main options of 'how much would you like to tip?. You have to navigate out to select nothing. Why is there a culture of tipping when the staff should be being paid fairly. This isn't America, and it's not fine dining where the staff are going above and beyond.  So many better Mexican restaurants in Melbourne.

how i found this restaurant today was a bit unfortunate (basically was trying to kill some time before heading to RVEEH) but what a find !!  i saw the prices and thought it was a bit much but was so hungry and i didn‚Äôt think i‚Äôll find another place that would be open on easter sunday so i went up.  we ordered the corn, fish tacos, pork belly, and corn chips with a black bean dip (?). the pork belly was $44 which is a lot HOWEVER was it to die for. my partner wanted it and i said sure, i‚Äôm not the biggest fan of pork i kind of fell out of love with it but i can eat mamasita‚Äôs pork main everyday. crispy pork skin but the meat was so juicy and soft i could not get over it.  my only gripe was the fish tacos. yeah, it was good but i think 18$ for the two was a bit much. i‚Äôve had similar quality for 10$ for two.  i do want to shout out the service though. the waitress serving us was super nice and explained the menu very clearly. i asked if they had any mocktail and recommend the virgin mojito which is apparently a secret menu ! she looked after us very well and told us about the lady on the wall ! so shout out to her !!  surcharge was crazy but not including that it was $120 for two ppl including drinks (i did have a mocktail so maybe 1.5 drinks). i think pricing was reasonable enough.  tldr: pork is worth 44$

Visitor from Sydney here, visiting Melbourne quite often but usually have something quick and easy around Swanston/Flinders.  This time, decided to try this restaurant as many guide suggested and I feel I should try something that ‚ÄúMelbournian‚Äù have. Also, a great Mexican food should bring me back a good memory when I was in Cancun many years ago.  Sat at the bar as I came alone and really want to keep the table for a bigger party.  The staff were lovely and service was good although a bit annoying as two ladies sat beside me seem to chatting and playing with staffs most of the time, fair enough, they might be friend with them, or, they might be extrovert and socialise people which the bar is well accomodate them.  However, I feel like I wasn‚Äôt taken care well enough even though I just came here for a ‚Äúnice‚Äù dinner, not sure if other customers at the bar feel the same or not. Also, the music quite loud which makes communication a bit struggle.  Then the food, here we come, the reasons for one star.  The menu wasn‚Äôt catered very well for non Mexican experts, come with various jargons and Spanish words. This might be good for upscaling the restaurant but it‚Äôs quite confusing and really have no idea how the food is (PS. English is my second language, it might be OK for others, I don‚Äôt know)  The food quantity is not that worth for the price tag. Your guys are a rip off. I feel like I have been scammed.  18 bucks for 2 very tiny tacos, 15 bucks for 2 very tiny wrap of grilled squid (?? I don‚Äôt know how to call as the menu issue, already mentioned), and 7 bucks for a tiny bowl of prickles and assortments. My initial plan to enjoy the nice meal here is over and I need to have some pizzas around Swanston Street after that to fill my stomach.  Anyway, the drink is OK and worth the price. The coconut milk with cinnamon is a good match and taste really great.
Amazing food! Made sure that all my intolerances were looked after in a serious way, the food was amazing and the drinks were Devine! Will be recommending to anyone who needs to eat in the city!
Our dinner was short but sweet! Literally mouth-watering tacos and that Yuzu Marg is to absolutely die for. Amazing service as well and such a beautiful vibe for a date night!

Incredibly disappointing. The taste of the dishes was extremely mediocre and portions were small. Very overrated place. The ceviche was disgraceful. I'm no expert but that's nothing like the dozen or so ceviches I've had before. 4 slices of fish in a red pink sauce. See image attached. Ordered 5 dishes,  none of which were mains, and four drinks and the total was $256. The drinks were decent but overpriced as well. $30 for an old fashion. Will never return or recommend. If you want better flavours, atmosphere and prices,  head to Harley and Rose.

Family of 5 here we took our daughter here for her birthday Food tasted ok  but the servings are so tiny it‚Äôs not funny I ordered the steak burritos very small amount of meat and they give you about 3 tiny little tortillas wasn‚Äôt enough for the small amount of meat my kids could not stop laughing at how small there burritos were I have noticed other reviews on here have said the same thing about how tiny the meals are maybe start listening to your customers and increase the serving sizes we went hungry as a family and after spending over $300 we all left hungry, we had to stop at McDonalds on the way home

First time here and service was outstanding. Waitress was happy to spend time to explain the drinks and food. Food and drinks were lovely - we had banquet $69 and 2 cocktails each and was enough for us. Would love to go back again sometime.

Generally it's a cool venue and the food is good.  However, we booked a table for 3 people, once we go there we were sat down and our food and drink order was taken and the staff were very friendly, however that's where the good experience ends.  We ordered the $69pp banquet set meal. The wait between courses was absolutely unacceptable, at one stage we waited over ONE HOUR between courses.  When we asked if our order had been forgotten were told that our next course would be "five minutes at most" - already tired and a bit miffed I started a timer on my watch - it took 23 minutes.  This was a recurring theme, we were sitting down for 110 minutes before we managed to get our main.  Then another lengthy wait for our desert was not what was on the set menu we ordered.  We were offered a free jug of sangria, but one of the 3 of us was pregnant and at this point we had been there for over 2 hours and had to get up at 4am the next morning to get a flight.  To top it off, there is a mandatory 10% surcharge on Sundays, which is usually totally fine, but it was quite a sour thing to pay when you have such an awful dining experience.  All in all, this place has loads of potential, and I'm sure is usually fine as we got it as a recommendation from a friend who said they had a good time here - but our experience was a completely unacceptable dining experience and no amount of "Sorry it'll be out in a second" every 5 minutes for 2 hours can make that feel any better. Unsure where the problem lay, but as a customer, this was unfortunately one of the worst dining experiences I've had in a long time.  The food was very good, but based on our whole experience I would not recommend this establishment.
The food was nice and the staff were attentive but the food was so slow! Over 3 hours for our dinner and an hour between courses. I was embarrassed to have suggested it for our group dinner.

This review is from our visit in early February. I usually love Mexican food, but somehow did not like the food here very much. Not very flavourful or fresh. But the one thing I absolutely loved was the mushroom tostaditas! So good! However the service was great.
Great view, great service, great food

Regularly go to this place.  The service is always great,  good is amazing and the views create a nice ambiance.   Great place to take that special person.   Meet and relax in the bar outside the restaurant

Visited this restaurant to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Beautiful views, excellent customer service and top of the world food. Amazed with details and the how well the flavours are complementing each other! Tortellini and veggie bao for entree are top notch followed by chicken breast, veggie main and date pudding, creme brulee! Definitely worth every $$$ and Thank You chef and entire team for such a great experience. We'll be back again!! Our section waiter Will, you're a gem and making this restaurant shine brighter! Great work
We have lived a culinary experience! Thank you so much to the Chef and the team ! Also the hostess was super friendly and helpful! Thanks again !

Will is the most amazing waiter I have ever met in my life and I traveled all around the world! He made our experience more than amazing and we will always remember him. Thank you for making our date night the loveliest! ‚ù§Ô∏è  The other waiters were also very nice and friendly!  The food was also amazing, it was so tasty and I consider myself a picky eater (I am French) haha  Beautiful view, great ambiance, great prices 100% recommend the place! Enjoy! ‚ú®

we dined here on a thursday night. The waiter was very professional and knowledgeable.  we asked for a table beside a window. beautiful view of the city at night. prices are on the high side, but the food, service and view is amazing. i'd go again

A fantastic experience with amazing views. The food was beautiful and waiters were all lovely. I would recommend for all special occasions. Only issue is it is a bit hard to find if you haven‚Äôt be there before.
Our Daughters 21st the food was excellent so was the service made the day memorable.Fab View!
Lovely meal, very high standard and with exceptional service from will.

We stayed at Sofitel Melbourne and dined as a family of 3 at No. 35 on 30 March to have an earlier evening. Beyond the beautiful sunset views of the city, we found the food and drinks to be enjoyable and elegantly plated. While one or two dishes were slightly over-salted for our taste, we found this to be the case for most restaurants in the city.  We were served by Ashley, who was courteous and warm to our daughter. The general manager at the front of the house was a cut above the others, and fully attentive to the varied needs of each table. For example, she noticed that we were sharing the entrees and proactively brought us sharing plates. Our water glasses were also refilled so smoothly that we didn‚Äôt notice anyone doing it. Would recommend No35 for a pleasant dining experience in the city.

I went to No35 for the first time with my friend and we were looked after by a lovely gentleman named Will. Will was so kind, knowledgeable, accommodating and hilarious! He truely made our experience worth while and a night to remember. We started with wines and not being a wine drinker like myself I was overwhelmed by the choices. Not only did Will narrow it down for us, he also recommended the best tasting ones and his favourite ones which did not disappoint at all! He was engaging in conversation with us and didn't treat us like customers, he personalised the experience as if we were old friends having a chat. Will's food recommendations were absolutely spot on and we'd be absolutely lost without his impeccable customer service and recommendations. He is an absolute asset to the team and if you ever get to eat at this gorgeous restaurant, please request for Will. I can't give him a more glowing recommendation, I will be back again in the hopes to be served by this lovely man. Please give Will a raise, or at least acknowledge him for the amount of care he provides for the work he does. It's rare to come across the customer service Will has provided. Thank you so much again Will! much love from your favourite chismosa xx

I recently had the pleasure of dining at no.35 restaurant and I must say, it was an exceptional experience. The restaurant boasts an inviting atmosphere and the service was top-notch.  My partner and I were celebrating our 2nd Year anniversary. As frequent diners, we've been to many restaurants, but no.35 definitely stood out in terms of food and ambience. However, it was Will's (the waiter) service that made our experience just that cherry on top.  We opted for the 3 set course and Will was very knowledgeable in recommending popular dishes. Each dish we ordered was outstanding. The warm chocolate fondant dessert was a highlight and perfect for any sweet tooth.  Overall, I would highly recommend no.35 to anyone looking for a superb dining experience with exceptional service.

A wonderful evening in a delightful venue. The city lights are outstanding! The food was excellent and Will, our waiter, was nothing short of pleasant, friendly and welcoming. His smile and humour made our evening together celebrating a birthday even more special.
The food and service was amazing! A special thanks to Will who looked after us and made our anniversary night extra special!

We spent the evening at No35 for my wife's birthday.  Our waiter was Will a young enthusiastic and extremely polite young man who was an absolute delight to have serve our table. He attended our every need and was kind enough to organise a small plate with happy birthday written on it.  Truly above and beyond üôè. The food was fantastic, everything was cooked to perfection and the desert was out of this world. With Will assisting us on becoming Accor members we most definitely be returning and recommending this fine (breathless view) stablishment. Thank you Will and No35 for a fabulous evening.
Fantastic customer service from the waiters Exceptional quality food I have been a few times bringing new guests who also enjoyed the meals and the service and amazing  views!

Highly recommend No35 as a place to celebrate specials events! Dishes are  delicious and atmosphere here is great. 5 stars for Will:))His service is excellent. He is so sweet! I had a really memorable  birthday night.

No35 is located in a high-rise building with an excellent city view, which creates a unique and enjoyable dining experience.  The view from the restaurant is simply stunning, with a panoramic view of the city that adds to the already beautiful interior.  The menu at No35 is diverse, and the dishes are carefully crafted and beautifully presented. Every dish we ordered was delicious and prepared to perfection. The quality of the ingredients used is evident in every bite, and the flavors are well-balanced and enjoyable. The wine list is also extensive and offers a wide range of choices that complement the food perfectly.  The standout feature of No35 is undoubtedly the service. Our waiter, Will, was exceptional. He was attentive and charming and made our anniversary day truly memorable. Will made us feel welcome and comfortable, and his recommendations were spot on.

The restaurant is certainly back to 5 star service, it‚Äôs an enjoyable experience, great view of Melbourne and amazing food and great selection of wine.  If you want something different try the popcorn Expresso martini.
Absolutely incredible

The most extraordinary breakfast experience in Melbourne; you can enjoy a fabulous view over the city and the river from 35 stories up whilst breakfasting on a sumptuous hot and cold buffet, with dishes like eggs benedict and omelettes made specially to your order. The service is wonderful too; legends like Alice, who's worked for the Sofitel for some 30 years, are always on hand with kindness and consideration to make sure that you start the day in the very best way possible!

High tea with resplendent views of Melbourne and a pianist was the perfect way to celebrate Valentine‚Äôs Day. At $90pp plus cc surcharge it‚Äôs definitely at the highest end of Melbourne‚Äôs high tea offerings but we enjoyed the experience. The savouries were pedestrian but the pastry chef impressed and the scones were the best I‚Äôve had in some time. Deliciously light and fluffy. Side note do visit the bathroom before departure. The view is sensational not to mention the sublime Balmain hand wash
Delicious
10 stars. The best fine dining in Melbourne an unbeatable experience, food, views and service.
Absolutely lovely!

Exceptional. Simple food served quickly for those of us going onto evening events but somehow not rushed and we got the impression we could have lingered all night if we'd had the time. Down to earth, but knowledgeable service and the anchovy toasts were some of the best food we have eaten this year. Yum. Only downside was that sitting at the bar meant we got bumped a fair bit but that's a very minor point.

I had rabbit mushroom risotto, a wet rice dish which was creamy, mushroom, yummy with chunks of rabbit in it with a $21 Spanish wine which was paired very well with the dish. Tip for person in charge, do make single diners more welcome.

We originally booked inside but upon arriving we asked if we could sit outside as it was milder than we anticipated. They were most obliging and quickly set a table by the heater for us. Service was super friendly and efficient and the food certainly lived up to our expectations. We loved sitting out in the bustle of Little Collins St.  The wines matched beautifully with the various plates we ordered. We cannot wait to return and order the plates we didn't try.
Great food and great service ~ best place to hang out
Great wine and desserts. Going to come back for a full dinner experience.
Overrated Spanish food. Menu is not rich. Description of food is not clear. Food presentation is not nice. Toilets are clean. Waiters are polite.
The food is great~ The original menu is in Portuguese~ The Mediterranean Iberian flavor is biased towards üáµüáπtapas~ It is worth coming again~ Great atmosphere~ Cozy bistro

Very disappointing. Staff is not helpful. Would not want to share the available wifi and when I cancel the order to head back to the hotel, tried to charge me for it even though I canceled. Felt like being taken advantage of, rather than welcome. if you are looking for a nice dinner dinner Sheraton while on a work trip trying to get some reading done with tablet and a dead mobile phone, look elsewhere.

What a wonderful place. Feeling like a European wine bar, Bar Lourinha did not disappoint our group of five friends on a busy Friday evening in Melbourne. The small and large share plates suited us perfectly from the tangy lime and chillie oyster, the beautiful wagyu beef skewers and the amazing pomegranate crema with honeycomb. Washed down with a delicious bottle of red (or maybe two) all topped off by perfect service.
Good food, friendly people but just lacked a sense of atmosphere for lunch. May be better in the evening.

Loved this spot!! Service was great and the food even better. Loved trying out a number of the dishes (great to come in a group of 4) with the standouts anchovy on bread tapas (special), scallop and pork cheek pintxo and Portuguese duck on rice. The Bolinho de bacalhau (cod croquette) was also pretty good along with the squid. Will have to come back and check out the rest!

Think twice if you have allergies!  I'm anaphylactic to sesame (seeds and oil).  We were at Bar Lourinha for a catch up with girlfriends from Sydney - some I hadn't seen in over 20 years!  I asked the servers twice if there was any sesame and I was told very confidently that there was no sesame in any of the dishes we had ordered.  I had a reaction straight away so I asked again and was told again that there was definitely no sesame in our food.  I finally asked if there was perhaps tahini in a dish and was then advised that yes, they had added a little bit of tahini in one of our dishes.  Not once did any of the servers, or the chef register that tahini is pure sesame!  That is like forgetting that there is peanuts in peanut butter!  Needless to say, I was left cradling a bucket with a very nervous uber driver but at least my friends got a free meal out of it!
The service was exceptional. We had a private gathering upstairs and they keep the bar open after hours just for us. Never experienced this at such a high demand bar before.
All time favourite Melb food safari destination. Beautiful flavours, friendly staff and delicious wines.
Great food
Delicious tapas. Buzzy vibe. Friendly staff, experts on recommending number of dishes. Great wine selection by glass. Dessert full of intense flavours, finishing off with Spanish Sherry. Bravo.
Spanish style food bar with tapas and raciones! Food is delicious and friendly staff!

Here the food is Spanish Tapas or more specifically Catalan cuisine. So expect many small dishes served in quick succession. It is a small restaurant but what it lacks in size is more than made up with an atmosphere that is unpretentious. You get the impression that the staff like working there as it reflects on what the customer sees - Friendly faces. I will return many times. Highly recommend

We had a wonderful New Year's Eve meal at this fantastic intimate eatery to see out 2022. A set menu, including a glass of bubbles (not the cheap stuff either), made it nice and easy for us. Everyone working there did so with a smile on their faces & made us feel special - a big tick in my book. The wine list is extensive and the food was sublime - my favourite was the spiced spanner crab tostado & my husband's was the soft shell prawns. We loved all the knick knacks adorning the walls - a nice reminder of times we spent in both Spain & Portugal back in 2018, and the live singer/musician towards the end of the night added to the ambiance. Thank you to the staff of Bar Lourinha - Happy New Year to you!
Lovely lunch with a client, set menu - 150$ was very nice
Very tasty food. Great cosy setting with knowledgeable and helpful staff. Will be coming back.
Great date night buzz .  Tapas were tasty , should‚Äôve ordered way more chicken heart skewers..delicious. Staff here are great . Tip well ! They deserve it !
Great fresh food and friendly staff in the Stamford hotel, we had breakfast their twice during our and lunch one day as well.
Amazing experience

Just had their 8 course Christmas lunch. What a joy! Fabulous food, meticulously planned menu, waitstaff unstinting in their attention and food delivery. Could not fault it and will be back next year.
Shoutout to Stephen for going above and beyond.  Appetisers and entr√©es were incredible. Mains were alright. Cocktails were good!

The restaurant for the Sheraton Melbourne. Pretty solid kitchen that also does the rooms service and the hotel breakfast. Burgers are really good and the salt and pepper squid was also a solid choice. Buffet breakfast is the usual hotel offering with hot food buffet, pastries and fruit. Eggs made to order including omelet. Staff are friendly and efficient
Food was great and enue was great too. The staff who served us was very helpful and tries to givee 110% all the time.
Comfortable night in
Fantastic service, small menu but great choice. Also cater for vegetarians great drinks at reasonable price. Over all it was a great night.

This Little Collins St Kitchen has changed since someday before after COVID19.  Dine-in menu for dinner is now pretty simpler as there is no longer fancy buffet run for dinner, nevertheless quality of shucked oysters with caviars is pretty good and worth paying for.  Wagyu hamburger for the lunch menu was good and worth paying for as it was still better quality than Hungry Jack.  Coffee in this hotel is not worth paying for as coffee beans do not look fresh nor aromatic flavor.  Downside is; 1. This restaurant and cafe does not have local beers(Melbourne one) 2. Overall I was satisfied with cook in this restaurant, but not recommended for Bar and dinner if you may look for better and quality of food and unless staying at this Hotel including breakfast is a package option. I was reading all the reviews online and hesitated to make a booking for my wedding party. I‚Äôm glad I decided to try for myself. First the service was amazing! I booked in advanced and pre-ordered a la carte menu. It was a breeze dealing with all their staffs. They communicated to each other well so I didn‚Äôt have to explain to every single one of them every time I contacted them. They were able to accommodate my request in advanced to arrive at 11.30, which would be earlier than their usual lunch hours at 12 pm to have refreshments. I was originally told that we could wait at the lounge seating at the front of the restaurant, which was fine but people would be walking around us. Again, I wasn‚Äôt fuzzy about this. But when we arrived today very early at 11 am, we were seated in a very private area that was reserved for our party next to the bar on those comfortable chairs. Unexpected and wonderful experience! It was intimate space and away from all the restaurant patrons. For refreshments, we had coffee and tea with those Buttermilk Fried Chicken sliders and Baked Camembert with herb and garlic butter along with toast. Those were great and such a hit with all my guests.  When we were seated at 12 for lunch, we were well taken care by staffs. Alison was knowledgeable with the wine selection. Love the Australian sparkling wine she recommended. When the food arrived, the portion was not at all what I expected. It was huge portion. Calamari was tender. Mushroom risotto was very good according to my husband. I had salmon for entree. Perfectly cooked with red curry butter sauce to spice it up. It‚Äôs not spicy but definitely something different that I would order again. The steak was beautiful and everyone enjoyed the meal.  I particularly love my strawberry macaron! Delicious and fresh to clean my palette after the fish. The dark chocolate hazelnut fondant was nice and warm. The richness of chocolate was satisfying especially to go with rum raisin ice cream.  Overall excellent service and amazing food. Definitely memorable experience for our special day. I will recommend to anyone looking for cosy and comfortable ambience with great food and five-star service.
Very relaxing atmosphere and food was delicious.  Excellent customer service as well.

Went there with 3 friends for a Saturday seafood buffet with our Groupon vouchers. Only had 2 staffs on the floor serving everyone. Staffs kept forgetting to clear our tables (as we had oyster and prawn shells in bowls) or bring us water. To be honest it was not their fault because I think the place was understaffed. Towards the end when it was quieter, staffs were really nice to tell us that the buffet was coming to an end and we should grab our desserts. Food wise I think the crab didn‚Äôt taste too fresh but everything else was great.
Seafood buffet has good quality seafood, fair variety of seafood. Buffet in general is quite small with average quality mains. Cosy atmosphere.
Service good. Food ok. If you go here, the corn is amazing!

Banquet menu not worth it. Had the Uncle Knows Best menu & it felt like they just serve you their cheapest dishes for $64pp.  It started with the lime cured hapuka and coconut on betel leaf which was so mild and lacking in flavour. The aftertaste was just fishy & in want of acidity.  The other starters were quite tasty: edamame was nice but is literally just salty grilled beans. The grilled corn was also done really well but ‚Ä¶. it‚Äôs just corn? The crispy chicken bao with pickles was the tastiest dish from the entire banquet & balanced sweet & salty well.  The mains were the let down. First of all‚Ä¶ fries? This didn‚Äôt complement the meal & the Szechuan salt was unidentifiable. The fish curry tasted like a bowl of warm milky coconut soup. The potato & bean curd puffs were just starchy & there wasn‚Äôt enough texture or taste.  Quantity: They gave us 1 bowl of rice to share between 3 people and 1 plate of steak between 5-6 which worked out as one slice per person‚Ä¶ definitely feeling a bit scammed here.  Vibe: nice set up & decor, nice toilets (unisex), with hand towelettes.  I won‚Äôt be back & am surprised by the high google ratings. I‚Äôd rather book at Rice Paper Scissors or Ho Chi Mama for contemporary Asian flavours done well.

Stepping into Uncle we were warmly and genuinely welcomed by all the staff.   Clearly they love working here.  The food was fresh and clean,  with the best of ingredients presenting us with hot,  umani, crisp and balanced combinations.    Best meal we've had in Melbourne

We had a delightful experience. Absolutely loved the food. If you are looking for comfort soul food look no further, paired with amazing cocktails.  Most importantly, impeccable service from the staff. Would go back again & again !

I had the displeasure of dining at Uncle yesterday for a team lunch. Unfortunately some of my team were struck down with COVID so of the 8 we booked for only 3 of us were able to attend. Upon arrival we explained the situation to the Manager and he said (in an arrogant manner) that we would be charged a no show fee of $64 per person that didn‚Äôt attend. He mentioned it was stated in the terms and conditions in the booking confirmation email (which they were not). The website also doesn‚Äôt mention anything about a fee when part of the group can‚Äôt attend. To avoid the fee I arranged for 3 additional colleagues to attend given the office is nearby. Therefore there were 6 of us.  We went to order the $35 lunchtime quickie but were informed that Uncle weren‚Äôt serving the lunchtime quickie during December. I was told that this information ‚Äòshould have been outlined in the confirmation email‚Äô (it wasn‚Äôt). I pointed out that the hard copy menu didn‚Äôt have a note or sticker or anything to indicate that the lunchtime quickie wasn‚Äôt available and nor did the website have any wording to indicate it wasn‚Äôt available (it is still listed on the website menu).  Our group then went to order a la carte and were told we were not allowed to order a la carte as we were in a group. I mentioned that the website doesn‚Äôt have a requirement that groups can‚Äôt order a la carte at lunch - direct quote from the website ‚ÄúA La Carte menu available at lunch and for groups less than 8 at dinner‚Äù. To clarify, we were dining at lunch (12:30PM).  The website also states: ‚ÄúWe require all groups of 10 or more at lunch to dine from either our ‚ÄòLunchtime Quickie‚Äô or ‚ÄòUncle Knows Best‚Äô banquets. Groups of 8 or more in the evenings are required to dine from either our ‚ÄòUncle Knows Best‚Äô banquets‚Äù.  The website further states: ‚ÄúWe require all dinner reservations of 8 or more to partake in either our $64pp or $80pp banquet‚Äù.  To clarify, there were 6 of us and it was lunch so I don‚Äôt understand how Uncle can justify forcing us to order from the Uncle Knows Best banquet. Even if they were enforcing that our booking was for 8 it wouldn‚Äôt justify it according to their own words on the website (there were less than 10 of us and it wasn‚Äôt an evening booking, it was a lunch booking).  I was then passed to a Manager (the same one from the start).  I explained the situation to the Manager outlining all the facts. The Manager was unable to justify why both the hard copy menu and the online website (and online menu) had no wording to support the $64pp no show fee, nor that the lunchtime quickie was unavailable, nor that we were not allowed to order a la carte when in a group. The Manager was adamant that all the information was outlined in a booking confirmation email. I showed him the confirmation email we received and he then went to get his computer to supposedly show the confirmation email. When he eventually returned, what he showed me was not a confirmation email (it was essentially some manually typed shorthand notes in their system).  As a ‚Äúcompromise‚Äù the Manager said he would waive the two no show fees (which again appear to be made up fees that we weren‚Äôt told of beforehand or could find no mention of on the website). Also given we had 6 out of 8 ppl there and were ordering takeaway for a 7th it would‚Äôve been a bit rich to still charge us a no show fee, so the gesture was nothing but an empty gesture.  At this point it was getting late and it was clear that the restaurant had an agenda to give us no option other than to order the $64pp menu and given our credit card was on file we begrudgingly accepted.  In terms of the food, the best way to describe it would be ok but not great. I‚Äôve had worse but I‚Äôve also had better, much better. The quantity of food was also not great.  I dine out a lot in and around Melbourne and have never had such an unpleasant experience at a restaurant before. Safe to say that the people I know won‚Äôt be going back. In my opinion there are much better options out there in the CBD with much better customer service so diners beware!

Another pleasant dinning experience from the Paiks enterprise!  As soon as you step into the two level restaurant you know you will be in for a treat, don‚Äôt expect your traditional KBBQ but a variety of mouth watering dishes starting from the sides through the signature soup and noodle dishes! Dishes of the night were Jjamppong - spicy noodle soup. Beef bokkeumbap a hearty fried rice with beef tender brisket with vegetables and egg. I recently had a great Korean bbq experience at Mapo Grill. Visiting for dinner we decided to order items individually rather than one of the set combinations. We got the beef bulgogi, pork belly, spicy chicken thigh fillet, vegetable combination and seasonal mushrooms. We accompanied this with steamed rice and a vegetable pancake along with rice punch, grape juice and lychee soju to drink.  The great thing about KBBQ at Mapo is that the staff do all the cooking at the table for you. This is particularly handy if you‚Äôre not much of a cook or if you‚Äôre relatively new to Korean bbq.  Everything we ordered was delicious and was very filling. The highlights for me were the beef bulgogi, chicken, mushrooms and the vegetable pancake. The beef was juicy and tender and the bulgogi marinade was lovely whilst the spicy chicken thigh was full of flavour. The mushrooms worked beautifully on the bbq and the vegetable pancake was nice and crispy.  I rate Mapo Grill ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è out of 5. The food was delicious and I loved that the team assist with all the cooking. Thanks very much for having me.

Mapo is still consistently goodüòã The traditional Korean food and creative idea to enter the Melbourne market.  Find out >> Melbourne‚Äôs Ktown @mapogrillbbq  üé• Follow for more videos!

My husband loved his BBQ pork on rice, my daughter actually finished up her honey chicken on rice so must mean it was good. I am extremely disappointed with my experience at the mint tonight. On every other occasion I have had a great time but tonight my friends and I arrived, . A young bartender came out to serve us drinks and he accidentally spilled an entire glass of beer and 2 white wines  all over me . All of our drinks were spilt in the process.  I understand this was a mistake but the staff after did not even offer us another drink? My understanding is that the normal process would be to at least offer us our drinks that were spilled all over me for free lol? is the common practice to spill drinks all over a customer then act like it‚Äôs their fault?  So I go inside smelling revolting and humiliated and kindly request they rectify the situation and offer us drinks. She asks me if I want the manager; I say no it‚Äôs ok I understand it‚Äôs a mistake and I don‚Äôt want to get the boy in trouble but I just want our table to be handled. They eventually agree to offer us drinks (again humiliating when I‚Äôm the one who is soaked and smelling horrible) but the lady comes out outside and just slams the drinks on the table and walks away. I was left very disappointed, In fact disgusting  at their entire temperament   following this even though we continued to stay there and ordered food and more drinks. Not happy.
