Good kbbq to visit in the city! We got the $88.8 beef combo which included three meats and a soybean stew (you can choose between that or kimchi stew). The soybean stew was still a little spicy by the way. But it was really good! The meats were also good quality and tasted fresh. Would recommend to have with family and friends :)

Normally BBQ should be all about meat but I definitely felt that the star here was the side dishes. Seaweed soup, spicy fishcakes, crabsticks, macaroni salad, etc. So much variety and all of them tasted so good, I would say this place is the best kbbq in town based just on that.  As for the meat, the pork belly was thick and good quality, and the spicy yeoltan bulgogi also tasted fresh albeit a little too salty for my taste.  Would recommend getting the DIY rice balls as well instead of just plain rice for that little bit of extra flavor.  Also, if you can, try asking for seats that aren't at the very back of the restaurant, since that's where large groups are placed and it can get really noisy and extremely bothersome when you're just trying to eat in peace.
value for money, plenty of space for a crowd

My go-to korean bbq place. Nice service and good food. The corona beer slushies is to die for. I wish they would have korean fried chicken in the menu though since I think that this might be the first korean restaurant that don‚Äôt do fried chicken.

A must visit every single drive to town.. Worth every penny.. Service was quick and people are lovely. Great ambient and K-feel the moment you walked in.. Good portion too..

weekday evening visit I knew for the first time since I was born that Saemaeul Restaurant was in Melbourne. It is located in a place where there are many Korean restaurants around. Baek Jong-won Franchise Hong Kong Banjeom is also around, so it's a surprise I ate a beef combo and an old bento box, but the price was higher than I thought, so I felt that the price was higher than in Korea. The taste seems to have made a lot of effort to preserve the local feel of Korea. Most of the customers seemed to be Asian, but there seemed to be a lot of Chinese. It is said that there is a wait on weekends or popular times, and that the store hours are limited to 1 hour and 30 minutes. The store is very large, so it's good to eat in groups. the place is just okay but I‚Äôm a little disappointed. side dishes are good and lots of variety of dishes. the downside is, we tried to order the spare rib that was pictured, but received LA style rib instead. when my husband asked about it, one of the staff said this was the spare rib. There are a few Korean pizzerias that are open until late at night. I have eaten two or three kinds of pizzas so far, and they are all very good. They have different flavors. If you want to experience a few more at a time, choose monster pizza. As a Korean shop, rice cakes are very good. The hot sauce is actually different from other Korean shops. It is spicier but fuller. The fried chicken is a bit ordinary, and the taste is no different from that of ordinary fried chicken shops. The few Korean pizzerias that have been open until late at night, currently tried two or three pizzas, they are very good, a variety of different flavors, if you want to experience a few more at once, choose monster pizza. rice cake is very good, the Korean hot chilli sauce is actually different from other Korean restaurants, more spicy but also more plump. Fried chicken is a bit ordinary, and the taste is no different from that of a regular fried chicken restaurant.

Tried their famous  loaded Premium Monstet Pizza which has unique ingredients and flavours. They also have Korean fried chicken, tteokbokki and Korean fusion pasta dishes.  The shark cocktail was also the highlight of the night. Great fusion pizza and korean dishes
nice Korean style pizza

Such a cool unique dining experience in a city that has so much delicious Korean food. I love Korean flavours and I'm surprised it's taken so long for the concept of a KOREAN pizza place to come up! I recommend the monster pizza which gives you a variety of different toppings, but the bulgolgi was my favourite! Also recommend getting the soy garlic fried chicken and tteokbokki which had great flavours. The KSP (Korean Snack Pack) is also the best treat for those classic late nights!

Melbourne‚Äôs first and only Korean-style premium pizza restaurant! üçï  This place specialises in Korean fusion pizza, pasta, and fried chicken! üá∞üá∑ The pizza comes so many unique and delicious toppings - like bulgogi, sweet corn, or potato mousse - as well as red bean and sweet potato stuffed crust! üç†  Highly recommend going for their Signature Set ($69) which comes with 1 Large Pizza + 1 Fried Chicken + 1 Tteok-bokki of your choice! üôå  Their famous Monster Pizza is a must if you want to try a bit of everything! Sliced into squares, each pieces has a different topping - including Sweet Potato Mousse, Bulgogi, and Prawns! üçï  Their Boneless Snow Cheese Fried Chicken is honestly some of the best - the cheese powder is insanely addictive and the chicken is super juicy and crispy üçó  Their Rose Tteok-bokki is also one of the best versions of the dish I‚Äôve tried - the rose sauce is sweet, creamy and cheesy at the same time üßÄ  Cream Bulgogi Spaghetti ($23) is a must-try if you love carbonara - love the Korean style twist and it‚Äôs surprisingly not too heavy! üçù

Featured: üçù Cream Bulgogi Spaghetti üçï Monster Pizza üçó Sweet Chilli Chicken üç• Rose Tteok-bokki üçπ Blue Shark Cocktail üçπ Passionfruit Ade üç∂ Lychee Soju  Korean dinner feast! We got the signature set which included 1 pizza + 1 chicken + 1 tteok-bokki for $69. There are heaps of pizza flavours to choose from and we opted for their signature monster pizza which comes with about 7 different toppings üò± definitely a good option when you want variety! They also do pasta with a Korean twist, fried chicken, tteokbokki and other side dishes. It was quite busy on the Friday night we visited which meant we had to wait a little bit longer for our food but otherwise service was good!

Pizza Monster üçï - Signature Set $69 * Monster Pizza * Sweet Chilli Chicken * Rose Tteok-bokki - Cream Bulgogi Spaghetti $23 - Blue Shark Cocktail - Passionfruit Ade - Lychee Soju $15  Pizzas and Pasta with a Korean Twist üòç I really like this K- Fusion concept. Their monster pizza had 7 flavours in one pizzas. If you are indecisive like me, the monster pizza could defo satisfy all your cravings. I enjoyed both the tteokbokki and creamy bulgogi sauces. Overall, food was not bad. My only suggestion is having more staff to work at peak hours. The waiting time could be long.  #invite
Had to wait over an hour for 1 pizza. Disgraceful in my opinion. Do not go here.

We ordered: üçΩ Signature set $69 - comes with: üçï Buldak (spicy chicken) $30 add cheese + sweet potato crust +$5 ‚ú® üçó Snow cheese chicken $22 ‚ú® üåπRose tteokbokki $19 ‚ú®  üçù Cream Bulgogi spaghetti $23 üçó BBQ chicken wings $12 üçä Grapefruit-ade $8 üçá Good day soju grape $15 ü¶à Shark attack $18  Came hungry after work to finally try out this place! Try everything by ordering the Signature set - sad there was no famous monster pizza to try but we ordered the Buldak one. Expected it to be hot like the dish but it was just a little spicy, tasted very nice and loaded with generous toppings, visible chicken breast, random prawn and pineapple too which I liked üòã Get the filled crust add on! Dab on some tabasco srircha for some extra heat üî•  Everything else was pretty good too - generous cheese, on the snow chicken with cripsy, juicy like kstyle pieces though a bit small serve; the tteokbokki could be hotter but the flavour is one of the best I've had, like addition of filled fishballs too. Quality carbonara, good blend and balance for something different. The Bbq chicken wings were a bit small but well cooked with a tangy glaze and great mustard sauce. Delicious and authentic food with friendly and helpful staff.  We had the soy marinated crab which was devine. Sashimi platter was fresh and delicious. Entree dishes and army stew were very enjoyable too.  Would have been better if they can take bookings.
Massive portions. Comfort food.

Went last week with my partner. We both enjoyed it so much! Unagi roll and Aburi salmon roll are the must try dishes. We also had a beef bulgogi stew, and the portion is like HUGE. Highly recommend this place to everyone who want some good Japanese & Korean food in city!
Was really good overall with food and service! Good to come with big groups as the portions are really big. Ambience was a bit chaotic but not unexpected.

The food at Nana Izakaya absolutely blew me away! This Japanese gem was a great spot to devour some unique and delicious izakaya style dishes - they even have an amazing drinks menu!  The unagi roll was my personal highlight. Everything was  incredible and super fresh!!! ‚ô•Ô∏èüòª I loved every bite of each piece. The sashimi platter was also ultra fresh. üåü the fish soup was also my top pick!  The venue is stunning with different seating areas to suit the vibe you‚Äôre after. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a date, group hang or just any catchup with friends. I also love the management and staff of the restaurant - they are so friendly and accommodating!  I highly suggest you check this place out for some delicious Japanese food!!! You won‚Äôt be disappointed
Owner is very kind and nice and goooooooooood service ~~‚ô° the lady manager also very petty and kind!!!!!! Thanks you!!!!!

Nana Izakaya and Seven Star Pocha are the same restaurant but different menus.  Best fried chicken I have ever had in my life, hands down. The japchae is absolutely delicious and is a must try.  Reasonably priced and amazing food. Definitely coming back here.
Awesome!! Good service, all staff very kindly and delicious.

One of Melbourne's Hidden Gems!  Whisked away in down Healey's Lane is probably one of the most incredible dinner spots I've ever encountered.  Nana Izakaya serves up the best Japanese/Korean dishes on offer! Totally recommend the spicy pork and baby octopus and the cheesy eggplant!

This is such a fabulous restaurant. The food is incredibly good. The sushi was extremely fresh. The scallop roll sushi was really delicate and so good. The drinks were excellent. The service was exceptional. We love laneway Melbourne restaurants & you def want to check out this amazing place. It is joined to its sister restaurant Seven Star we tried the potato noodles, fried chicken & tuna rolls and they all were amazing. We will def become regulars here.
Assorted Sashimi is average. Love their pork belly and toppoki!

Decided to walk in and try their food, great range of dishes on offer. I chose the grilled chicken cold soba salad to eat in which was fantastic with a range of pickles and also a serious amount of avocado. Great flavours, look forward to coming back. Price is decent for the meal you receive that is for sure.

Their raw fish are super fresh and they actually use real wasabi which not many Japanese restaurants does. The staff are super friendly and attentive we had a very good time there. Especially after lockdown thank you guys! Ps. Yuzu cocktail is the cocktail to go ü§© ‚Ä¶

Mentaiko udon is bloody freaking delicious. The only con is you never know when they're open? I've walked back dreaming of mentaiko udon, but then find they're closed even though Google says they should be open :( perhaps call up to double check before booking
Not a izakaya Japanese restaurant , this is joint with their Korean restaurant. Charging 10% on Sunday ‚Ä¶ not normal

A bit pricey for what the dishes are. Most items are above what you get in a Japanese restaurant (same sort of quality) your typical sashimi and sushi combo. Tried the chirashi, ok portion but the rice is over seasoned. The miso soup is way too salty than it needed to be. The good news is the Korean menu seems a lot better (yes you can order Korean dishes as it's a joint restaurant) and the alcohol is fairly reasonably priced. $14 for a 300ml sake. $19 for cocktails (2 pp per serving). In conclusion, great place to drink but not ideal to dine for the asking price (pretty street food vibe not izakaya...)
Love their lunch-time sushi! Great and variety of offerings

Located in a small alleyway, Nana Izakaya is one of the two restaurants there. It‚Äôs sister restaurant is a Korean restaurant called Seven Star Pocha. When you enter the venue, the two restaurants are actually connected despite each having its own entrance.  On this visit we had sashimi and sushi as our entrees. The sashimi was available in three sizes; small, medium and large while the sushi was available as small with 6 pieces and main with 13 pieces. Both of these were fresh and beautifully presented.  For our mains we chose two nabe dishes. Nabe is a hotpot which is cooked in a portable gas stove at the table. We were advised that nabe is designed to be shared between 2-3 and we think this is true if you plan to have entrees and other smaller dishes but as a main, we could finish a nabe each.  We had the wagyu nabe and sake fish nabe. And our favourite was the wagyu nabe which had a variety of mushrooms, tofu, glass noodles, cabbage and wombok in a sweet mushroom broth. While the sake fish nabe was as described with shell fish already cooked to 'well done' and layered on top with a layer of cabbage at the bottom.

Absolute gem of a restaurant, serving up a delicious variety of izakaya-style Japanese food! My favourites were the Unagi Roll and Mentaiko Cream Udon. All the food was very fresh and the service was lovely and attentive throughout the night, without being overbearing.

Loved dining here at Nana Izakaya. The sashimi and oysters were super fresh and delicious. We also got some yummy unagi sushi. I ordered the creamy mentaiko udon with egg yolk, highly recommend, while my partners ordered some ribs, very generous portions! Staff were super lovely and it‚Äôs a cute little spot. Also if you like soju, the presentation was so fun and loved the refreshing but not overly sweet taste of the fruity soju cocktails

Good service and nice ambiance. Run by Koreans, the food is good but too pricey for what it is. A pity. Got a jug of Black Asahi, large sashimi, 1 sushi roll, 3 entrees and it was $80 a person. For that price tag, I‚Äôm expecting to be blown away. The fried chicken was tasty but not extremely crunchy, loved the wasabi octopus, sashimi were good but small‚Ä¶

its bit expensive but delicious

Nikos has truly made a name for itself as the place for a good sandwich and coffee. Every morning and afternoon for breakfast and lunch, there are lines of people waiting to get their orders in. Of course I had to try to see if it lived up to the hype.  I ordered the Chicken Schnitzel sandwich and my goodness was it delicious. Unlike your usual schnitzel sandwich with lettuce and mayonnaise (not that there‚Äôs anything wrong with the classic), this was a harmonious combination of the bread, cheese, sauce, pickles and dill which took centre stage with the schnitzel as an accompaniment. With that being said, the chicken was beautifully cooked and rather than minced chicken, it was crumbed chicken breast so it was super juicy and tender.  Highly recommended and yes it lives up to the hype. Can‚Äôt wait to try the Cubano Melt next time.

Great sandwich spot! We ordered the Cubano and Tuna Melt sandwiches. They were both great! A bit of of a wait - but well worth it. Seating was limited, but we walked over to Flagstaff Gardens and had a nice picnic. The menu is posted, but I recommend looking online if you're wanting more details about the ingredients. Definitely recommend!

I already ate cold noodle in many place but this one give me feel the best because this taste so fresh but I hope they can put more colder. It can make this taste perfect If you come to this restaurant. Please try sangye tang (ginseng chicken), it so nice and feel good after done this meal
Great experience here. Food was super tasty. Would definitely est here again.
Yukhoe Bibimbap Yukhoe is so fresh „Ö†„Ö† Yukgaejang and glass noodles were so delicious. I think I will go again next time !!!

We were craving Korean fried chicken and came across Mook Ji (I feel like I came here a few years back but not for KFC). The fried chicken was tasty and fresh. Absolutely no complaints at all. The Korean girl on cashier was also friendly. Would definitely return.
There is a lot of meat and all the side dishes are delicious!!‚ù§Ô∏è The staff were so kind and it was a pleasant dinnerüëçüëç Is really good and clean!! every staff so kind‚ù§Ô∏èüëçüëç
Food and interior - below average. Service is mediocre. We wanted korean bbq and this was the only place open that time.

Great food and nice staff, all assisted with cooking. We ordered only the add-ons (wagyu, scotch fillet, and vegetables) and not the whole set but was still very filling. Cool and fun music. Clean place and not as smoky, as compared to other k-bbq. Talk about UH-MAZING dessert! YUM!!

My partner booked the restaurant for Saturday night dinner, because the atmosphere looked great online, the interior  looked very cute, and the reviews were very good.  HOWEVER, we had a terrible dining experience. I normally don‚Äôt leave bad reviews, but mainly the music was just TOO LOUD considering the dining atmosphere that the restaurant tries to portray? I‚Äôm not joking when I said my partner and I had to YELL and still couldn‚Äôt hear a thing. üòìüòìüòì  (I thought live music of cello and violin would be very classic, elegant and beautiful, but they played extremely loud pop music one after another and personally it just doesn‚Äôt match with the atmosphere.)  We ordered crispy pork belly with egg and duck curry. The first time they gave us the crispy pork belly, it was COLD. After telling the waiter about it, they then gave us a fresh one. But it was just okay‚Ä¶ the meat was really chewy and not crispy.  Overall I was disappointed. The only good thing was that the staffs were helpful and friendly. Might be a better place for a big crowd (seems like their targeted customers anyways).
The food was amazing. Hats off to the musician amazing song selection and loved his work. Will definitely be back soon
Absolutely amazing!! A 10 out of 10 for their wonderful service and food. Easily one of the best Thai food in Melbourne!
Great ambience and fantastic live music on Saturday night! What a place to be. Definitely coming back!
We had a great time at the restaurant. Friendly staffs and quality food. Thank you for the birthday‚Äôs balloons and cake.
Nice sitting for dinner and food Is tasty yet limit choice with live music.

The Wanderer is a cozy and welcoming bar located on Lonsdale Street in Melbourne. The ambiance is relaxed and comfortable, with plenty of seating options both inside and out. The decor features rustic wood paneling, dim lighting, and vintage touches that add to the cozy vibe. The drinks menu is impressive, with a wide selection of beers, wines, and cocktails on offer. The staff are knowledgeable and happy to offer recommendations based on your preferences, making it a great spot for those who want to try something new. The food menu is small but well-executed, featuring share plates and light bites that pair perfectly with your drinks. The Wanderer is a great spot to catch up with friends or have a quiet drink on your own. The service is friendly and attentive, and the ambiance is perfect for a low-key night out. If you're looking for a relaxed and comfortable bar in the heart of Melbourne, The Wanderer is definitely worth checking out.

Great atmosphere at this restaurant. Live music and really friendly staff. The stand out dishes for the night were the beef rendang and the broccoli with roasted port. We also enjoyed the desert during the night. If you enjoy spice, just order chilli on the side. Overall. Great restaurant for group of friends to catch up.
Had a birthday dinner at this venue. Staff were friendly and always checking on how our night was. Amazing live musicians. I'm definitely going back again.
Bit overpriced with the portion of quantity provided. Apart from that, great ambience and good service provided with background live music and all.

*edit came back after covid and surprised at the standard of the food... Atmosphere still great with live music. Service is good. We ordered pad Thai and it lacked flavour. Ratio of noodle and bean sprouts was off. I normally enjoy bean sprouts, but for me to have a mouthful of mainly beansprouts was not pleasant. The crispy duck curry was not rendered properly and definitely not crispy. Soggy duck and the flavours in the curry weren't balanced properly. Quite disappointed.  3 years ago this place was good....Ambience was very good with live music on a Saturday night. Staff was friendly and attentive. We ordered the duck curry and the Tom yum soup was made depending on how spicy you requested, both were full of flavour and delicious. Had the coconut pandan cup which was sweet and savory, great dessert to end the night. Would definitely come back to try the rest of the menu.
Good sized and priced food.  Nice atmosphere. There was live music the night we were there.  Staff were polite but could have been more attentive.  We would return.
Food and service were good the live music on Friday was bruh. The guy was playing trumpet or sth with the original songs playing in the background. Most of the songs are outdated and annoying.

Great Thai restaurant with a nice vegan section of the menu.  The decor is whimsical, not your typical Thai restaurant, but I quite liked it.  This is elevated Thai dishes, done in share portions.  It's a bit more expensive, but I think it's warranted for the atmosphere, service and food is all of high quality.  My friends and I had an amazing dinner.  The only thing I didn't enjoy was the smoked maple and miso old fashioned - I think the miso was overpowering and made the drink too salty which was not enjoyable.  Personal opinion, keep the smoked maple syrup as that's always a winner and to make it "thai" maybe garnish with a thai specific citrus like thai lime or maybe use the leaf as an aromatic with the orange.
Excellent food and very kind staff.
Good food and amazing live music

Probably the best service I've ever had. The table was for a hens event .The live music from 6pm was great , the food was delicious and came out fast and the service they provide was really accommodating as they set up balloons for us around the table free of  charge which was unexpected .

Was exciting to drink couple of cocktails too but not worth giving money away here. Don‚Äôt bother coming not worth it  Update- after having the food (especially the pork belly) i was sick. The amount of oil in there was terrible The rice was undercooked Some waitresses were nice The only dish I liked was the Tom yum out of the 4 dishes we got

Very cozy restaurant with live amazing soothing music. Ordered fried rice recommended to try with spicy powder tastes yum! Spring rolls are fresh and must try. Fast service and friendly staff. Finally, roti will melt in your mouth üòã
Nice atmosphere , food price and portion are reasonable. After 11pm , the restaurant becomes a bar under Thonglor Melbourne with live band. Sigha /Heineken Beer 5 bottles for 30$

10 points to recommend this restaurantüëçüèºüëçüèºThe waiters are top-notch üòç Definitely praise themüòâ There is a music performance inside, the waiters and the music performers interact a lot, I think the atmosphere is very good, and the food is also good. I saw many people celebrating their birthdays , not only have birthday songs to listen to, but also small fireworks to playüòçüòçüòçHappy~  Thai Shrimp Dongxin Soup (very rich shrimp flavor) ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è 10 points recommend the fried rice here ~ very fragrant, and there are a lot of seafood in it ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Super Fresh Papaya Salad ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Duck Breast Salad The meat is fresh and tender, and the mouth is springy. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è  The manager here is very nice, if you need help with taking pictures, he will set the angle for you üòùüòùüòù It's like hiring a photographer We all had a great meal throughout the processüëçüèº Highly recommend ü§©ü§©ü§©ü§©ü§©
Impeccable experience,  loved this placeüëå Customer service is best so far, outstanding pad Thai. Nice place for birthdays and dinners. Has good vegetarian options but can do with some more. ‚Ä¶

brilliant roti dinner for $10
Although the service is good, the food at Mamak is absolutely amazing.  So delicious and so fresh.  I can't get enough of Mamak. I'll be back very soon.
Food is really good been here thrice. The servers needs to smile a bit but overall experience is good. Wed take the whole family next time üôÇüôÇüôÇ ‚Ä¶

Mamak is the go-to spot for authentic Malaysian cuisine in Melbourne! Their menu is packed with flavorful and fragrant dishes that will transport your taste buds straight to Malaysia. Whether you're a fan of satay skewers or spicy curries, there's something for everyone at Mamak. I highly recommend trying the roti canai - it's crispy, chewy, and perfect for dipping into their delicious sauces. Also morning glory stir fried and combination with the Tarik .The atmosphere at Mamak is always lively, with a bustling open kitchen and friendly staff who are happy to recommend dishes and make sure you have a great dining experience. If you're in Melbourne and craving Malaysian food, Mamak is the place to be!
Great food, service was good. The only thing they could improve is to have food coming at the same time or close to each other, apart from that great and recommend the place.
üëçüëçüëç

Cheap, Quick and Some decent flavours! Please do not expect amazing customer service. Here speed and customer turnaround is important. I recommend the famous roti canai and murtabak‚Ä¶good value for your money

do you like roti canai? then head to mamak, watch the cooks twirl the roti over their heads as you queue for the pillowy, crunchy roti. good stop also for awesome authentic malaysian food, but watch out for death by sugar in their tea tereks!
Very friendly and clean place with restrooms. I tried the canai roti, delicious. Also the kari ayam. Could have more vegies but they have kangkung. Can be pretty crowded at night.

If you know what to get, Mamak is great. And it even has my Malaysian father-in-law's approval!  Top choices include the roti (perfectly flaky with savoury and sweet curries/sambals for dipping), the teh tarik (fluffy yet strong tea with just enough sweetness), the rojak and the nasi lemak. The curries and fried noodles/rice are also tasty but didn't leave the same impression.  I don't even know how many times I've been here. And the food has been consistent throughout.

Mamak is our all time favourite, and we are frequent visitors. All dishes are tasty, Satay, Nasi goreng, Ikan curry are the best. We also tried roti Chennai and it tastes like what you will get in Malaysia. Mamak is truly Malaysian authentic taste :) and the best part it is halal!
The food was delicious and I recommend the Nasi Lemak!
Best Malaysian restaurant in Melbourne. Always so delicious.
Such delicious food, served promptly and at a good price. It‚Äôs a big noisy place with lots of action.

Really bad experience, don‚Äôt recommend going an hour or two before closing time. Staff are in a hurry to take the dishes for washing while eating. Cleaning and moping are done in-front of table whole eating and really really bad experience of dine in. Food was okay but not adequate quantity.
Best Satay in Melbourne
Delicious, authentic, well-priced Malaysian food.
Very rude customer service. Said will bring the menu when I said I am a foreigner without data service. Never did. Food was horrible.
The only fly in the ointment is the three-color beans in the fried rice.
Absolutely amazing Malaysian food. Their satay chicken, egg roti and teh tarik was heavenly. Will be back soon!
Food as always was amazing,never disappoints. Always a favourite and now has become favourite of friends.

We've eaten here at least four times and will be back for more! Our favourite dishes are the Acchiq chop and the lamb skewers. The noodles are really flavourful and the lamb skewers, juicy. We have also tried the braised eggplant (slightly sweeter) which was quite nice!

Halal restaurant where you can enjoy beef, chicken, lamb dishes full of flavour. The handmade noodles and skewers are a must try!! First time tried their homemade yoghurt drink - It was delicious! Reasonably priced with generous portions.  Friendly staff.  3 mnts away from Melbourne Central and 10mnts walk from Flinders. It was quite busy for a Thursday night so better book if you are heading on a weekend.

A mate took me here a few months ago, I didnt know what to expect, OMG this place was an eye opener in flavours. Delicious flavours and smell def must try! Good prices too, highly recommend. I had the lamb hotplate, special rice, lamb skewers and that package thing!
Lamb skewers are good but the minced beef in the buns are pretty dry. The noodles definitely needed to be eaten with a dish full of gravy
The lamb skewers are delicious and so succulent. It was my first time trying this cuisine and I‚Äôm very impressed! By far a great halal restaurant!
Everything with this place is fantastic the food was amazing and the service I could not complain it's a must have to try
The lamb skewer neither taste nor look like lamb but chicken mixed with pasta.

This has an authentic ugher food experience that is very different from the traditional Asian cuisine. You can tell the Turkic influence based on their menu. Their lamb skewers were the absolute best along with the dumplings. They were oozing with flavors that you won't find elsewhere. Highly recommended!

Checking on google the restaurants we knew were closed so we made the spontaneous decision to try this restaurant and it was definitely a great decision. The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, the service was very pleasant and last but not least the food was fantastic. We ordered the noodles requesting no meat for our kids just vegetables alongside few other meals including the dumplings. Everything was packed with flavour and cooked perfectly and the portions were quite generous also. The pricing was very reasonable considering the price of meals now a days. My 8 years old son was so satisfied and happy with the food that not only he asked me to write the review but made sure to share his thoughts with the staff and giving them an in person 5 stars! Will definitely be coming back again. Thank you :)
Excellent food. You can‚Äôt go wrong with any of their meals. Skewers are a must try. Not to mention halal as well.

The food is tasty. The waiter welcomed us warmly. The food portions were perfect, not too much and not small portions. Although the restaurant wasn‚Äôt spacious, it can serve/sits families and small groups.
Delicious dishes. The Ziq Kawap lamb skewers and the Gosh Nan pancake are our favourites. The stir fries are also pretty good.
Very exotic flavor, the mutton skewers are delicious, with Xinjiang Uyghur characteristics, and the strips are also very strong, a good food experience
If you can handle the spicy üî•ü•µ please ask for extra chilli for the kebab!!!!! It's amazing how hot it can be. Can't miss it!!! Ha ha ha ha

I loved eating here, and definitely will come back
This what I got for 16$ quantity that worth no more than 5$. Wasted time....

We went to this restaurant with no expectations. I guessed it would have elements of Turkish and Chinese cuisine. This is partly true. I reckon 80% of the dishes has lamb as its main protein. It was also pleasantly spicy. The spice palate seemed more Middle Eastern but many of the cooking techniques and ingredients were more classically Chinese such as stir frying and noodles. Overall the atmosphere and staff were pleasant. The ingredients seemed fresh and the finished dishes tasted balanced without being bland.

Great hospitality, friendly customer service and food is always very yummy and worth the commute! Have always been coming here and will continue to come when feeling like Uyghur. Highly recommend and won‚Äôt disappoint.
The food was delicious. My favourites were the lamb skewers, Gosh Nan, and Poshkal Qorumisi. The food came super quickly which is always a bonus!

This has been my favourite restaurant in Melbourne for a very long time. Food is authentic and delicious EVERY SINGLE TIME without fail. It's the first place I think of when I'm hungry in the city. 10/10
Sweet little bar x I will be back
Cute bar, nice vibe, great music and live music

Average experience, we had a group for a birthday looking to go up to the rooftop bar, we were told to sit at golden monkey as the rooftop was full, waited 30-45mins to finally be told that our group was too big. Very disappointing.  Only good thing I'd say is that the bartenders were great and made fancy shots for us.  I would've liked to have been told that our group was too big from the start so we could move on earlier instead of wasting time.

Amazing atmosphere and the staff is super friendly! Also food (steamed buns) I had were great too! I would recommend!
Bloody good vibes. Plus amazing house shot

You will love this hidden underground bar located at hardware lane in the city! Luckily we had a chance to enjoy a Thursday night live music session which is quite rare to find in the city, but @goldenmonkeybar is killing it. Serving beautiful potent cocktails and some scrumptious bao buns to keep the night going! Loved the cozy vibe here and warm service, and the live music sesh was a total mood add on.  We definitely had a blast!
Good fun... good DJ & music...intimate and lively.
Absolute bomb hidden nightspot in the CBD with some Asian inspired interior, cocktails and food! Live music on every Thursday too! üòçüé∂üî• ‚Ä¶

Great place to gather with friends! Good food, drinks and atmosphere (especially with their local band on Thursdays). Service is fantastic too, definitely recommended!  Be sure to follow @melbbites on Instagram for more recommendations ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Great vibe great cocktails
Nice bar for after work drinks

Great cocktails here! If you're looking for a bar that's a little more chilled out and the music is not crazy loud so you can actually hear what your friends are saying then it's a good choice

The service is good, the meal is fast, the waiting number is shouted, pay attention to it, it is fun, ordered the Wagyu udon-the shop is more beef and fried chicken cutlet rice, it is a mixture of Chinese and Japanese styles, taste In general, the price is good. Lovely staff, quick service, food is so yum.

Ordered Tempura udon. Tempura was warm, crispy and delicious at serving. The soup was slightly plain, but reasonable for the price. The staff who served me was nice, but she was the only person working. Fortunately I did not have to wait long, but my friend who ordered after me was not as lucky.

1 star for a good service Kimchi ‚ÄãBeef on rice - Kimchi had unusual strong smell, Beef was tasteless, and rice was mushy. And I got a stomachache afterwards. It may be because yesterday was an unusual hot autumn day.
Food ok, ordered take away and they put hot soup and noodle together in one container, not very smart! I asked and the lady behind the counter laughed!

Went yesterday and the food was average. My sister and I ordered the Chicken Katsu and Karage and we found there was a lot more rice to meat ratio which meant that we had a lot of rice left over. The salad was nice though. Also my brother got a ramen bowl with a clump of uncooked noodles in it which wasn't good. Definitely not the place it used to be! Previously they served meals in larger bowls with excellent sized portions. This used to be one of our regular takeout spots. Now food is only served in smaller takeaway bowls, likely due to the pandemic, but the quantities we received of Teriyaki Salmon on Rice and Udon Noodles on Sunday were laughable. Had to order lunch elsewhere afterwards. If you've shrunk your serving portions,- fine. But please don't charge the same prices for less than half of what you previously served! Disappointed. Won't be coming back.

Horrible experience compare to other Rice workshop!!  Order a large and regular, the main difference was box size! What‚Äôs inside was of the same quantity!!  The beef lacks taste! Their kimchi is horrible and extremely sour!
Very nice. Hubby had the angus beef bento and I had the grilled tofu.very pleased. Only one worker and very frendly and good customer service.  Was very busy but every one was patient and polite.

Was just walking along china town street (Lt Bourke) deciding what to eat. This looked great. And it was tastes good. Quick to prepare. And quite cheap. Good service.  We went at 2 pm do it was quite quiet.  The truffle potstickers was very moreish but 5 for 2 is always a bit awkward. It's a pity that you can't get an even number and pay the extra but maybe the computer billing can't cope. and very amazing üòç ‚Ä¶

Step on the big thunder the service is ok, the environment is good‚Ä¶but the food was like‚Ä¶indescribably so salty the Xiaolong Bao was ok but very pale the roasted duck instead is toooo salty‚Ä¶ and the kongbao tofu is very salty too, shouldn't the kongbao tofu be sweet... Best food can‚Äôt go wrong But order accordingly  Greens with chili and garlic Vegetables with noodles And prawn dumpling in peanut sauce Too good  2 people 3 dishers 1 coke 1 tea $74 and better then top Asian places I go

Went after the lunchtime rush for a very late lunch so was seated immediately. Easy ordering system through the QR code on each table. Good selection of shanghainese favourites. Had the hot sour soup noodles. Taste and texture was authentic and delicious! Mid range price point but on par with most similar restaurants in Melbourne CBD. Convenient location in Emporium and not long to walk to Melbourne Central station. Good option if you're after good Chinese food after a day of shopping
The most disgusting meal I have ever endured. It tasted as if the staff microwaved old socks and served it.
Great dumplings and pork belly. Great serice

Wonderful meal and very courteous staff. Would highly recommend

According to this place, the taste of Shanghai is... SALTY. The only person who would enjoy this much MSG is Uncle Roger. Copious amounts of tea were required to wash everything down, except there were no wait staff around. I had to serve my own family and collect extra crockery, take my teapot back to get more water and hunt for someone each time we needed something. Don't waste your time, this has to be one of the worst Chinese restaurants I've ever eaten at.

This is our family's go to dumpling place. With kids, parents and grandparents it has great access in the Emporium, cool atmosphere ( not overcrowded and squashed like some other place) and fast service (although not the most attentive staff) Pork dumplings are firm and juicy, and seafood dumpling's mouse texture has a great texture (much nicer than alot of other places). Soy and vinegar sauces compliment the dumplings nicely (some places they can be over powering). Favourites are Xiao Long Bao, Fried Pork Buns and Boiled Prawn dumplings. We've been going to New Shanghai/Shanghai taste since they started in Sydney and still go now as they are consistent in their dumplings.
Nice service! Foods are really yummy. One of my favorite restaurants in Melbourne Centre. Staff are nice and kind.
Food was decent but service was terrible. Food took over an hour to come at a non busy time and we had to ask three different waiters/waitresses to follow up. Wouldn't come back here.
I ordered takeaways, the food looks out of date and tastes even worse. üò± Can't believe how come they still run business. üò¨ Never ever recommend
I thought this was New Shanghai. It is not. It is now called Shanghai taste and the food is low quality.
Nice Dumplings

Eleven people had dinner here. I have been here with small groups ,5 & 6 diners in the past. Dishes are shared. Typically Shanghainese so not sure what to expect. With eleven diners, we ordered six dishes (can order more if needed). Each dish was double , so worked out more than enough. Restaurant closes at 7:00pm. so to eat comfortably, must arrive at 6:00pm. We split the bill and we were surprised it was so cheap. Definately will come back.
Very nice place~
Absolutely enjoyed the foods that we ordered! Best I've had so far compared to other Chinese restaurants I've been to in Brisbane, Sydney and Melbourne. Highly recommended.
yummy food, service was so good, staff were kind and helpful.  girl with tattoos on her arms was too sweet and told us about them, super cute. she knows who she is üòä

The service staff is really sweet but the food came very extremely slowly. Also, this is the blandest Japanese food I ever had. The food was not good at all.

What a place to eat, amazing customer service, clean, great atmosphere, the music and volume were perfect, food delivered to table on-time, very respectful and friendly staff, best quality food. All meals arrived hot, drinks were spot on. Definitely will come back many more times. Highly recommend this place to anyone who loves food. So far, my best ever restaurant experience.
Amazing food. The blonde girl who works there is nice, professional, with great customer service. Love it!!!
Amazing

Absolutely beautiful! Atmosphere, staff and most importantly the food ! Delicious would definitely recommend. The hot stone steak was such a great experience.

I've dined at Cookie multiple times, during the day, at night, etc. Unfortunately, compared to other 'scaled up' Thai restaurants, e.g. Longrain, and Sunda, Cookie is just not up to mark, with hit-or-miss food, order-at-the-bar service, plastic crockery etc., despite comparable pricing. That said, the staff are always kind and helpful. What Cookie does well is its drinks menu, which is much more diverse than other upscale Thai restaurants I've been to. Their flavour-pairing Daquiris are delicious, and trying different combinations is fun. I'd recommend going for a drink and snack with friends, and I'd advise sitting out on one of the outdoor terraces, as inside the restaurant can be pretty loud, and the view off Swanston street is nice!

Located in the bustling heart of Melbourne's CBD, this long-standing Vietnamese restaurant has been warming the hearts and bellies of both locals and tourists for years. Steeped in history and adorned with photographs of Asian celebrities who have graced its tables, it's no wonder this storied establishment has become a veritable institution in the city's culinary scene.  I ventured into this renowned eatery with great anticipation. True to its reputation, I was promptly presented with a steaming bowl of their signature pho noodle soup. The broth was fragrant, rich, and soothing - the perfect antidote to Melbourne's chilly winters. At $15.50 for a small bowl (May 2023), the price may seem steep, but the experience and ambience are worth the premium.  Beyond the pho, the restaurant offers a delightful selection of Vietnamese staples, including their generously-portioned spring rolls. At $19.50 for eight pieces, they may appear to be on the pricey side, but these delectable morsels are larger than your average spring roll, justifying the cost. Their size and satisfying crunch make them a worthy accompaniment to the meal.  However, for those seeking a more authentic and adventurous dining experience, it's worth noting that Melbourne's sprawling suburbs offer an array of hidden gems. If you're able to venture out to the Springvale area, you'll find a treasure trove of establishments serving up even more delectable pho dishes, bursting with flavor and authenticity.  In conclusion, this iconic restaurant in Melbourne's CBD is an ideal stop for tourists looking for a comforting, warm meal amidst the city's vibrant streets. With its rich history and notable clientele, it's a must-visit for those who appreciate both the culinary and cultural aspects of dining. But for pho connoisseurs seeking the ultimate bowl, a trip to the city's outskirts may prove to be an even more rewarding adventure.

Food is quite nice but the new booking system which requires a $40 deposit needs some work. On arrival, the hostess is trained to let you know that the deposit will be refunded at the counter. However, purchase is via the QR code app where the pay at the counter option is "cash only". Therefore, if you only have card and need to get your deposit refund, you will most likely select the credit card option. However, once you do this, you can't get your deposit back. You have to then email head office and try to get your deposit back which is a real screw around. Really unhappy with this and hope to get it back.

Tonight I decided to add something different and got the wagyu tataki but it was a massive disappointment. It was ice cold, extremely thinly sliced with NO sear on the edges and tasted of nothing but salt pepper and vinegar. It felt like it was sitting in the fridge for a long time and the fact that I received it 1 minute after placing the order confirms it was not made to order. For $17.90, it was a massive let down. Camy Shanghai Dumpling House is a popular Chinese restaurant located in the heart of Melbourne's CBD. Known for their delicious dumplings and authentic Shanghai-style cuisine, this restaurant is a favourite among locals and visitors alike. The restaurant has a casual and relaxed atmosphere, with traditional Chinese decor and furnishings. The menu features a variety of classic Chinese dishes, but the standout items are their steamed and pan-fried dumplings, which come in a variety of fillings such as pork, chicken, and vegetarian. In addition to the dumplings, Camy Shanghai Dumpling House also offers a range of other Shanghai-style dishes such as fried rice, stir-fried noodles, and hot pots. The food is always fresh and cooked to order, and the portion sizes are generous. The service at Camy Shanghai Dumpling House is efficient and friendly, with staff members happy to make recommendations for dishes and provide extra condiments if needed. The prices are also very reasonable, making this restaurant a great option for a casual lunch or dinner. Overall, Camy Shanghai Dumpling House is a must-visit for anyone looking to try some delicious Chinese dumplings and other Shanghai-style dishes in Melbourne.

Extremely disappointed in the service we "recieved" last weekend. We made a booking early that morning and we arrived 5 minutes early. We waited for our table and within 10 minutes the 4 of us were seated in a booth. But that was short lived as 20 minutes later, thinking they were coming to take our order, we instead were asked to move to allow a larger group to sit in the booth..... ? ... ok... No worries, we understand you want to cater for groups so we happily moved. Still ready and waiting to order now at our new table, we had to get the attention of staff as no one was serving us. Once we got the waitress attention, ordering seemed promising as she knew the item numbers by code and our drinks came out fairly prompt. We were then given 3 bowls for the 4 of us and told another was coming as we sat patiently awaiting out food. Not only did the 4th bowl not arrive, but as we watched new people be seated around us, it became more and more packed. We waited, waited... the new people were all being served before us, we even saw meals we had ordered, be served to those who had been seated 30 minutes after we had been! What was going on? We went to ask someone and were told someone would check. We never heard back and an hour passed with no food and no communication. Ridiculous! We had to leave hungry to get to our show and the waitress had the nerve to ask us to pay for drinks, 2 of which weren't even opened as we were waiting to have them with our non existent meals!! This place cannot handle the number of people they took on that night and no matter how patient or polite you are, trying to get any help or attention is pointless.

ORDERED: üç®‚Ää 61. Milk Snow Ice with Mango Jelly and Mango Juice with Popping Pearl üç®‚Ää 64. Milk Snow Ice with Red Bean, Pearl and Mango Pudding  These were $32.76 together!  REVIEW: Dessert story is an iconic institution in Melbourne. It's been around forever and its efficiency has never stopped. Bare bones, Dessert story will give you dessert and space with friends but nothing more.  The menu hasn't really changed over the years. The Milk Snow with Ice with mango jelly is still the best! It is lacking the additional flavour and wow factor that you get from its competitors in the Korean shaved ice space. But as a result of the lack of pizzazz, the desserts themselves are very affordable for the quantity.  Definitely more of a cheap spot for kick ons after dinner. The tables are cramped, and the plastic spoons and cutlery don't provide much focus on quality. There's no real table service, so you'll need to order at the counter and then they'll bring you the food to your little table number stand. The food comes out unbelievably fast too. Efficiency number 1.

Okay so this looks to be a marmite little joint, you either love it or loathe it. We might have been lucky tonight as all stars aligned, hence a 5* review. This place is fab for a late-ish night grub (say around 11pm, when most other venues are already shut). We've started with desserts, which were prima sort - really great HK style. Had #27, 41 and 83, all brill. Then the savory bites: ok maybe not the best in class, but certainly did the trick that night and hey, it's a Dessert story and not noodles or ramen or whatever. That said, hugely enjoyed the ü•öü•ö and dumplings, also no complaints about the chicken schnitzel (yes, served in a paper bag, but so what, the batter was actually very tasty). Good vibes about this place, still full of people, and staff were all smiles and quick to attend and serve food. It may depend on whose shift it is, but was really surprised to see that some folks complained about rudeness of staff. The team tonight were great üëç  All in all, really recommend for desserts or if you find yourself with an empty stomach after 10pm. Will be going back to go through some more items on the dessert menu.

Over the years we have eaten so much Japanese food‚Ä¶ many local and also in Japan. Mr Ramen San is so authentic and delicious. We all chose something different and none of it disappointed us. Washed down with a beer and it was so satisfying. They offer extra noodles free for those with a bigger appetite so save some of the broth and indulge in more.

Mr Ramen San is a small but cozy restaurant located in Melbourne's CBD, and it's a must-visit for any ramen lover in the city. The restaurant offers a selection of authentic Japanese ramen dishes, including pork, chicken, and vegetarian options, as well as sides and appetizers. The atmosphere of Mr Ramen San is welcoming and casual, with a minimalist d√©cor that emphasizes the focus on the food. The seating is communal, with large wooden tables and benches, which can create a convivial atmosphere as diners enjoy their meals. The star of the menu at Mr Ramen San is undoubtedly the ramen, which is cooked to perfection with an excellent balance of flavours. The pork broth is rich and savoury, and the noodles are chewy and flavourful. The toppings, such as the chashu pork and the soft-boiled egg, are also outstanding and add depth and complexity to the dish. Aside from ramen, the restaurant also offers delicious sides such as gyoza and edamame, as well as a selection of Japanese drinks including sake and Japanese beer. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, happy to help diners navigate the menu and provide recommendations. Overall, Mr Ramen San is a fantastic spot for a satisfying and authentic ramen experience in Melbourne. The prices are reasonable, the portions are generous, and the food is simply delicious. It's a great option for a quick lunch or a casual dinner, and the atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot to enjoy a hearty bowl of ramen with friends or family.

Been a loyal customer for the past 3 years. But I really don‚Äôt know what has happened to the broth. It‚Äôs so blend now, I come every time with the expectation that It has gotten better but just get disappointed. Wish they can get it back to the quality level they have always delivered.

Noodles and broth was very good.
Great quality food and their Cocktails are amazing and presented in unique glassware! A bit pricey, but you pay for the experience.

So we went here for my partners 40th birthday and we wanted to go there as it‚Äôs a fun experience and took my young boys as it was a good experience and something new for them. The staff were fantastic and very hospitable and happily took a cake I brought in I can not thank them enough for accommodating us and letting us stay back. So my partner selected this place as the food is what we love about this place so we wanted our family and friends to experience this as we had talked it up for a long time. Now the food itself was fantastic. However the lack of it is what has upset us to a point that we all felt hungry still and for 2 adults and 2 kids totalling $330 we definitely should not have been feeling hungry. Happy to pay for a great meal but we shouldn‚Äôt have the need to eat on the way home. The disappointment was our friends and family also felt the same. I believe that the kids meals which we had to Change to suit the kids tastes were just deleted and not replaced with the alternative selection we had made totally understand that if it was not in the price bracket of my expectations for premium service. Feel a little bit ripoff but I hope you guys will take in the right manner.
Great experience, tasty food and drinks or chef was friendly and entertaining!
Came with a big group. Staff were accommodating and super friendly but food was not worth the money you pay. Fried rice was dry and old, meat barley had flavour

Disclaimer: This is a review from a VEGAN/VEGETARIAN perspective. The meat eaters we were with enjoyed their experience. HOWEVER, we did not. We understood we were going to a meat based restaurant which is totally okay, however the fact that they offer a VEG SET MENU sets the premise that they will be able to cater for VEGETARIAN. This is not the case. We called before hand and were advised that Vegan was no issue and they would be happy to cater for us fully as per the VEG SET MENU. We were charged the full fee for the veg set menu. However we barely got anything as per the menu. None of our food was prepared in front of us so we were not paying for that experience either. We were not served Yasai Salad, Spring Roll or Fried Rice (These are three dishes stated on the VEG menu). We were given four puffs of tofu in soy sauce, a tiny portion of stir fry veg, we were given a bowl of 4 pieces of tempura veg with no sauce. It was all so disappointing. As I said we understood that it was a largely meat restaurant, but in our opinion a VEG MENU should not be offered (and for that price!) because you don't cater for us. We are a young couple with a new baby and it was our first night out away from our child and we had saved for that and were really upset with the cost for what we got and no experience. WE DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS FOR VEGETARIANS/VEGANS
Very professional, nice area.
Amazing place to eat. Bento sets r worth every penny! Been trying to figure out where they get the peanutbutter mochi.
Had the best experience here last night. Watching our chef cook and some fun games at the end. Food was delicious. Best experience ever

My partner and I came here for our anniversary recently and had an absolutely fantastic time. The food was cooked perfectly and contrary to the other reviews we found the amount of food/portion sizes very fair! The meat was cooked perfectly, so tender! The ‚Äúshow‚Äù and ‚Äútheatrics‚Äù were brilliant. The chef engaged with us and had us laughing out loud. Table service was great, the dirty plates were gone before you could even wipe your hands. The price isn‚Äôt cheap per head but when you factor in the entertainment for the night it‚Äôs well worth it for the experience, especially if it‚Äôs a special occasion.
Not a great experience.  We went for a birthday and not great service. The food was nice.

I have fond memories of eating at Ginza Teppanyaki as a teenager in the 90s.  Today we took the kids there for lunch.  The kids had a great time, and were entertained watching the chef. The food was great too. It was a good as I remembered.

Was this value for money? No, definitely not. Portion sizes were tiny and we left hungry.  Spent $130 for 2 small miso soups, 2 small rice, 1 lamb cutlet,  2 small serve of squid, half a salmon fillet, small serve of rocking fillet, 2 small serve of bean sprouts and 1 small steak fillet. The serving sizes were child size. The price is basically robbery.  I Don't recommend this place and won't be coming back.

Took my wife here for V-day and we had a lovely time. Our chef was friendly and happy to have a laugh, but cooked the food beautifully. More traditional style of Teppanyaki, and our table had a blast. Plenty of food so you won't leave hungry, and my wife got a token for the Candy Floss vending machine which was a nice touch (it's meant for kids haha). Would recommend.
Lots of fun!! Food and service was awesome!!
Great place and food‚Ä¶

Great experience with friends. Friendly staff, Food was great and the use of tablets for ordering makes it really easy to get drinks, service was instant which was impressive. 5 stars if they'd let us split the bill.

Went as a group of 12 for my partners birthday. Aiden the chef was very entertaining and put on a great show! The staff were very attentive. Highly reccomend :)
Good experience overall but not value for the high rates that are charged. The staff was very friendly though.

AVOID: Terrible food, paid $300 but not even worth $30. The waiters were good, but it seemed like the chef had no experience and was just trying to finish his shift. We left this restaurant feeling frustrated and unsatisfied.  It was really hard to get any service from our main server, wearing a white dress.  Our food took over 45 minutes to arrive. Upon receiving our order we noticed some things missing from the descriptions. We were told they weren't included in our package. Only when I pointed to them on the menu next to our selection, The server crumpily told the kitchen to go prepare, but still no apology or communication.  It also felt very overpriced and dry.  The only saving grace was that some of the other front of house staff were friendly.  We won't be back.
Excellent food and service! Definitely will come back soon!

The 4 people course set meal was so fulfilling. Meat was very fresh and tender. Staff gave amazing service, so polite and friendly. The seating wasn‚Äôt too comfortable, was a bit awkward getting in and out to go to the bathroom.

Went here for just a random Sunday night dinner. This place‚Äôs all you can eat has been on my list to try for a while. First of all, you need to know about the ‚Äòall you can eat‚Äô menu and ask for it because they don‚Äôt provide you with that menu when you sit down. The owner asked about any allergies and confirmed if we would like everything listed on the ‚Äòall you can eat‚Äô menu. We were not sure how the ‚Äòall you can eat‚Äô part worked or if we were allowed to order the listed items again because after ordering, the menu was taken away and everything just came out as if it was a set menu. It wasn‚Äôt until the end of our meal that a waitress came by and asked if we would like any more meat. This clarified that we were able to order more within the ‚Äòall you can eat‚Äô menu. Upon looking up the menu online after we finished our meal, we realised that were a number of dishes that weren‚Äôt served to us despite the owner confirming that we would like everything listed. Despite this debacle, it was a really delicious feed, nice experience and good atmosphere.

Lovely place to eat at - the quality of service was top tier. I spent my partner‚Äôs 30th here and we felt extremely welcome. The staff were accommodating and even though we sat beyond 2 hours of the all you can eat - they told us that we should still take our time and just enjoy the food. Best Cantonese late night seafood comfort food around! We‚Äôve tried quite a few dishes and all but one are nothing short of excellent. Don‚Äôt bother with the seafood tofu clay pot. Had a really great experience at Flower Drum!  Service was great, had a quiet dark atmosphere. Had the 6 course and the 5 course menu. I'd definitely revisit, but there was an insane amount of food. Perfect

I've read so much about the place which seems so highly recommended... But sadly, my conclusion is that it's overrated and subpar (to many other normal offerings overseas and epsecially those at the same price point).  Ultimately, I find it hard to justify visiting again due to the disappointment in expectations and the high price.  The food - the pekking duck was tasty, and I enjoyed the texture with the thicker and slightly chewy piece of meat compare to other places. The flavours were just right. (5/5).  The first taste of the soup in the large seafood dumpling with chicken both was great, but somehow the flavour didn't seem to last and the dumpling (with scallop and other nice things) could have been tastier (4.5/5). The pearl meat and crayfish omlette were quite good (4.5/5) but the portion sizes would only be a bit larger than normal fine dining.  The rest that we had (calamari, roast duck lotus leaf fried rice, sauted mushrooms, tofu) was hardly any better than other restaurants.  The service - in our experience, the high standard of service experienced by other visitors was just not found by us when we visited... (they seemed understaffed on a Monday evening and slightly overwhemled though the restaurant wasn't full).  I'm personally also not a fan of how dimmly lit the place was.  Concluding... Once again there was nothing exceptionally good to bring us back... The only thing exceptional was the high price for the quality of food and service provided (hence the 2 stars). There's so many other great places to eat at for maybe 1/4 of the price.

Really enjoyed the food. Worth the money spent. Food was very tasty. Prawn chives dumplings, lamb dish ( recommended by staff), mushroom dish , duck pancake and fried rice were ordered.good quality food made to perfection. Will come again. Would be great if you can improve on portion size.
Food and service perfect. A beautiful experience

The waiter was angry at us because we didn‚Äôt tips. What kind of service did you give. Terrible customer service ever. 1:No one top up the tea 2:the food was out on the serving table after one hour plus cooking time but still No one served for 5-8 mins. 3: our table waiter was missing at all time and other table waiter just ignored us. We got three person put our hands in the air for 5 mins. They still chose not to see us. This happen at least 5 times in 2 hours.  And the food. Omg. So bad. Where did you get the chef? 1: fired chicken not marinated. So blank. The skin of course is not crispy for sittingu at the serving table but not serving. The five spices salt(dips). No spice taste only too salty. 2: Wagyu beef. 100% not wagyu beef. You can tell by looking at it. Wagyu beef has the unique butter taste. And this is just normal steak. 3: Australia has the best lamb in the world. How did you cook the lamb chop without the gamey taste? 4: the bbq pork just food court standard with extra honey sauce on top. 5: the pearl meat is ok. Very average quality. Has a good flavour with right texture. 6: the pan fried fish can‚Äôt tell too much it‚Äôs too cold while I eat it. But still not too bad. 7: the fish noodles. Again can‚Äôt tell much. It was cold. But should be good if  it‚Äôs hot.

Love this exquisite place

Recommend the wantons in a chilli sauce and the crystal prawn dumplings and if you like a battered calamari then the salt and pepper squid is a great dish to indulge in fried food. best dumplings in the city. The bouncer, who was also our waitress downstairs, is from the old school. Snappy, military, but friendly. Turned away dozens of non-reserved guests while we ate.

Absolutely incredible dumplings! I didn't even know I could enjoy Dim Sum this much but the signature prawn dumplings may have changed my life. I would pass on the fried rice though. Brilliant feed before going to AAMI park on a Thursday night. Not too busy. My mate said his chicken Shnitty was the best meal he's ever had in his life. High praise.

We dropped in for an unplanned late Saturday lunch.   The staff managed to fit us in but our courses were delivered quickly one after the other as the kitchen was closing. tasty
