Shoya has a great environment and good service and the restaurant has a professional preparation for Japanese-style food. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for the lunch sets, especially the tempura and the green tea ice cream.
Quality food and service at a Melbourne institution. Always liked the food here.

Had an amazing experience here with my family! High quality food for reasonable price as I've had set menu for lunch. Thanks for friendly and lovely staff as well xx Such a shame that no one took a photo of any dishes as we were enjoying the moment, but everything was just perfect and we ended up so full hehe.

We were a party of four and we all had one of the ~$40 set lunch menus. Great experience overall! The decor is cozy, the staff are friendly and the food came quick. All the fish was fresh and quite filling. The matcha ice cream at the end was also very nice! Highly recommend!
Amazing service and delicious food Sashimi was fresh and taste delicious Couldn't fault any of our dishes Tempura wow!!! Thanks Shoya for the amazing food and service
250pp

Shoya tried to have a high price like Ishizuka and minamishima in Melbourne CBD during Valentine‚Äôs Day. I cannot see any seating privilege or attitude costing 250 dollars pp. The A5 Wagyu was really oily as the last main course. 250 pp deserves more. I am suggesting other restaurants if you have a budget of around 250pp. I was not feeling well and gonna puke about the oily fatty food. It feels like drinking oil. I couldn‚Äôt accept it and spit it out. Normally, the wagyu is acceptable for me in other restaurants. But it has unreasonable oily in one bite. If you are really fascinating on fatty food, I think this is a good place for experiencing. When I reported the problems, there were no solution.

This one is literally sooo good. Loved the otoro and the snapper. High quality fish but reasonably priced. Worth five stars. One thing is that I wish I got more rice lol, too much sashimi, not much rice.

The ambience in the restaurant makes you feel like you're eating in a Japanese restaurant in Japan. The food was excellent.. beautifully presented.. it looked exotic.. that I didn't want to ruin it by eating it. The taste was absolutely delicious.! If you're cravingJapanese food.. I recommend you to dine in here.

Good ramen, fast and friendly service Noodles tasted a bit gluten-y and the chashu was just roast pork. The place has issues with crowding. God help you if you want a Thursday night dinner there. Gyoza was very tasty and the broth is very flavoursome, though I found that there was nowhere near as much broth as I was hoping for. Menu customizing is a big plus
This ramen was so good I felt like I was on a episode of Naruto I almost went to fight Sasuke after finishing the plate
One of the best ramen in Melbourne!

Such rich and delicious broth! We had the fish taikei, which is the best fish ramen in town, and the black tonkotsu ramen - again a regular crowd favourite. Food quality was absolutely wonderful and never disappoints. Highly recommended!

Simple but delicious ramen. Service is efficient, you order using the QR code located at each table. Staff are always helpful. Can become crowded at peak times but the line alwaysovedls relatively quickly.
Best of the best ramen if your up for a quick bite! Xoxox
good experience , chicken is great
Wow I never was impressed with Ramen until now
Super flavourful broth, chicken karaage was also tasty and tender üòã toppings can get a bit pricy if you want a lot though
Really delicious & quick
I was disappointed that the chashu pork looked like a bunch of chopped up off-cuts but the overall flavour was good. Also, it's starting to get quite pricey for something where an egg isn't included.

Amazing ramen and gyoza. Reminded me of being back in Japan again. Staff were very nice. Can be very busy and more ideal to visit solo or as a duo, but not so much for bigger groups. Can be a wait at times, but I felt like it was worth it!
Best Ramen ‚ù§Ô∏è
Did not disappoint, 45 min wait in the cold was still worth it.
Dinner
It was said to be a famous ramen, so I tried it. The meat broth was delicious. The first bite was very good, but the longer I ate, the richer the meat broth felt. The chopped kelp? is delicious haha

Nice authentic ramen broth. Rich and creamy tonkotsu. Little pricey for what you get as a standard bowl. Dining experience was a little disappointing. Very crowded (elbow to elbow with strangers) on the bench and order via QR code with no staff interaction at all.

My favourite ramen in Melbourne. I‚Äôve tried all the ramen on their menu several times over the past few years. It is so good that I‚Äôm there almost every weekend. Flavour, consistency and quality 10/10
Very similar to Yilan ramen hahaha

First time visiting Hakata Gensuke, every time I come to Melbourne there are long lines outside this ramen joint but this time the line was a short wait. Once inside you are greeted by their lovely staff and are seated at your table. The restaurant uses a QR code to order and pay for your food. I ordered the signature tonkotsu and also I had the God Fire ramen and gyoza.  Tonkotsu was a very meaty broth and you can also add extras such as more seaweed and chashu. I had my noodles soft and this was definitely a delight, the ramen was very balanced and nothing was overpowering in this bowl.  The God Fire is their spicy ramen and I had it at level 2 and for chilli lovers it packs a punch but is still very enjoyable.  Their gyoza‚Äôs are made fresh and the filling inside was delicious, ordered 2 serves of this as we had to try another.  Definitely recommend for ramen lovers to visit Hakata Gensuke.
super nice
Average
food too inconsistent for this price point. Particularly the polenta that came with the main was completely unseasoned?? really weird mistake.
Impeccable!!
Love this restaurant especially the clams linguine.  Best clams this side of Sicily. Caio bella

Very disappointed considering the calibre of Resturant. Ordered the bistecca and had it arrive with no salsa verde. I questioned the waiter and he told me it was on top of the steak, trying to pull the wool over my eyes. He got unlucky because I happen to be in the industry and when a fluro green sauce is missing it‚Äôs hard to lie to a customer. This waiter also appeared to be on some form of narcotics to the point he nearly fell over onto our table. Then spoke to the lady in charge and she was not helpful. She confessed there was no salsa verde but proceeded to do nothing about the issue. Plenty of other ‚Äúnicer ‚Äú places in Melbourne .
Food, service and atmosphere were all fantastic and it was a great experience
A wonderful experience. From the moment you walk in the door and up the stairs to the moment you leave, this is fine a dining experience that is above all else. Never dissapointed when we go here.
A lovely place with great food and very friendly staff. The service is immaculate
What an amazing place to dine. Service and food was 5 star.
Best restaurant in cbd.

We had a pre theatre dinner in the Cellar Bar on a Saturday night and we certainly weren't disappointed. The wait staff exuded Italian professionalism, all impeccably dressed and quietly efficient. (Dropped knife off the table? Discretely picked up and replaced.) The food was well presented and everything from the tuna stuffed peppers to the ragu and the saltimbocca exactly as you would have expected. I can't wait to come back to Melbourne with more time on my hands so I can experience The Grill and Florentino.
Poor  quality food an atrocity to the history of the restaurant, but then again, synonymous with the self adulation of Guy Grossi. A very tragic conclusion to a Melbourne icon.
Had 3 courses which were delicious. 2 would have been substantial. Staff were friendly & professional. Never seen a wine list of this size. Would take a couple of hours to read it all.
Food was very nice and also the restaurant. I‚Äôm impressed with the variety of Italian wine here. Friendly staff

Let me start by saying, if you're a fan of Italian cuisine, you're in for a real treat. The food is simply out of this world! From the fresh and flavoursome dishes to the perfectly cooked meat options (I still don't know how these magicians create pork that melts in your mouth!), there's something for everyone on the menu. And, of course, we can't forget about the tiramisu - it's to die for! Trust me, you won't be disappointed.  But, it's not just the food that makes this place special - it's the atmosphere and the staff. From the moment you step inside, you're transported to a different world. The restaurant has a warm and inviting ambiance that makes you feel right at home. And, the staff - well, they're just fabulous! They're friendly, attentive, and always happy to go the extra mile to make sure you have the best experience possible.  Overall, I cannot recommend Florentino restaurant enough. It's truly a gem in the heart of Melbourne CBD. Whether you're looking for a romantic dinner for two, progressing a business relationship, or a catch up with friends over a delicious meal, this is the place to be. So go ahead, make a booking, and treat yourself to an amazing dining experience - you won't regret it!
Top restaurant, fine food, impeccable service! Modern and classy, this place is masterpiece.

Another Melbourne institution with timeless appeal. I have always loved the more informal bar / cafe area of Grossi Florentino. 2 lattes, and a lasagne with a glass of the French rose for $60. I spent a lovely couple of hours working and watching, whilst typical Melbourians (on the outside) were feeling the chill just to be seen üòÜ. Always a great vibe, with very attentive and beautifully manicured staff.
Such a great experience!

A stunning example of fine dining. A passionate team who have immense pride in their offer and ensuring a memorable experience for their diners. Huge congratulations to the entire team and a special thank you to Hamish. The food was incredible and demonstrated expertise and flair garnered from years of high end service delivery. Flavour, flare and theatre; joy in receiving the food offered to you; you could tell there was pride from those delivering the food. Nuanced service of the various courses was cherished by us during the evening; a marble topped cheese trolley shrouded in muslin cloth screening a stunning selection of fromage; zabaglione served to the table directly from the bespoke copper pot. Sublime. Highly recommend this as an experience to share.
It‚Äôs easy to be a star for a minute , but it takes effort to be a star for a long time.  Elegant dining and mature service.  For the sophisticated diner. Still highly recommended.
Great service and food at Grossi Florentino last night. The sensational Franco and his colleagues definitely looked after us and made us a smile along the way.

TL;TR Pretentious and overpriced bland food 3 stars or 5 stars depending on what you are up too. You want to impress a date with well groomed waiters, beautiful table settings and high prices. It‚Äôs 5 stars for you. If you like delicious food, and care about presentation, flavour balance ‚Ä¶. It is a 3 star review.
Excellent English style pub with great food and beer varieties. Recommended

I started going here a bit when I found they had two English ales on tap, which was great.  Once recently, the Old Speckled Hen I ordered was completely carbonated, and disgusting. I simply switched to the Hobgoblin they had on tap. This beer wasn't carbonated and was at cellar temperature, and tasted great.  The next time I went in, with a friend who wanted to try a real English ale, we were served the Hobgoblin ice cold, as it must have gone through the cooling system with the other beers on tap. I politely brought it up with the manager, who instantly stonewalled, claiming that 'the whole cellar is ice cold'. I have worked in plenty of pubs previously, and can tell you that that statement is a categorical lie.  1 star for being a British pub that's unable to serve English ale properly. Would give -5 if I could. Go to the Charles Dickens instead, if you like English ale.
Great place for a drink Good atmosphere.

Sadly, this place could be so good, but the service was dreadful, slowest bartender I've ever met and we were rudely told to move from where we were sitting, even though the place was not marked as reserved. Were not offered another place to sit, just told to move. Luckily when we went to the ground floor, some other customers offered us a place to sit... Stayed for one drink and went elsewhere... can't recommend this place at all.
I should have gone upstairs for a decent table. The little table wasn't cleaned.

I normally never give 1 star reviews but this place deserves 0. I advise you not to support this business at all. I came in without any acknowledgement from anyone at the bar. The ginger man with beard (apparently the manager called Sam) looked at me and then decided to serve the gentleman beside me, clearly knowing I was there first. At first I did not find an issue with this but when he finished serving him, glanced at me ( I was directly in front of him), then proceeded to serve the customers at the very end of the bar. I found his behaviour was so rude and discourteous, but, as a hospitality worker myself, I thought maybe he‚Äôs having a bad day and gave him the benefit of the doubt. It actually gets worse from then on.  My buzzer rang to collect food and when I came to the food collection counter, I was barely acknowledged at first and could see the servers eating chips and chatting around that area. Sam, without a word, rudely pointed the other side, I felt panicked and quietly picked up two dishes and placed them on the table. I realised I picked up the wrong dish and came back to the counter where I ordered. I apologised to the servers about taking the wrong dish but he said he couldn‚Äôt do anything about it. The manager asked what table number I was, found the docket and proceeded to slam the docket in front of my face. I looked at the docket and the server had put down the wrong order. I told the server I had clearly stated another item and he once again said it was up to the manager. I looked at the manager, he went to serve another customer through this dilemma, I felt so disrespected and upset, scared to argue back that I just took back the food. I asked my sister who was there with me when I placed the order, and she clearly stated that we had placed the correct order and the server had processed it wrong.  I didn‚Äôt touch that dish and had lost my appetite, I started crying and wondering why I felt so degraded. I have been a restaurant manager before and I understand that in hospitality it is important to simply acknowledge your customers with a ‚ÄòHi, how are you?‚Äô and attempt to find conflict resolution if something goes wrong on behalf of the hospitality team.  I was not at all rude and politely told them the order was processed wrong but it was the response by them that made me feel absolutely disgusted. In this case, I was happy to wait for my order to be made again but no attempt by management was made to fix the issue. I looked at other reviews about Sam, not showing respect for non white woman and wondered if it was race and/or sex that played into this, as I am a woman and a person of colour. I just couldn‚Äôt wrap around why someone would treat their paying customers with upmost disrespect and make them feel less than human. I strongly advise you to not continue supporting this business, my friend who has gone there for a long time was shocked about this as he personally knew Sam, and has mentioned to never come back. Such behaviour will get you losing new and loyal customers. I hope all staff at this venue rethink the way they treat people because their behaviour that night was appalling.
Had to stay quickly as service was slow amd we had to go to a show
I waited at the downstairs bar for 10 minutes, it was not busy but they would not serve me. I cannot recommend a bar that wont serve you.
Great service here.
Fantastic pub with a great atmosphere. Staff were very friendly and eager to help. The food was delicious and hot. Would definitely recommend pulling up a chair for a few hours.
The food was the best I've had .

Great place for a meet up with friends or work colleagues. Great selection of nice beers on tap and a decent menu from snacks to dinner. I would only say, the best thing they need to do is turn off the auto fragrance dispenser they have over the ground floor bar. Soon as you walk into the place it smells like a men's urinal cakes. It's fowl having to smell that whilst trying to enjoy the taste of food or beer.
only ducked in for a beer, but pretty decent spot
Great Irish bar with large, quality meals.
Good food and great atmosphere

Couldn't believe I was charged over $14 for 1 sticky date pudding with 1 dessert spoonful of ice-cream. Sticky date was stale and for the price I paid, really ripped off. I checked and re-checked the price was right and was met with cold replies of yes, correct price. Not a great experience at all.
Foods alright atmosphere well that depends on the day, the day of the week and time of.
Paid $19.22 for a pint
Great place
A wannabee English pub. Great service but something is missing.

We got charged nearly 33 dollars for 2 asahi schooners of beer absolutely highway robbery and the don't have lube on the bar to ease the pain and staff were average at best terrible experience don't go there
Really nice place to relax with friendly staff

This is my go to place for a quick lunch or dinner in the cdb or to fill in time waiting for a theatre show. ....much cheaper than the surrounding restaurants, and I usually enjoy the food more üòÅ Was particularly useful and yummy when Harry Potter and the cursed child played in 2 parts with a two hour wait inbetween each show. Whilest others lined up at nearby pubs and restaurants - I took advantage of this venue

Came in on 1st of May with two friends. Food was excellent and fresh. Staff were kind enough to remake part of my order, despite it being completely my error. Really appreciated the kind and accomodating service.
While we were eating, Yankee came and showed his face and choked. Crazy Delicious chicken and salad, friendly staff Vegan written on the bathroom wall

Ordered online, called to confirm location of pick up and it said the phone line was disconnected, went to the store and they said the order wants there, then called someone and said the order was re allocated to another restaurant, I asked where and they said they didn‚Äôt know so I asked them to find out and they said their manager would call, waited in total an hour and got no food, so terrible experience all round and no was to contact anyone by phone as there were no call staff or reception all numbers went to voicemail
Outstanding. Great food, wonderful service. I live in the CBD and Nandos at the top of Bourke St is one of my absolute favs.
Very busy for a Wednesday evening but food was great and service was fantastic
Lots of tables, quick service!
Best Nandos in the CBD.
Busy

Nandos used to be my favourite. Then they started making the portions smaller and smaller and I stopped going. I thought I'd give it a try again and it's even worse. My sons kid meal was the largest meal. Table was sticky, toilets had not been cleaned for ages. No toilet paper. Thanks for reminding me why I stopped going.
Unfriendly service,
The food was great. I'm rating 4 stars because they got my basting wrong. It was nothing I couldn't fix with the sauces available dining in.

A good Nando's restaurant. Well prepared chicken. Chips were nicely done. Helpful staff when we took home food we hadn't eaten. A favourite of many of my friends, so any easy choice for a quick group meal. Recommended.
Lovely service very polite staff, got a good vibe as soon as I entered the shop. Manager was very kind too.

Why is the piece of chicken at a chicken restaurant in a burger that costs almost $15 so small..? It's not even an entire chicken breast. It left me feeling ripped off and unsatisfied to say the least... This is the second burger I've bought there and it's happened both times (the previous time was even worse), so it's no mistake. They are clearly price gouging here. For that money, just go somewhere else if you want a decent meal that will fill you up. The service when ordering wasn't great either. I felt like I was bothering them just by giving them my order.
Not bad, typical Nando‚Äôs.  Could be cleaner.
The best Nandos outlet out of them all somehow. Food and chips seem to be always freshly cooked on the spot and hot.

Unexpectedly great. Banging house music banging dishes and banging cocktails. Our waitress was attentive and watchful and even brought some homemade ice scream for the birthday girl. Expensive but quite the experience! Will return. I am sure.

Dined here a couple of weeks ago, and we found the service was lacking. Not being pedantic, as we both have a decent tolerance for these things, but this was disappointing. The restaurant was 3/4 full but we struggled to get staff‚Äôs attention for ordering, they would walk by and not even look at the table to see if we needed anything. Ordered drinks whilst we continued to look over the food menu - however, the drinks had still not arrived when the food started coming to the table. Despite reminding staff we were waiting. No apologies, just got told ‚Äúthe bar is busy tonight‚Äù, like it should be our problem they are busy. Staff began clearing our dinner plates when we once again said we were waiting for our drinks, and they just so happened to arrive at that same time. Staff they joked, ‚Äúsee here they see!‚Äù. Not impressed. A little genuine acknowledgment they we were receiving ordinary service would‚Äôve gone a long way. Cocktails were tasty, but nothing exciting. Food was alright. But we were left with a bitter taste from how we were treated. Birthday dinner kinda ruined.
Great place, the food is fantastic, the drunken noodles and rendang roti are amazing. Great service, good vibe.
Delicious!
Nice selection of craft beer and good cocktails

Average tasting food, not horrible but not in line with the reputation Magic Mountain has. Food quality seems to be declining from late last year. Unfortunate as the menu has great options and good variety. Staff unwelcoming and unhappy. We felt like a nuisance to man who was serving us. The saving grace was that he did help us out when one dish was too spicy and he got the chef to add more coconut cream.

This place had feel good vibes from the moment we walked in. Staff were quick to get us seated and communicated efficiently between floors using a headset. The lady at the door was fantastic, she provided us the wait staff members name (Montanna) to meet at the top of the stairs. Every staff member we interacted with seemed genuinely happy to be there!  Montanna seated us and suggested a variety of choices from the menu, tailored to our request.  Every dish was presented immaculately and the flavours were iconic! The small plates came out within 15 minutes, the mains took a little longer (around 40mins later) however they were absolutely worth the wait.  We were pre-warned by friends about the amount of chilli used at this place - if you're not a fan of spicy food ensure you request to have the chilli toned down.

For this small establishment, the food is incredible Asian Fusion that will have a party going on in your mouth.staff are super friendly, but the food and cocktails are amazing. Thank you for the experience
Amazing service who gave us tips on what to order. Food was unreal.
Amazing food and heaps of vego options. Friendly and helpful staff. Definitely on my return list

I had lunch here a number of years ago and wanted to return because the food was great. The food was still great when we went for dinner: decent portions, flavoursome and saucy, and with a bit of a spicy kick.  However, there was more than one mishap which occurred during the night. - Waiter took our orders and all was correct when repeated back to us. But then we were given pork baos when we ordered the Peking duck rice pancakes; we had to send it back. We never received two of our dishes: fried chicken ribs and roti bread. Unfortunately we didn't realise until near the end when we just didn't bother. - There was a hair in my passion punch mocktail that I found while drinking through the straw and felt a strange strand go into my mouth. The waitress did take it back, refunded the drink and gave me a new one. - We received a cocktail drink that wasn't ours (Samantha Jones) but we did decided to keep it anyway. - When we received the bill, we had been charged for the roti bread that never came (the chicken ribs were not there) and there was a mistake with the drinks' portion.  Given it was a busy Saturday night, but this many mishaps has never happened before. It's unfortunate because we liked the food.
The service and the food are outstanding, I'll be back with more time to enjoy the place and other beers.  Strongly recommend to accept the spice options on your food, it has the perfect level
Fab city staple for thai fusion and the best spicy Marg I've had in a long while!!

This is a really funky restaurant that has three levels and a DJ. The menu has a great variety of dishes to choose from. I tried the pork belly bao buns which were so delicious and filling. I also had the duck noodles that had great flavour. My friends had the pad Thai and the fried chicken which were both great!

Food was delicious, cocktails were fantastic and the overall vibe of the venue was great. Only downside was that the bar staff kept forgetting our drinks but the wait staff definitely made up for it with their hospitality.

Will be back to try more dishes  Yeah Silken Tofu, Shiitake Mushroom & Star Anise Broth Sticky Pork Sticks & Shrimp Rice, Shredded Omelette, Apple & Mint Salad snapper sandwich Thai crepe cake  Nah Kale and crispy pork  Maybe Tofu red curry Black rice Pannacotta Pad Thai ‚Äì Rice Noodles, Egg, Pickled Turnip Garlic Chives & Peanuts - spicy Grilled Pork Belly, Poached Eggs, Daikon Croquettes & Smoked Tomato Relish + Fairy Toast - pork belly like sampgeopsal but daikon croquettes are good
Went to magic last night for dinner ! Thank you very Monty and chloe for the amazing service!! Love the food and drink .specially duck pancake , soft shell crab curry ! So good üëç
Very good service from all girls

Quality food and friendly staff helped us select incredible options based on our group's tastes and dietary requirements. Staff were very accommodating to move us to a booth upstairs halfway through our meal. Would highly reccomend this venue for parties and gatherings of all sizes!
Thomas was a great host and waiter, what a legend!

Booked for 8:30, arrived at 8:35 and was told they were still clearing/setting up our table and asked our group of 8 wait in the walkway. We waited until 9pm to be seated without any formal apology, kind of just treated us like it was normal to wait half an hour for a table we had booked for. If bao buns are $20+ on the menu I kind of expect that they'll come made and not require us to assemble them, bit disappointing. Thankfully they tasted nice, the pad Thai and salmon curry was lovely too.

Came here for dinner tonight with a couple of my colleagues and loved it! Service was great, staff were friendly, food tasted a treat, and great selection of drinks üëå Loved the calamari, chicken wings, and fat noodles. Will return, thanks guys!
One of Melbourne‚Äôs must eat-at restaurants. Awesome vibe, fantastic drinks and the food is just superb!
staff were friendly and helpful. we enjoyed all our food.
Recommend the brisket burger

Very hospitable and friendly even in a busy time. After I asked the chef whether or not I ordered sufficiently for my group, he said not to worry and if we need more he would send another extra dish free of charge and he did so which was very kind of him.

Me and my boyfriend went for dinner before comedy show last night and wow the service was incredible from the moment you walk in, the food was cooked to perfection, we got quit abit as we like to try everything and all of it was amazing ! Would highly recommend!

Great food, with great value and generous serving sizes. Genuine authentic American BBQ smoked meats and vegetables. Absolutely loved the pork ribs and even the corn ribs were surprisingly amazing. Easily the best corn I've ever had. I'm not a vegetarian but I found myself picking at my partners vegetarian dishes as they were shockingly good (for vegetarian options hahaha). Even the hot sauce selection was generous and tasted amazing!

Food was quite bland, needs seasoning (there was no salt or pepper on the table either). Meat came warm and not hot, so it quickly got cold. It would be better to serve it on a hot plate to keep the meat warm.

Always a winner here. The food is some of the best BBQ in Melbourne. The staff are great and I love that you just order at the table through the QR Code when YOU are ready and that avoids wait staff hovering. (I'm sure they love this too) Awesome rooftop area as well.  Highly recommended.
Came at 10pm and was closed
Great experience with such personal and welcoming service. Food was delicious but we couldn't get a photo as we ate it all! Lovely and creative drinks that were just as delicious. üòã
Awesome brisket!
Great food, quick service- would recommend to anyone in the area.

Loved this place! Incredible space and very cool vibe. Ribs were amazing and really good value. Great views as well from the window seats. Can‚Äôt rate it enough (except for the QR codes) but that‚Äôs just me! Will be back .
Great service and great food, corn bread is to die for. Overall great experience and reasonably priced.

We were so happy with our meal here! We are from the U.S. and were looking for good BBQ in Australia.  We definitely found it at Fancy Hank's!  The brisket was perfect and the ribs had an amazing crust on them.  We really liked the cornbread too! The service quality absolutely met the quality of the food as well.  We would totally recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good BBQ.
Ribs weren't quite flavorful and not tender. Possibly needed to cook for longer on lower heat.
Everything was great, the food was authentic and great service. I look forward to coming back
We had the premium platter and there was enough food for the 2 of us. Meat was perfectly cooked. Service was great so all in all we had a great time.
Phenomenal! Enourmas servings, brilliant service, food is just like I had in Tennessee and South Carolina. We also love the gorgeous 1930s ballroom its set in. Was worth the big drive from Warragul.
The worst thai food i ever had. My pork noodle soup is SWEET!? And my friend‚Äôs kway chap noodle is glutinous like goo. Disgusting. Please avoid at all cost.
One of the best authentic Thai in town!

I chanced on this little gem because most other restaurants were busy. I had a steamed barramundi and a  pork salad. I was amazed the authenticity and taste of their dishes.  It is similar to that of Thailand.  The dishes  were not loaded with sugar or extremely sour.  And from hearing patrons talking, there were actually Thai people there. That says much.
Great value and taken to thailand.
The Pad See Ew was amazing! So rich in flavour and wok hey. Really decent prices too!
Great authentic Thai food üòã
The duck skin was not roasted and was the wrong colour. Noodle had no taste. The pork and rice was nice and spicy. But the crispy pork skin is not that crispy and the pork was too little.

A real gem of an eatery! I've only been after business hours and would expect a wait when they're busy. The demographic of diners says it all: very popular indeed! Can recommend (#11) Kaow Soi Gai: a bowl of soft Thai noodles topped with fall-off-the-bone chicken pieces in a subtle but slightly sweet curry sauce topped with some crisp fried noodles. The spice heat creeps up on you, so western palates be warned!
Yum!!! Hands down best food court dishes! I am working my way around to try everything on the menu.
Superb
As the name says it all...one of the best Thai in melb city! We had the sticky rice pork skewers ($15) and fish soup egg set ($17)
People rude,taste horrible, slow service ,never never go again
Small Thai kiosk in the food court with an authentic Thai flavor. There are too many Thai dishes to try if you love Thai food. Not a fancy place but the taste and the price is good
Great and caring service. Made a special soup for me.

Yummiest Creamy Tom Yum noodle soup I‚Äôve had in Melbourne so far. Have been here consecutively for 3 weeks already! It‚Äôs so good that though each time I come I wanted to try other dishes but ended up ordering the same dish!  My husband ordered the fried rice today. On the sweeter side but still very tasty.Large portion. Waited a bit during lunch peak but it‚Äôs worth the wait. Very reasonably priced. Loved the old-school food court atmosphere too

I do love this shop and I've been loyal to it it for years.  However, some dishes could definitely be more authentic though.  Yet on the other hand, they have some of the best dishes that are hard to find anywhere else.  People love this place though and it's super busy.  Especially when the Thai students are in town!  I think I first discovered this place in 2019 when I was working at The Meating House.  Their Nam Tok has always been good.  Some other dishes you'll find that are interesting are things like Kanom Jeem Nam Ya.  A really nice turmeric fish ball noodle.  The boat noodle and Tom Yum fried rice is popular with the Thai diaspora.  I've seen khao kluk kappi on the menu too.  The service is generally fast, just understand that it's a busy food court though and your patience is appreciated.  Especially during these difficult times for hospo.  This isn't Bain Marie style like the other places and everything is cooked fresh.  If you live in the city, try some Isaan dishes here.  Keep up the great work.

Getting more expensive now.  Price hiked three times in the last 12 months.  Not worth for food court meals to be honest.  Hard to find seats during peak lunch hour in the food court too if dined alone.
Food court, taste is good, cheap and quantity!
We ordered 2 types of fried rice : the chicken and the mackerel fried rice.  They were quite nice but just be careful if you order the mackerel fried rice as there are fish bones in it.
Delicious, cheap, Thai flavors, various menus

Hidden in the Paramount Food Court but it's always busy. Decided to try.  Ordered 2 items: 1. Tom Yum Noodles with Pork. Flavourful broth with plenty of toppings. Huge portion, good value for money. 2. Chili Basil with minced pork. It tastes alright and comes with a runny f ried egg, which is always welcome.  Overall, it's a good place to have pretty authentic Thai food.
Like Tom yum noodle here

Stumbled across this place when a couple of our Thai options had long queues - located in an obscure little known food court in the Paramount basement.  Seeing families and small groups of Thai descend ordering from this stall, we settled on trying this place.  The person at the stall was very helpful in suggesting items we should order after asking what our preferences were and the spice levels we were comfortable with.  Ordered Number 17 - Chinese Broccoli with Crispy Pork and Rice, Deep Fried Tilapia and Rice with Original sauce and Som Tum Green Papaya Salad.  The crispy pork dish was very tasty but had some raw egg white in the fried egg, nice runny yolk though. The fish was crispy and well seasoned, went well with the sauce but the sauce did not taste great on its own. The papaya salad tasted as it did in Thailand and they did put the mortar and pestle to it.  The above were more like a local home cooked Thai food, no frills as you‚Äôd expect at a local food stall in Thailand but tasty and well priced. Portion size reasonable.  Be prepared to wait about 15 mins for the fish. Our order was ready all at the same time.

Who said you cannot find #authentic #goodfood in #foodcourt üòÅ this place is my to go lunch spot.  Thai boat noodle 5/5 üçú Oyster omelette 4/5 üçú They also have #deepfriendbanana #deepfriedsweetpotato - it is also pretty good - Rating 4/ 5üçú  Must try #thaifood #thaifoodinmelbourne #thaicuisine #thaiboatnoodle #melbournefoodie #melbournegoodfood #melbournefoodlover #foodieinmelbourne #chopsticksjourney

Located in a Paramount Food Court. The food didn‚Äôt take long at lunch time but I was there just before people queued up tho. The stir fried crispy pork with kale was delicious. Papaya salad tastes like they mixed the sauce with vegetables instead of cooking it with mortar like traditional Thai way.

We had a family dinner celebration here and I must say ‚Äòwow‚Äô. The food and flavours was delicious, decor is beautiful and the customer service was outstanding. Excellent job team and we will be definitely be coming back for 2nd round!
Excellent place for a steak, the atmosphere was excellent. There service was also top notch. Would like a bit more traditional Argentinan food to be served with there excellent steaks.
This place was on my list for a long time and lived up to the expectation. Entrees were the favorite. We could have split one steak for extra entrees but it was all great.

Had a such good moment that I even forgot my phone away e didn‚Äôt take any pictures. But food is impeccable, great wine selection, authentic atmosphere, but no doubt the best thing about San Telmo is its friendly and lovely staff. I can‚Äôt wait to come back for more Asado de tiras, alfajores and Malbecs!
Great selection of wine. The wait staff was incredibly friendly and very knowledgeable about the wine list and food menu. Would highly recommend!
Best steak in Melbourne. Rib eye is my favourite. Great customer service by all the waiter and waitresses, especially by a young lady , Adonia. Superb customer service level. Highly reccomended
Another great recommendation from Bob Champion‚Ä¶if only I was sharing the Hanger steak and char grilled beans with James Maurice Vedelago ü•∫ ‚Ä¶
Amazing staff and A+ food. All the atmosphere was great.

We had booked outside but the team managed to get us inside with only a 20 minute wait. Really appreciated it as it added to the ambiance. We did the mid ramge set menu and it was amazing, Empanadas were on point, Cervice was delicious.  Chimmichurri + rib eye was great and the lamb was an unexpected highlight. Great selection of Malbec's and comprehensive cocktail and wine list. Had a sour cocktail which was nice but could have been a little more sour. Would definitely recommend San Telmo and it will be a guaranteed visit for me each time I'm in the city.
Had an amazing date night dinner here at San Telmo. The steak was the best we have had in Melbourne. Can't wait to come back again soon.
Surprisingly nice restaurant for full Argentinian experience. Good meat well cooked
What a fantastic meal. We dropped in, without a booking, and were looked after beautifully. The service was excellent and the food was exceptional. Thank you

May 2023 - I have been wanting to come back just to have the pork jowl again. It was a life changing dish. It is my favourite dish of any restaurant from all countries I have travelled. The steak was also mind-blowingly delicious and pared perfectly with the Malbec that was recommended by the staff. There was nothing I could fault for this whole experience. The prices reflected the quality and I felt I got value for money. (And I can be quite frugal)  Approx 2019 - The food had so much flavor and was done perfectly. I would recommend this place for sure.

Exceptional service, amazing food and wine - all in a perfectly lit, relaxed-yet-kinda-fancy setting with great energy. I highly recommend whatever specials they have - especially steak-related! I‚Äôll be back for sure.
The personal attention was great, the food delicious, so was the wine. They respected a voucher that had expired last month, I could not fault them on anything.

American steak house, Australian beef, Argentinian cooking. The last time I ate before boarding the plane in Melbourne, I thought it was a good taste, so this time I went to Melbourne to bring friends to eat again. I had to wait for more than 30 minutes because I didn't make a reservation the day before, so I didn't wait, so I didn't have to wait for lunch today. Lucky lottery did not disappoint my friends, but the consumption is a little bit expensive
Excellent lunch, attentive and professional service. Great all round experience

We had a team dinner here after a property shoot, we were lucky enough to get a table as a walk in, on a shared table which happened to be in a private space.  Service was incredible, had a really good experience with (Sut), food was even better, we had the striploin and wagyu, well cooked and lots of flavour, doesn't need to be paired up with sauce.  Striploin: balance and cooked medium rare, the balance in fat and meat was rich in flavour, we preffered this over the wagyu,  Wagyu: very lean, lot of flavour with a more leather like texture ( wasn't the house favourite but it was still an experience)  Raw fish with coconut milk was divine, lots of flavour as an entrees,  Black sausage something different thats for sure, flavour was great.  Tartar paired with the home made chips was incredible.  Dessert: Flan was easily one of the best I've ever had, it was paired with cashews and toffee, incredible.  Reasonably priced too.
Been twice now. Very consistent!
Best steak + best customer service had in a while!
Great vibe, food and service!

First time visit San Telmo, experience the delicious food with quality of service so will definitely come again. We was rushed for movie so we missed dessert. Will share how the dessert are in the futureüòâ  Highly recommend the steak here, because the good food take time to cook, visitors could come early when they not that hungry or oder some lovely entree. Outdoor seat also available if you like to enjoy sunshine while tasting food. Wine and mock tail are both great. Definitely worth to give it a try üëçüëçüëç
First time here! Everything was so yum!!
Bottega never disappoints. My last visit was with 19 of my closest friends, each of whom was very happy.

I ordered the pan seared Dory fillets, it was probably one of the worst fish dishes I‚Äôve ever eaten, tasted like they had microwave the ones you buy in the box at Coles. It was very small. Partner ordered the Lamb. Whilst the meat was delicious way too much fat. Very disappointing. The only positive was the duck ravioli. We won‚Äôt be back üëé

One of the best beef carpaccios I have had for many years. I would come back and order this for starter, secondi and dolce! Lunch with old foodie friends. Followed up with Porcini risotto - seasonal Victorian mushrooms, black garlic + 30 month Parmigiano Reggiano, 250gm flat iron steak ‚Äì (Gippsland, pasture fed, MBS2+), Mediterranean herb butter, rucola + aceto balsamico. The young waiter just here from Italy was friendly, knowledgeable and engaging - great service!
Had an incredible experience at Bottega, staff were professional and on point ! Will be returning very soon :)
booked for a business Lunch, Service was on point, staff were discreet and proffesional - Food was fantastic

Staff - 10/10 our waiter was amazing and tantative. Food - 6.7/10 we expected alot more after reading many good reviews but found the food very average and lacked alot of flavour. There are many better Italian restaurants within the vicinity.

Wagyu and kingfish entrees were nice, mains Moreton Bay bug pasta (before I even had a bite I could smell the fishy off seafood, pasta was not Al Dente) duck ravioli was nice, as the ragu and The dory. Disappointing steak. Missing 2 stars due to one of the dishes not being fresh and the way our table was arranged my chair was seated infront of another table and everytime the staff had to go behind me it was a struggle for the staff to try their best not to nudge me each time.
Very nice dining experience. Super friendly and attentive waiting staff. Food is amazing, every course is spot on.
Food was amazing, wagyu carpaccio was outstanding! Service was excellent, especially Ellen, thanks for a wonderful experienc.

Best place for pre-theatre dinner in Melbourne by far. My wife and I have eaten at Bottega probably 20 times over the last few years and we have never been disappointed. The staff are all great and always remember our preferred table (thank you!), the food is consistently amazing and the pre-theatre menu is amazing value! Can't wait to come back :)
Fantastic lunch. Only criticism is that the booth bench is very uncomfortable after 1hr.
Thanks Axel for the hazelnut dressing tips. Carpaccio was amazing, staff are super, wine list fab
The food is absolutely delicious, staff is very attentive. I cannot wait to go back.
Food was average but the service made up for it. We had a great time celebrating a friend's birthday!
Great atmosphere and food for our anniversary celebration
I chose Bottega restaurant because of its booth seating so easy to have a conversation with friends I'm with.
Great restaurant, food was lovely and the service was excellent

Service was friendly and attentive. Good selection of drinks. Disappointed by the quality of the food for the price. The pasta itself was overcooked, and the ragu tasted dry. Other items either lacked salt, or had too much salt (the croquettes for example, while tasty, really needed some sort of accompanyment to offset how salty they were).

Bottega is back! A very satisfying dining experience with beautifully presented food that is well balanced and delicious. Service is friendly and efficient. A very enjoyable evening. The pre-theatre service was not too rushed, but pleasantly paced. (As it sometimes can be). We will be back!
The quality of the food an service were unquestionable
I had an amazing San Valentin night üåô. The food was amazing, but the fish omg! Yummy üòã. I 100% will be back.
Dined in for lunch with everything being absolutely delightful from start to finish. We had the lovely Katarina and Hannah serving us which was the cherry on top of a beautiful lunch ü´∂üèª ‚Ä¶
Had lunch at Bottega, food and service were both exceptional! The Wagyu carpaccio in particular was a favourite, look forward to returning in the future.

Had dinner last night on the spare of the moment it was very busy and the staff fit us in and serve our table super fast so we could leave and see a show we had book food was fantastic .staff was  amazing A+++++  thankyou we will be  back again for sure
This place is cool. Great cozy vibe and fast service before a show at the theatre. staff were great, marinara spaghetti was awesome ü§åüëå
Delicious food and great service! Big pasta portions too.

We were upstairs and enjoyed the entertainment themed walls. They were busy as entree arrived before drinks. Everyone enjoyed their meals and pricing was reasonable. They cater for the theatre crowd understanding needing to get in and have meals served promptly.

Really lovely dining experience in an older restaurant. Everyone enjoyed their dinner and drinks. Personal favourite was the Veal scallopini. Can't talk to the desserts as they failed to ask us if we wanted any! Other than that the service was fine. Would still go back as the entertainment was fun and food was great.
Best lasagna, fabulous tirimisu.

To their credit, the staff were very kind to accept my partner and me for dine-in dinner, less than an hour before close. Thank you.  Fish of the day was good, my partner really enjoyed it. Polenta chips were good but smothered in parmesan cheese so unfortunately it overpowered the chips. Carbonara wasn‚Äôt great, the pasta was a bit rubbery and the sauce needed more flavour.  Customer service was good, although I was confused and annoyed by the waitress who served our mains and didn‚Äôt clear the empty plate on the table from our entree. None of the other waiters walking past cleared it either.  The space is tacky and outdated. There‚Äôs some great original features but the carpet and lighting need updating.  You don‚Äôt get the experience that you would expect for the prices they charge.  Staff all asked us how our food was, but we didn‚Äôt feel comfortable giving an honest answer to their face. If they would like honest feedback it would be best to give customers a QR code they can use to leave anonymous feedback.  Overall, good staff but I wouldn‚Äôt go back unless I was stuck with limited options.
Enjoyed a lovely meal with friends

What a beautiful welcoming atmosphere, as soon as you enter the spaghetti tree you are overwhelmed by the beauty, from the smells from the kitchen to the live music playing and just the general buzz of a busy restaurant. We have eaten here a few times, and this evening, we were seated upstairs above the beautiful gentleman playing the piano. It was our first time upstairs, and it was lovely upstairs with lots of photos and old posters of shows past to take in. I did feel we were forgotten about upstairs, which would be the only reason for giving only 4 stars on service. We had the lasagne and the chicken parmigiana both were absolutely delicious üòã  we had hoped to eat dessert also, but there was definitely no room after the generous serving sizes. I even had to take half of my parma home with me! The schnitzel was crumbed with panko crumbs, and it would have to be the most amazing crunchy schnitzel I have ever had the pleasure of eating. Highly recommend the spaghetti tree perfect for any occasion or just to grab dinner before seeing a show. But always book ahead as they do get very busy. However, if you do pop in on a whim, they can seat you at the bar to have a cocktail while you wait for a table. Big love to the spaghetti tree

First time visiting.  Firstly the service: - was at times a little disjointed with multiple waitpersons asking same questions - little things like not offering ground pepper with mains - forgetting one item. - waiter when we enquired ‚Äúis the children‚Äôs fish battered?‚Äù, seem to diligently go to the kitchen to check, returning and advising it is not battered.  Only to have it arrived battered (which our little boy will not eat). All of these very forgivable. Secondly, food quality / quantity: We have veal / prawns and a spaghetti dish for adults, fish for little one - veal was well sized and delicious- only negative was luke warm - other mains were delicious and plentiful.  Desserts were delightful!  Overall - we would return
Great food and friendly staff. Just as I remembered it
What a fantastic place. The food and atmosphere were amazing as well as the live music.

Excellent food and service as per their usual high standard, and live music being played. My go to Melbourne restaurant for any relaxed but still fancy dinner. Plus, very accommodating to the theatres nearby.

Haven't had a chance to try this restaurant before - my loss! Atmosphere great, food so yummy, and service +++ Outside seating/service available. Summation: Hungary, go in and eat to your heart's content!
A great place to eat
Excellent. Great food. Great service. Interesting building and decor. Can‚Äôt fault.

Amazing comfort food, but restaurant quality. The service is always so attentive and ask if you need to hurry your orders to make a show/theatre time. Delicious! Highly recommend! Will always go back!
Always been the best place to eat in the city. Everyone is friendly and kind. Great service and wonderful food that really hits the spot.
Always a pleasure to eat here. Great food and service that is perfect for a pre-theatre meal.
Service amazing, generous serve but quality missed the mark
One of Melbournes iconic places to visit. It's a must do. Top of the mall always busy.
Extraordinary night out! I give five stars üåü  based on its amazing dishes, Seafood Spaghetti Marinara, and, Ricotta & Spinach Ravioly üòã, and, of course, the authentic lemon granita.

Coffees and bleuberry tart 'stile italiano' at Pellegrinis, Melbournes oldest (and first in the 50s) bar style cofffee shop on bourke st. Still the old italian cafe atmosphere down to the staff.  The late 'lunchers' appeared to relish their pastas!
Best coffee in Melbourne... big statement for sure on a highly subjective topic but...... you will not find a better long black
Gorgeous!!
The church of Pellegrini, a must visit
Real Italian lunch break in Melbourne!!! Tastes of home!!!
The place and atmosphere was really nice but they don't have much vegetarian option.
Damn fine berry pie
Great coffee

Love coming here when ever I‚Äôm in Melbourne. Absolute must for any Melbourne food tour. Always try and sit in the kitchen when I visit here. Staff are always so friendly and enjoy talking to you. Food is incredible. I love the lasagna. My go to dish when I come here.
The best coffee in town
Must stop when in Melbourne. The friendliest staff and best ambience.  Come for dinner and dessert

Exceptional service and beautiful coffee. Thank you.
Such a good spot. Real authentic italian vibe. Great coffee and granita! Food is very decent. Staff is just wonderful

Classic Melbourne staple.  I‚Äôve been coming here for years. This week I decided to try them in the same week during the week and weekend and document the differences.  Been here twice in the last week. The lasagna was incredible the first time I visited. (On a Tuesday night - still busy but no line) came to our bar table within 10mins  I got the rigatoni the second time (on a Saturday night, line out the door) and it was mixed with penne ‚Ä¶ so I guess you‚Äôd get rigatoni if you ordered penne too lol.  On the Saturday night they forgot our order and it also was Luke warm when it eventually arrived after 25 mins, I know not long for usual restaurants but slow for their usual service.  The toilet is out on the side at and around the back of the kitchen. Definitely don‚Äôt bother asking for anything special, what you see is what you get and it is how it is vibes.  Not wheelchair accessible unless you eat outside and don‚Äôt need to use the bathroom. This is a melb classic, worth it for a middle week corporate quick lunch or after work dinner with mates. Don‚Äôt bother on the weekends- too many tourists flocking
The spaghetti and meatballs is one giant meatball.  I  L O V E  I T .

I finally manage to dine in one of Melbourne's classic Italian restaurants which its reputation is undoubtable. Well-known with its first espresso machine in town, this place also serves variety of incredible pasta. There are not many selections of menu, however, they serve only the best. Not only the pasta, there is dessert options available.  Discuss with the staff is recommended for a first timer. They will be able to guide you with the order, which a portion of a lasagna and a portion of a spaghetti carbonara were suggested. We will be served a piece of in house made bread and butter prior to have the meals. All the pastas I have are flavourly tasty. The classic carbonara is a top notch, and the classic ragu lasagna was amazing.  It is perfectly cooked and served warm. The portion and the price are very decent. I, definitely would be delightful to come back and try other menus. Although there is a waitlist to get in, this place serves the food relatively quick.
Love this place. An iconic eatery that reminds me of when things were simple. Great pasta, cakes and coffee. Thank you, don't ever change.
Been going here for decades, never disappoints.  I love how they're not renovating and waiting for it to come back in style.  Their pasta is the best!  Rose is their secret weapon! 10 out of 10.
Great food and service.

Three of us came to Pellegrini‚Äôs Espresso Bar on a Friday night for dinner. We ordered the fettuccine carbonara, ravioli amatriciana and spaghetti bolognaise (pictures included) as well as the watermelon crush drink. Food was tasty, service was excellent, and vibes were bustling and vibrant. I‚Äôll be sure to stop by next time I‚Äôm in the area and craving a delicious Italian pasta. Thanks for a good time Pellegrini‚Äôs!

A casual and warm shop~ It has a history full of feelings~ The food is simple, rough and delicious~ My husband said that he has eaten this shop for 30 years~ He regrets what happened to his grandfather when he was abroad and he couldn't come back~ He felt sadüòñ He said that he often has lunch and coffee here alone~ the grandfather is very interesting and helpful~ The customer sitting behind me brought his granddaughter to drink coffee and told the granddaughter the history of this store. The place to start helping! Really great, I like this store very much!
Great spot for some low-key pizza and drinks

When I visited Australia, I went looking for a place to get a slice of pizza. Little did I know that‚Äôs not really a thing in Australia. But then I found this place‚Ä¶ AND THEY HAVE LEGIT PIZZA!!! It was seriously a small taste of home for me. If you‚Äôre looking for a slice of New York style pizza, this is the place to get one. Next time I‚Äôm in Melbourne, I‚Äôm 100% gonna head back for a slice.
Great pizza, great bar. Well done!
My mushroom pizza was kinda dry but my friend's slice of vegetarian was apparently quite good. Not bad if you're on the run.
An intriguing spot offering quite an above-average experience, but seating needs looking into in general.

Really cool hidden bar in the back where you can order drinks and food. I had 3 slices of pizza, and really enjoyed the chorizo. The cheese and pepperoni were quite average.  Music was a bit too loud if you wanna chit chat but that‚Äôs the vibe.
Love love love. Best walk up slice I've had. Thin and delicious crust, quality toppings

The person at the door that was dishing  up takeaway pizza with a large side of bad attitude on Wed 29/03 at 10.10pm had the most vulgar attitude and should rethink their suitability to work in the service industry.

Pizza Pizza Pizza hidden bar is a cozy little spot in Melbourne that serves up delicious pizzas and drinks. The atmosphere is laid-back and intimate, with dim lighting and a speakeasy vibe. The pizzas are the star of the show here, with a range of creative toppings and crispy, thin crusts that are cooked to perfection in a wood-fired oven.  The drinks, on the other hand, are just okay. While they have a decent selection of cocktails and beers, they're not particularly memorable or outstanding. That being said, the prices are reasonable and the service is friendly and attentive.  Overall, I would recommend Pizza Pizza Pizza hidden bar for its tasty pizzas and cozy atmosphere. However, if you're looking for exceptional drinks, you may want to look elsewhere.
5 dollars for 1 pizza slice üçï ü•∞ ‚Ä¶
5 Starts for the name, the owners must be a fan of Strangers with Candy
Good food..Tasty..
Gorgeous!

Looking for a drink that will transport you to a realm of royalty? Head over to Pizza Pizza Pizza and order the Elder Side! This majestic libation will have you feeling like the queen (or king) of the castle in no time.  As you're handed a glass of the Elder Side, you'll feel like you've been whisked away to a world of magic and enchantment. The presentation is a sight to behold, with a fresh sprig of greenery delicately resting atop the drink, making it look like it was plucked straight from a secret garden. The glass itself is a work of art and adds to the enchanting experience of sipping on the Elder Side.  With each sip, your taste buds will be transported to a realm of pure bliss. The flavors are carefully crafted and perfectly balanced, providing a delightful combination of sourness and tartness that will leave you wanting more. The Elder Side at Pizza Pizza Pizza is like a grown-up version of a childhood favorite, taking you on a journey of nostalgic memories with every sip.  This is the perfect drink to enjoy in the company of friends or while lost in your phone. The atmosphere of Pizza Pizza Pizza is the perfect complement to the Elder Side, making it the ideal spot for an enchanted evening out.
Hidden away, this little joint does possibly the best pizza in inner city Melbourne.

Lovely little pizza place, they offer take-away. But there is also a hidden bar/restaurant in the back...  Great large pizza'süçï, juices, and mocktails (without alcohol)..  Excellent staff members: very capable and knowledgeable in their work!  Please make sure to visit whenever you are in the CBD...
Sorry, the pizza didn't have flavor, the place is a bit weird.
Fun place with nice pizza
Always a great place for cocktails! Pizzas smelled and looked good but we didn't eat.

Great spot, cool vibe and good drinks. These are the only good things about this place. The staff service was absolutely abysmal, firstly we were refused a vacant booth seating despite having more people than what their couch seating could comfortably accommodate. Secondly, attempting to order further drinks was near impossible to the point where we had to approach the bar even though it‚Äôs ‚Äútable service‚Äù. Thirdly, the overall attitude of the staff could definitely use an adjustment, with a refresher course on treating paying customers.

Do yourself a favour and get one of their stracciatella, mozzarella, mortadella & pistachio paninis. It will blow your mind. Stopped in for lunch with a client and it was perfect!  Classy yet affordable, excellent service, and quiet enough to have a proper conversation.  This is now my go-to client lunch spot in the city.
Great little bar - cocktails were delicious.
Great service and a really nice atmosphere. Highly recommend their Mulled wine (when available), best one I have had yet here in Australia.
Great little bar, wonderful staff üëçüëå ‚Ä¶
Tasty lunch with fresh ingredients. Authentic Italian. Friendly service and not silly prices.

Exceptional service and drinks. We were offered to have the heater turned on, candles were lit and glasses of water brought out without asking. That‚Äôs what makes fantastic customer service. There was a wide variety of drinks to choose from. Highly recommend. Thank you.
Cool bar with excellent original antipasti to nibble on. The bartenders make great cocktails!
A fantastic Italian nook offering amazing coffee, light snacks and a Leone Spritz to die for. Service is amazing!
Beautiful bar in the city. Atmosphere is nice and the leone spritz the best. I can‚Äôt wait to came back.

The only place in Australia that you can get Leone to drink (think Aperol but better!). Fantastic place for drinks, coffees and snacks. Definitely recommend.
Great atmosphere and drinks.
It is rather narrow and the place had a vaguely cavernous feeling because of the layout. The staff was very friendly, but depending on the time of day there are several better bars or cafes nearby.

This bar is A M A Z I N G!!!  there is so much love invested in this lovely and cozy bar. The service is outstanding, the staff and very friendly and the LEONE SPRINTS are the best cocktails ever!

I came here a few days ago and had Panino San Daniele with mozzarella and tomato. It was just delicious! I will be back soon to try the Porchetta one... Exciting!!!! Also, a big thank to our italian server from Trieste, see you soon!

Who cares what shape the pizza was. They taste fantastic. Staff were so friendly & couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful. Will be back next time in Melbourne.
Great italian pizza!

When you are in Melbourne CBD and want to eat pizza, then this place is one of the best, there are various choices of delicious pizza in a sunny, pleasant afternoon.

This place used to be fantastic when they were doing Napoli style pizza a few years back but the newer Roman style pizza is square, dry and thin. I highly recommend the amazing Roman style pizza here at Sempre. The pizza, antipasto and desserts are all delicious! Highly recommended! ü•∞
Great local pizza place. Our hosts were the best. Very friendly family owned restaurant.

Pizza is EXCELLENT & Carbonara pasta DELICIOUS...
True old fashioned family service with a smile. Good food,good wine great service.
Lovely resturant with good food and lovely friendly Owners.

What a great find!! We were lucky enough to stumble across this gorgeous little Italian restaurant on a sunny evening. The owners were so lovely, the pizza was delicious (great GF bases) and the spritz‚Äôs were amazing too.
Lovely service, very yummy pizza and pasta, good wine too!!  I will definitely come back.

The pizza and pasta dishes were delicious, wine was from Italy and perfect, and the Affogato hit the spot at the end of the meal. oh my god pizzas were amazing - fresh crusty and delicious

Brisk friendly service,  great  veg pizza and excellent mediterranean salad with a glass of house red.  One pizza was plenty for two.  Lots of space, and not too noisy. Very happy to go back.

Visited on Tues 9 May. My second visit this year from Sydney. This a a very good restaurant. The staff are knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive. Menu is very good, not too big and some good specials. We enjoyed a fine Italian wine. Richard is an outstanding host. I would highly recommend Lupino.

I recently visited a restaurant and was blown away by the quality of the dishes. The Oyster was fresh and well-seasoned, while the Somen was cooked to perfection and served cold with a refreshing dipping sauce.  The 7-kinds chef selected Sashimi was a highlight, featuring an array of fresh and flavorful fish that were expertly prepared and beautifully presented. The Nimono was also a delightful addition to the meal, warming my stomach and preparing it for the main course.  The Eel was tender and perfectly cooked, with a sweet and savory glaze, while the Foie gras was rich and decadent with a silky texture. A small glass of fruit vinegar that was sent to you by the server after the Eel was a wonderful touch to refresh your palate  The 3-kinds chef selected nigiri was expertly crafted, and the Wagyu was a standout dish with a rich and flavorful beef cooked to perfection.  The desserts were the perfect way to end the meal, with the Mandarin jelly being a refreshing and light option, while the Creme br√ªl√©e was rich and decadent with a smooth and creamy texture.  Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant for its attention to detail, expertly prepared dishes, and warm and welcoming atmosphere. It is truly a dining experience not to be missed.

This was our all time favourite korean restaurant since early 2017 however over the years the taste and quality has changed and is inconsistent. It had the traditional korean restaurant taste. I have been here with friends, family my husband alone during lunch breaks as it was my favourite but it no longer tastes as good. :(  Favourites were/are(?) sseollongtang, spicy pork bulgogi, galbijim and the soy bean soup.  The last time I visited was at the end of 2022, for the mains the taste was still fine and good for korean restaurants around the area but it just wasnt as good as before. Side dishes were still good.  Would not recommend their hot pot / big soups like the spicy crab one, army soup and the stir fried octopus and pork dish. I don't think this is the restaurants strong suit.  Rating is low just because of the inconsistency and decrease in quality compared to before. It still is in my opinion, tasty for Korean food and definitely not bad but it was just SOOO much more delicious before!  I hope the restaurant can work on this because it was just really good before  Also the restaurant needs to include at least some side dishes when you order on uber eats. One time I was considering ordering delivery to save time, but uber eats did not come with any side dishes which was sad. I think it would be reasonable to include at least a few because I think the side dishes are a main highlight of this restaurant.

This place  feels otherworldly. You step in, soft jazz meets your ears. A friendly voice perks up: ‚Äúcan I help you?‚Äù. You turn to see a desk with a small person behind it that you‚Äôd somehow completely missed. You accept her help and ask where you can place your order. She directs you to a small counter with a shiny blue espresso machine on it and twinkling wine glasses hanging above. You wait at the counter but it seems like no one is there. So you ring the tiny bell and the sound mingles with the jazz but no one comes to help. You start thinking that no one will ever come, and just at that moment a man bursts from the back room. You stumble through a slightly confusing but resoundingly polite conversation and end up with two hot chocolates in a midnight blue booth.  Time slides by as you survey the characters in the room: a man working away at his laptop in the low lights, a bright conversation behind you, and the warm brown eyes across the table.  Before you know it the piano stops and the spell breaks. It‚Äôs time to go. The cold night air snaps you back to reality but that saxophone stuck in the back of your head keeps you warm inside.

Having said that, service could use a bit of finessing: 1) One waitress spilled a drink which splashed several customers and their belongings, none of whom received an apology 2) Another waitress ruined another customer's perfectly white shirt (on their sleeve) with orange stain when cleaning out their plate without even noticing 3) They will kick you out a little bit after an hour by bringing your bill to the table (despite ordering 3 items per person, each spending more than $40), so probably go elsewhere for special Au Revoir type occasions, just come here for quick brekkies.  Surcharge 10% weekends, 15% public holiday. Does not allow split bill.  Visited on a public holiday.

Izakaya Minami is a fantastic Japanese fusion restaurant located in the heart of Melbourne CBD. The restaurant provides high-quality dishes at affordable prices, making it an ideal spot for a casual night out or a special event with loved ones.  The ambience of the restaurant is cozy and relaxing, with just the right amount of music in the background. It's a 9/10 for us.  What we ordered: ‚≠ê Sushi Moriawase Entree (6pcs / $22) ‚≠ê‚≠ê Ika Teriyaki (grilled squid $18) ‚≠ê‚≠ê Gesso Karaage (Deep fried squid tentacles $14) ‚≠ê‚≠ê Asari Sakamushi (neck clam egg noodle soup cooked with sake $28) ‚≠ê‚≠ê The Gourmet Seafood Chawanmushi ($26) ‚≠ê Unagi Seiro ($19)  The food is a delightful combination of traditional Japanese cuisine and fusion cuisine. We highly recommend trying the Sushi Moriawase Entree (6pcs / $22) to start your meal. If you're sharing or feeling hungry, you can go for the 10pcs option. We also loved the grilled squid (Ika Teriyaki) and Deep Fried Squid Tentacles (Gesso Karaage).  For the main course, we tried Asari Sakamushi, a neck clam egg noodle soup cooked with sake. It's a great value as you get a lot of clams, and the soup is perfect for cold wintery weather. The Gourmet Seafood Chawanmushi ($26) is also worth a try, a premium take on classic Japanese egg custard.  We also tried Unagi Seiro ($19), the steamed eel, rice, and egg served in a bamboo steamer, which was decent for the price.  The staff at Izakaya Minami are lovely, and the menu is reasonably priced. We enjoyed everything we had here, and everything was well presented. Unfortunately, we didn't try the cr√®me brulee or pannacotta for dessert. Overall, we highly recommend Izakaya Minami for your next Japanese fusion dining experience in Melbourne CBD.  Overall rating: 4.5/5

ü•© O‚ÄôConner Beef Sirloin üßÄ Burrata, Fennel Herb Oil, Ciabatta ü¶ê King Prawn Skewers, Nduja, Basil Dressing üçù Wagyu Beef Ragu Pappardelle ü•î Roast New Potatoes ü•ï Tuscan Roasted Baby Carrot ‚òïÔ∏è Tiramisu  Mafia history and Italian culinary delights collide to form Pretty Boy Italian Steakhouse, located within the Novotel Melbourne Central Hotel. Victorian produce is the hero of every plate, with steaks aged onsite using traditional curing techniques.  The cocktails are simple - and cheap! Chefs cook your meals in a large, central open kitchen for your viewing pleasure. Being a hotel restaurant, naturally my expectations were low but they were immediately surpassed from the first dish. ü•∞  The Burrata did its thing, oozing into a fennel herb oil and mopped up with some toasted ciabatta. The Prawns are a must, my favourite dish of the night. So much meat and a delicious nduja pasta to spread. ü¶ê  The Sirloin Steak was good, it was cooked well, lots of bbq flavour coming through but a little tough. It is served with an offering of 4 different styles of mustard. They are pricey ranging from $47-$185 but unsure if it quite matches up to the level other premium Melbourne steakhouses. ü•©  The Wagyu Beef Ragu Pappardelle was quite generous and very homely. The Tiramisu had all the right flavours but would‚Äôve loved it to be a little creamier.  Everything was lovely, presented well - we really had nothing to complain about. We left satisfied with full bellies, a great option wether staying at the hotel or not!  ‚≠êÔ∏è 3.8/5 üí∏ $$$

ORDERED: üç®‚Ää Royal Taro (Regular): Taro flavoured bingsu with rainbow jelly, blueberry popping pearls, tapioca pearls and taro mochi ($16.00) üç®‚Ää Honey Dewd (Regular): Honey Dew flavoured bingsu with fresh watermelon & honeydew balls and rainbow jelly ($16.00) + venue service fee ($0.54)  I paid $8.14pp, between 4 people.  REVIEW: Scoopy is my favourite bingsu place in the CBD. It doesn't hold back with its flavours, with a sweetness so addicting that it's incredibly memorable. ü•∞ The taro is my favourite. It doesn't have an overpowering sweetness, but a rich nutty coconut flavour. Your spoon somehow keeps going back in. üòµ Alternatively, if you like something more refreshing after dinner, Honeydew is the way to go. It's light, and with an abundance of watermelon and honeydew balls, it's a really nice experience.  I love bringing people here. Everyone gets so surprised by how flavoursome and delicious it is. You conveniently scan through the QR code so it's really fuss free. üì≤ You may need to put yourself on a waitlist though (through a website), if there's a lot of people waiting. When your table is available, they'll send you a text with 5 minutes to answer so you can return from your walk around the block. Sadly they've taken off the group sizes (this was really helpful information!!) and they don't provide tap water anymore. But they'll gladly bring tap water if you ask.  ü•§
Have introduced all of my friends and family to scoopy. All their options are delicious!

You can hardly share between two people. It really made me wonder how tiny the small size is. With the shaved ice, it was more dense than say like Taiwanese one. It wasnt very sweet, in fact the thai tea flavour is bitter, so you need the whole condensed milk on the side to make it sweet. I like the mango jelly topping the most out of all the toppings on it. Overall it‚Äôs the novelty of the experience, and the appearance is unique from other shaved ice place, but it is expensive for the portion.

It was one of the best coffees I've had while visiting Melbourne by far ( I've tried a few) and the one of the cheapest! If staying at Ibis or Novatel, definitely stop in and grab a coffee and a bite to eat before exploring.

This place is open and ready to serve delicious breakfast as early as 530am. The staff was extremely pleasant, quick, and accommodating. We tried out the porterhouse steak and caesar salad, both did not disappoint. The grilled chicken included in the salad was tasty a grilled to perfection. The steak was tender, came with a small side salad, and a handful of golden chips. The gravy was perfect for both the steak and chips. The serving isn't that bad considering the price, although some may say that the food isn't as tasty as what other places would have. We have absolutely no complaints, the staff took the time to check if our food was cooked and served to our satisfaction. The place is perfect for an early bite and I would come back here any time than go to a 24 hour fast food.

The saddest beacon and egg roll I've ever had. Nice roll, but with the smallest egg laid by a chicken. Was cut in half to spread over the roll, just charge and extra 50c and put two eggs on to cover. At least the coffee was good.
Cosy little Cafe with very friendly staff and delicious food and coffee. Glad I decided to stop in on the walk past.
Small cafe but good choice of food and drinks. Good service, didn't have to wait too long for cooked breakfast
Very friendly staff with huge menu and good range of food options! Definitely recommend üëå ‚Ä¶

Good little cafe located in the Novotel/ibis foyer. One of the few places open early. Well priced breakfasts and Fast coffee.

Pleasantly surprised by this place which is in the foyer of the Ibis hotel where I checked into. The omelette menu is great and the coffee has a nice and fresh bite to it. The lighting is relaxing, with a good music playlist and the sunken position of the cafe against the street makes it feel cosy. A good little find, recommended.
