Quick and delicious

How convenient. Right at the doorstep of Novotel. More importantly, late closing, for people like me on a different time zone.  Ordered the standard beef noodle soup since its my first visit.  Not disappointed. Soup was wholesome, full of flavour, and just the right level of saltiness. Beef was super tender. Melt-in-your-mouth type. And the shaved noodles were spot-on, exactly like those you find in mainland China.  Definitely will be back to try the other menu items
Extremely bland soup and noodles tasted very doughie and raw. Portion sizing tiny and still struggled to finish the bowl.
Nothing fancy but nothing special. Good variety and value. Taste like home cook food.

Daniyeru's Detailed Review:  Customer Service 5/5 *You normally get bad service or barely existing service, but good food at your typical Chinese restaurant. Not here! Surprisingly clean, friendly and a modern fit out where you can order via QR code.  Food 5/5 *The minced pork noodle is a must have. The noodles are the absolute star here and as they describe and abbreviate the DAO meaning, it means something to the terms of hand made sliced noodle by knife. Which is exactly what you see the chef doing at the front viewing window! *The noodles are so bouncy, they take a unique forms and shape only found at DAO Noodle and due to this unique shape, texture and form you know 100% it is handmade and the quality thst is achieved through the knife method is there as soon as you take your first bite. *The minced pork and ingredients also complement the noodles in every way possible. Soft minced pork, no nasty bits or bone a nice punchy sauce. It is the #1 Chinese noodle definitely in my list in Melbourne and I will definitely make time to come back again. *  Value 5/5 *For the delicious unique handmade noodles and the price you pay for it, which is not fine dining, rather casual dining it is definitely Max score! You just cannot miss going here if you like Chinese noodles!  Atmosphere 4/5 *Modern, bright and clean. Casual vibes.  Overall *#1 Chinese noodles in Melbourne for sure with no doubt due to its unique knife slicing method. You will be a fool to miss this place!
Very nice noodles, fried dumplings and side dish.

very tasty noodles very chewy Cilantro for a finishing touch Tomato scrambled eggs are a bit salty, but they are perfect when mixed with noodles The braised eggs that are added to the single order are ordinary The service is good and the environment is very clean
Delicious noodles, so fresh. Nice staff, really clean place, nice for a quick meal. Limited but very good veggie options.
Been here twice now and it's delicious! The noodles with pork, tomato and egg are my go to.

Everything we ordered were good, they are very different in taste but all good. The green bean noodle is probably the leaT of three just because the noodle is kinda dry, but the great seasoning made up for if.The handmade noodle is soft and great to chew and the beef soup is not salty but definitely tasty :) Tomato mince pork / shanxi traditional noodle was best of three eventough it's also the simplest. Price is allright  Came back for lunch on 17Jan2023 and ordered shanxi traditional noodle. To my disappointment the noodle is slightly hard and the soup is darker color like its overburnt or not enough tomatoes,  taste is not great at all.

This place is fantastic. Usually get the mince and eggplant noodles, however today I tried the steamed hand cut noodles with pork belly. Very unique dish which I haven't seen elsewhere. The green chilli sauce is also a must.
Great vibe. Chilled place. Interesting decor. Seems like the food is very fresh.

A small but great quality place. We wanted something quick from a hotel nearby so grabbed the tomato, eggplant and pork noodles with some veg dumplings too. We took it out but only had to sit waiting for 5-10 mins, with quick and friendly service. The food itself was incredible, super yummy and fresh! Would definitely recommend

Absolutely love the steamed handmade noodles. The noodles were of excellent texture - a little bit springy, a little bit firm and a whole lot of yum. The beef noodle soup blasts amazing flavours, as did the pan-fried dumplings. Good value for money too.

Yesterday was my first time here and I can say that this was probably one of my favorite noodle places in Melbourne.  Ordering was very easy and simple. You order through the QR code on your table and the food gets delivered to your table when ready.  The stirfried steamed noodle (men mian) was so unique and delicious, definitely recommend ordering. If you love tofu and tea eggs, add those as extra toppings on your noodles as well. And if you love chili, definitely go for the option of getting the extra green chili release to add to your noodle for extra fragrance.  For entr√©es, you have to get the braised beef slices, as well as the vermicelli salad with seaweed and carrots.

I had a great time, the service was good but it would be great if the servers introduced the food and maybe recommend something for first timers.  I'm not a  huge fan of the QR code things at times.  As a neurodivergent, they sometimes feel like a real barrier.  I understand places need them at the moment though.  If you are a first timer, I'd go for the egg & tomato mix and the pork.  Both were excellent and the super savour flavours at DXM Noodle were really satisfying.  The noodles were also excellent and it was my first tome trying this type.  Although I think I've seen similar in Vietnamese cuisine.  It's not the most comfortable place, so I don't usually hang around after my noodles.  I'm going to come back for the dumplings.  They looked incredible to he honest.  Similar to Shandong panstickers.  The food isn't overly spicy, five it a go.
I been this restaurant many times,all good l like it

So SO GOOD! at this point I‚Äôve tried everything on the menu, and none of them have let down.  My favourites are the beef noodle soup, and the tomato & egg noodles. The dumplings are a close contender with their beautiful crispy skirt though.  The noodles have a great bite to them, and the sauces and soup always taste delicious and clean (weird description for food, but it just doesn‚Äôt leave my mouth and stomach feeling strange).  The tables and environment are always neat and clean, and the service is super friendly too. Highly reccomend!  Brought many of my friends to Dao now, and they always love it.

This small restaurant serves traditional hand cut noodles and you can get either full soup or dry / saucy style. We tried two different dry noodles, the traditional pork / egg / tomato combo and the chicken gravy. The noodles themselves are chewy and the sauces are light tasting which lends it's homely flavour. The hidden gem for us was the pickled radish, it's crunchy and pickled really well. Food - 9 Service - 9 Vibe - 8 Price - $
Very authentic!
Order two dishes, beef soup noodles, and pork mince soup noodles for dinner. I like beef more than pork mince as it tastes good. The aircon is too cold for me as the outdoor temperature is 26 degree.

Waited for 30+ mins for our uber eats order. Then it got cancelled with 0 communication. If you can't take an order 30+ mins before your stated closing time, have the basic decency to cancel the order **before** we wait for 30 whole minutes. Common sense? Not so common, clearly. </3

As soon as I received the pork cutlet, even with the naked eye, the fried clothes and meat were all separated, and it was burnt black. The end taste is a kind of pom-pong flavor. I doubted my eyes to the extent that I wondered if I had reheated it or how long I had kept it in the freezer... Even if I bought frozen pork cutlet and fried it at home, it wouldn't be this good.  There is no broth for watercress, but one large ice cube and a little bit of thin ice are put in, so the noodles are chewed right away like ramen without the need for scissors, probably because they have not been rinsed in cold water. The restaurant itself is unhygienic.  The female employee who looked at the counter couldn't tell what mistake she had made or whether she was eating because of her whining voice throughout the meal, or whether she came to listen to her whining voice. If the hall doesn't run smoothly like this, either increase the number of staff or retrain the staff.  Food is not basic. I know you're not doing business for Koreans, but I'm really very upset that I paid this money and ate this food. I've been to all the Korean restaurants in Melbourne, but this is the first time I've been to a place where I can't get a rating like this. Not even worth 1 star.

Tried their gimmari tteokboki, bibimbap,cheese chicken, kimchi fried rice, yangyum fried chicken. Portions were great let alone the taste was phenomenal. Always enjoy a good meal and a warm environment with friends and staff are extra friendly however, the only problem was they gave me so much food! I couldn‚Äôt finish the food so i packed it to work so win win! 10/10 recommend

Went for dinner at this Korean restaurant with three friends on Friday night. The restaurant closes at 8:30 pm, and we got there at 7:30 pm, so we decided to order just three meals to share between the four of us (plus three bowls of rice) as we thought we might be scarce on time.  It turned out to be just the right amount of food (in fact, three meals left the four of us feeling a bit stuffed). The food was served pretty quickly, too, so we had plenty of time to eat.  We ordered: Cheese Chicken Bulgogi (5/5 stars) (~$25), Yangnyeom Fried Chicken (5/5) (~$20), and some vegetarian dish, whose name I did not catch, but which came with translucent noodles (4/5) ($~20), plus the three bowls of rice. Overall, it cost us $80, which worked out to be a very reasonable $20/each.  A great find! I will definitely  visit again. Thank you CJ Lunch Bar.

One of the best spots in the city for a consistent, affordable feed. Despite the name, they‚Äôre also open for dinner and their super high-value bentos are on offer all day. A clean and quaint experience. Portion sizes are good value for money.  Kitchen is efficient, taking about 12min from order to table. Food quality has some highlights, but a couple of shorts as well; poached eggs were perfect, mushrooms and hash browns were amazing, but the toast came out without butter or butter on the side, chorizo itself is very flavourful but it's cut length ways and then seared...so it dries out terribly. Coffee is definitely a highlight...one of the best cups I've had.  The double and triple shots are strong and bold, but not bitter, just brilliant. The noodles with the sliced beef, egg, pickled beans and peanuts were delicious and the noodles were perfectly chewy and soaked up the sauce to make them unbelievable and left you wanting more after each mouthful. The steamed egg with lobster was so light and fluffy it really was a taste sensation and is a must when you come here. By far the standout though is the pork belly bao buns. The pork belly melts in your mouth and the flavour of the pork explodes in your mouth. The bao buns are so light and fluffy it was like biting into a cloud. The braised pork belly was slightly overcooked with the pork coming through a  bit dry but the "fatty" part was tender and tasty. While the service is a bit hit and miss the food does speak for itself and is certainly worth the visit. I'll be back next time I go the the cbd.

I used to work here and broke my femur falling off their poorly maintained e-bike with worn tires. The store is also very dirty in general which says a lot about the management of this store. I picked up a pizza from here earlier in the year (after I quit) and the service had actually gotten worse, they cut the pizza with a blunt blade, the pieces were inseparable. Only one person working in the store at this time by the way. If you‚Äôre looking for good service try a suburban Domino‚Äôs. We booked a table here for 11 people for a bachelorette party. When our table started to order our food we were told that we weren't allowed to order from the regular menu. Instead our table was told that each of us WOULD be paying $70 each for a set banquet.  At no stage in the 5 weeks prior did they ever mention that we would be forced to have the banquet, despite me being in contact with them a few times in the weeks preceding to discuss the event. When we told them that we had not been informed that we only had the set banquet as an option and we had expected to order from the regular menu as we had food intolerances we were told (at least politely) that the banquet was all that would be given to us. If we thought that we might have been able to get a table for 11 elsewhere on a Thursday night at 7.30pm then we would have just left.  On top of that the service was slow, the drinks took over 20 minutes to arrive (just soft drinks and beer/cider), we did have one server who was trying her absolute best but it was unfortunately not enough to make up for the disorganisation of the majority of the staff.  So essentially this restaurant ruined the bachelorette dinner because they couldn't be bothered to inform us prior to actually sitting down to dinner that we weren't going to be forced to pay $70 to get food that none of us would have ordered if we had a choice.

As she was passing behind him I watched as his face changed to a mocking one, rolling his eyes in her direction as she headed upstairs. This man has no business working in a restaurant or neqr customers. Not making this up. I'm happy to relay this to the owner if they get in contact.
Authentic Greek cuisine, everything is very delicious, but the prices are pretty high as for me.
Fresh, fast and friendly. Proper, old school Greek food, with respectful, professional and prompt service. Very tasty and filling, noms.
Excellent
Wow what a fantastic meal.
Busy restaurant with good food and a great atmosphere.  Great customer service particulaly by the older gentleman who was very friendly and welcoming.  Love the Stalactites ceiling too....

There seems to be a line outside every night. They only take reservations for groups of 6+, all others are walk-ins. The food and wine was delicious. I ordered the mixed gyro platter. The only downside was that I wanted another dish, and the waitress said it would take 30 minutes to prepare and she can't do that because they were busy.. i think it was because i was occupying a table they could have fit two people at. Other than that the staff was friendly.

The beautiful Greek tastes and once awesome Hellenic dining experience has disappeared with the chefs and restaurant staff predominantly Indian heritage. The lamb Yeeros burned, chips not worth completing and overpriced. Won‚Äôt be returning.

Returned here after 5 or 6 years.  Previously had a very poor experience with a Christmas function upstairs where they crammed us into a shared space.  Then had a souvlaki that was very fatty.  However decided to give them another go.  And very surprised!  It is a Wednesday night and every table is full so we had to wait about 10 minutes for our seats.  I only a generous lamb lemonata main and it was pretty good but a maybe a little chewy.  The ouzo to cleanse the palate was a generous serve.  The missus ordered a GF souvlaki and it came with a little GF certification sticker on the napkin.  So all is forgiven.  Final note: if you are expecting to see Greeks in the kitchen and serving you, you will be disappointed. But we are a multi cultural society and the food was as "authentic" as I could imagine it.
Food's ok place is too crowded seating bad, feels like your sitting on top of one another.
The food was ok, but I'm not sure both skewers were made with lamb. Too toasted for my taste. The ambience is nice, especially the ceiling.
Stalactites has bomb kebabs! I use to go here few times when I was in my youth! Now I take my husband. The building aesthetic is beautiful too! The space is small but not a big issue.
A Lamb souvlaki to die for!!! So much food, so generous, staff excellent.
Great options for coeliacs!

Who doesn't love Greek food. Great menu...staff efficient...decor is basic except for ceiling. Didn't get 5 stars....food can be hit/miss, steak not good, so stick to Greek. Staff...don't explain the food or specials, but if you are a regular, not an issue. Love they are open late...quick and efficient to clear tables and sort drinks and food.
Meatlovers perfect place...the food is awesome, lamb, beef, chicken, pita bread...excellent

Delicious! But don‚Äôt order the calamari. We went after 6pm and ended up in the queue out to front. It moved pretty quickly. Only waited around 15mins. Expect a very busy and crammed room. Once you‚Äôre in your seat, don‚Äôt expect to be able to get out! Our chairs were touching the people behind us. The dips, saganaki, pita, mixed giros platter and Greek salad were all delicious. Satisfied our Greek craving! I just wouldn‚Äôt order the calamari again. Would definitely go back another time.

A busy but great dining experience. If you arrive after 5 then expect to wait for a table. Service friendly and attentive, and the food arrived quickly but very well cooked and amazing flavour! Great for anyone gluten free as a celiac registered restaurant.

I'm having dinner or lunch at this place since 2018. And I can say that they have very good food and service. There are many different dishes and the amount of food served is quite good. I'm still going once a month at least. Chicken and lamb are really good.
Like always. great food. Dips ar die for
Good for cakes.  Meal was ok but not worth the queueing. Had lamb shoulder. Cold and dried from being cut for some time. Pricey for what we got.

Coeliac accredited. Lots of GF choices. Lemon lamb dish was yum. No opportunity to get a second drink so order two! Definitely focused on flipping tables for next sitting.
24HRs  but 10% public holiday surcharge +18 Night surcharge=28%
Enjoy everything we ate

Tasty seafood laksa
Great food and good service.

These guys try to overcharged you. They charge around 20% extra on Sunday instead of 10% as advertised. They did the same to the table next to me.  They just think your  a drunk white person at 2 am and you won't notice. I doubt they are doing it to one of there own
Very rude service from the aunties.

The lady at the counter is very rude as I am allergic to seafood I asked her can u please remove prawns from my dish and add chicken the girl was like can‚Äôt you see what‚Äôs written on the menu ! Such a rude staff !
The food was okay. Some food was very salty and some very bland  Super bad attitude. Don't recommend it at all
Don‚Äôt get the noodle, it is just bland like most noodle in Melbourne, but the fried rice & chicken was quite good
Food was not good and service even worst. If your going by picture my omelette was burnt and overly salty.

To me customer service is really important, that‚Äôs why this place lost a few stars. The food is delicious and served quite fast but the service is not very friendly. When I paid cash I got charged 10% additional, when I enquired she pointed at a sign high up on a pole, 10% surcharge after 10 pm and weekends and public holiday. Excellent Asian food.

Wanton Noodle was bad. Noodle was hard and the worse thing, the lady seems like having bad day and complaints about customer to other staffs. The counter lady was freaking rude. Food and service were equally terrible.

I bought half a roasted duck. The neck meat of several ducks below is also very thin. This is not half a roasted duck at all, but spliced ‚Äã‚Äãtogether. It‚Äôs really annoying. It‚Äôs time to close down cnm‚Äôs

This used to be the place to go for the best, affordable Chinese food. Unfortunately it is less so these days. The service is poor and the prices are ridiculous. $9.30 for 4 pieces of chicken feet.. Seriously! What a rip off, and to top it off, they were not fresh and seemed like they had been reheated a few times because they were gluey and chewy. I‚Äôm so disappointed and will never return!

I used to be a loyal fan of this yum cha restaurant but things changed recently. No more traditional dim sum trolleys, you have to order from the sheet and wait for all dishes to be served at one time, dishes got cold easily after a little while. Chicken feet was not marinated properly, duck feet was stinky, prawn&scallop dumpling had no scallop inside. Most of the dishes are below average compared with other yum cha in Chinatown. Not even mentioning the astonishingly high price. They asked for tips though I could not see any decently customer service except rushing us to finish within the one hour limit.

So so disappointed. Been here many times and quality has gone down hill. Service is good but Yum Cha with no trolleys? This is a big no no. Tick a box to order but then can‚Äôt order more cause you‚Äôve only got one checklist? Menu was also missing so many staples you would normally be able to order. Used to be so good, what happened? Expensive for what was offered.

An extensive range of dishes to pick from and each one is so delicious. Pick what you want on the menu and no trolley that comes around with the food. The prawn dumpling was slightly overcooked as the skin started to break and the xiao long bao had minimal soup but overall the dishes we had are what you'd expect from a yumcha. Prices are a bit on there expensive side.Note: best to book in advance as there's usually a line

The taste is good, the price is a bit expensive, but the taste is worth it. It is very suitable for inviting people to have morning tea or dinner.

We had the dimsum, which has one hour limit and minimum spending 30 dollars per pax + credit card surcharge + public holiday surcharge. Just every restriction u can think of. Also ridiculously expensive dim sum. And the food is not even nice.

Worst service imaginable, largely due to the obnoxious attitude and behavior of the waiter. I would give 0 star if I could. One of the waiters seemed to take pleasure in belittling you and your party, and made no effort to conceal his contempt. Making remarks that their restaurant is the Hermes of seafood restaurants while I was ordering food and taking pleasure in interrupting my ordering and making constant reminders of meeting their minimum spend were just some of the horrors that we experienced.  Overall, the restaurant with the rude, arrogant, and obnoxious waiter provided an incredibly unpleasant dining experience especially with very ordinary food. If you are looking for a restaurant with good service and a welcoming atmosphere, it would be best to steer clear of this establishment. Had Yum cha yesterday, and I was really surprised by the cost. Normally, it would only cost around $350 plus for 8 people, but this time we had to pay almost $600! The food was good, but I think I'll try other yum cha places in the city next time. On top of that, the booking time was limited to only an hour, which is ridiculous. It used to be an hour and a half per session, but not anymore (unless the booking is for the last available session before the restaurant closes at 3:00)  To make things worse, we had a really baffling experience with one of the waiters. We had booked for 10 people, but two of our friends couldn't make it. When I asked the waiter if we could keep the extra bowls and cutlery, he just kept insisting that we only needed 8 sets because there were only 8 of us. I was so confused and annoyed! Why couldn't they just leave them? We might need them later, and it's not like they were in a hurry to clear the table for the next booking. It was a pretty tense moment, and I just gave up in the end because I didn't want to ruin our lunch. I've never had this issue with any other restaurant before, and I think the management should look into this attitude issue with their waitstaff. It's not good customer service to insist on taking away items that customers might need.

Rushed service 1 hour limit food was above average but watch out for their ‚Äúdefault 20% tip‚Äù when you tap your card for payment. We insisted on a refund of the said ‚Äútip‚Äù ‚Ä¶ highly unethical by any standards!!! Stick to making profits decently!!

Fantastic place! Was served by the waitress Rosa who made the whole experience so much more! Dimly lit, intimate setting with charcuterie boards and an extensive whisky list. Decor is funky and vintage and it's easy to hear and listen to your friends without being too loud in surroundings.

I had the one of the greatest nights with my friends here for one of their 18ths, The vibes were immaculate, rustic and filled with decor and banging 60s and 70s blues and rock tunes from ZZ Top to Muddy Waters. Of course this couldn‚Äôt have been accomplished without the liveliness and cheerfulness of the bar staff and servers, massive f*cking shoutout to Rosa, they were so sweet, funny and filled the table with laughs. Also big ups Bryan/Brian/Ryan who was interested in our game of chase the chicken and was pouring drinks like a mad lad. 5/5, 10/10 would definitely come again. Thank you Boilermaker House! <3

Great atmosphere,great whisky bar
While the atmosphere and drinks menu were top notch, the real star of the show for us was the service from very knowledgeable staff. We loved the decor and felt like we came across a hidden gem here.

My wife and I had a wonderful evening here for a special celebration. Food and beer was fantastic, the oysters, cauliflower bites, snd truffle Brie were particular highlights. Our server Rosa also went above and beyond to make it an enjoyable evening - friendly and helpful, and some excellent whiskey recommendations even though I only gave her some pretty vague requests to work with. Will definitely be coming back as soon as we can get more babysitting!

We had a lovely date night here. Excellent food, beer & whiskey. Really knowledgable and friendly staff. Rosa was so warm & welcoming & a great guide to the back room whiskeys too. Thoroughly recommend!
Whiskey menu is spot on
Nice place very good drinks.

The food is absolutely to die for. Delicious plus and very filling.Great service , great value for money..going again Thursday night

If I could give this restaurant 0 stars I would. The waitress forgot to give our order to the kitchen and we were made to wait 1.5 hours for average food at best which is ridiculous. All waitresses were ignoring us because no one wanted to deal with us. What‚Äôs worse is after the 1.5 hours, the dish that I ordered was vegetarian and they bring it out with chicken and serve us someone else‚Äôs dish??? What a ridiculous restaurant, even worse waitstaff and awful service. Save yourself your time and money and go to the other way better Thai restaurants in the city.
All the food I ordered was great and the staff were also very friendly. I will definitely come back.

Super yum and super authentic! ‚Ä®Brought me back to Thailand. The menu can be a bit overwhelming because there are so many options. ‚Ä®I ordered the Tom Yum which was creamy spicy perfection.  For drinks I went with the Thai milk tea to wash down all the spicy goodness. ‚Ä®‚Ä®I had faith in the food being so good I order the Pad Kee Mow to go. ¬†I knew it would be great for lunch the next day, oh boy it did not disappoint. Again I was floored at the authentic amazing taste and quality. ‚Ä®Flat rice noodles with chilli, garlic, egg, chinese broccoli, basil in a black sweet sauce and oyster sauce! YUMMMM‚Ä®‚Ä®There's sitting in the little alley way and then they have a bigger restaurant space around the corner. Eat in the alley way if you can, makes the whole experience better. ¬†The alley way isn't great for groups though, a total of maybe 9 people fit inside. Again plenty of space for group in the main part of the restaurant.
Excellent Thai food - some of the best in Melbourne.  The red curry is exceptional!

I had such a great veggie red curry here on a quiet late-night Tuesday that I had to go back. But they were so busy - no surprise - I opted for a couple of takeaways. If I lived in Melbourne, they would never see the end of me. The design is casual, boutique and Bohemian, and the space is comfortable, open and inviting - Highly recommended.

Best Massaman Beef Curry I have ever had in Australia. We also took Chilli and Basil Stir-Fry with Sticky, Jasmine Rice.  The beef was so tender almost melting in mouth, went pretty well with perfectly balanced sauce/gravy.  Will be going back to try some of their other dishes soon.

3 stars for the laugh this rollercoaster of a meal gave us. The food was good, nothing special but nothing wrong either. And the encore: A Long Island ice tea. After two attempts and one send back, I gave up and settled for whatever this creamy concoction was üòÇ. Delicious, unpretentious, great-value-for-money food. We had the omelette with prawn meat, grilled chicken, crispy pork and a curry. We walked away satisfied, full and really impressed. Service was great, food delivered quickly.  Well done, highly recommended and we will be back soon.

Best lemon ice tea I have ever had. On the night of 5.12, the first woman at the cash register opposite the liquor shelf had short hair and glasses, seemed to be wearing pink clothes and a black mask, and her attitude was really bad. When I was in line, I kept waiting for the cashier to say next waiting until she finished chatting with her colleagues and turned her head to signal me to put the shopping cart on the table. After I put it on, she turned her head and continued to chat with her colleagues. When I finished the bill, I didn't say thanks, and didn't tell me that the bill was successful. I asked her if she was all right, and she didn't answer. Could it be that she is dumb? It shouldn't be, the voice is quite loud when chatting!
Bad counter service for the girl who worked on night shift today with black hair colour üëé ‚Ä¶

Forget this place , keep walking . Food was horrible and whatever you order you get different. Don‚Äôt waste your money

It was very quiet when we arrived (9pm on a Friday night) and we ordered via the qr code. 25 minutes later we got our drinks, including 'china tea', which turned out to be a dilmah teabag. After 40 minutes we received our first dish- tea eggs, which were totally fine. Our steamed dumplings then arrived, which were stone cold. Another 10 minutes for our Chinese broccoli, which was fine, but cost $17. At close to an hour, we asked about our main dish (sausage mixed noodles) and were told it was 2 minutes away. Ten minutes later it arrived in a takeaway container (we requested this as we were super ready to leave), again cold. Like, fridge cold. The dish turned out to be egg noodles with some chili oil and sliced salami of some kind on top. Genuinely one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had in Chinatown.

So many things wrong with this place. There was my group and only one other table of 2 people and the time for food was absolutely ridiculous. A couple of dishes came out and an hour passed before a couple more did. Over an hour and a half later, we still hadn‚Äôt received a serving of fried chicken which we asked about multiple times and kept being told that it was on the way. We ended up leaving and waited at the desk for someone to talk to about getting a refund, but no one came out after 15 minutes. So we left as we had somewhere to be, lost money because we couldn‚Äôt get a refund and didn‚Äôt get the food we came for. 2 of the servings of dumplings were still stone cold in the middle, they chucked it in the microwave and brought it back out. The outter layer was hot and inside was still cold. Left them on the table as they were inedible. To make matters worse, as we were walking out we saw TWO RATS run through a gap between the booth chairs ü§Æ absolutely shocked this place is still up and running.
Food is always good
Absolutely terrible.
Great food and service :)

we ordered and it took over 2 hours to get half our meal, it took so long to get the other half that we ended up leaving before getting the rest of our meal and we realised later that they had not started cooking it yet. food was slightly below average and noodles were undercooked.

Tread lightly at the Ants Bistro. Look, the food was decent but the service was shocking. This place has an online ordering system via a QR code on the table, so there's no excuse to get it wrong. Our table of 5 ordered pan-fried dumplings, two mains, fried rice and noodles. One of the mains came out first, so we picked at it, hoping the rice would arrive soon. Ten minutes later (maybe more?) the second main arrived. I asked whether our rice and noodles were coming soon, and what happened to our dumplings? Dumplings come first, I was told! I think another table got ours... Rice & noodles finally arrived, along with steamed dumplings. By then everything was cold. Also, trying to eat fried rice off a plate instead of out of a bowl with chopsticks is awkward! We won't be back.

If I could then I wouldn‚Äôt bother to give that one star‚Ä¶ had the worst food. We ordered dumpling and pork shredded something. I told them and then they gave us back that same dumpling by heating up in a microwave after 15/20 minutes ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Jesus! wasted my money and time‚Ä¶

Places are struggling with staff, but it's ridiculous trying to staff a medium size restaurant with one cook and one waitress. Service was ridiculous slow, we ordered two dishes - one took 35 mins, the other came out 15 minutes later. Avoid!

We ended up leaving after one hour of waiting for our meals, the entrees were first in ok time but then 20 mins later first dish arrived, then a while later the fried rice was served and was missing bbq pork and shrimp just had rice peas and carrots. We sent it back as it was not what the menu described. Our other 3 dishes never arrived. When we approached staff they said we had been served all dishes, then they checked with the kitchen and they thought they had finished our order. We were even told they couldn‚Äôt serve prawn toast  as they had none but they still charged us for it. We were very hungry and dissapointed. The fact that no Asian people were dining in there was a big sign that it‚Äôs not up to their standards either. We paid for entree and one dish between the 5 of us and left very annoyed. Poorly run business, stay clear!!

we came in and stood in the door way to be seated for 10 minutes (minimum) and was then seated at a filthy table. we were not given cutlery, napkins and we had to ask for water after being seated for 30 minutes (minimum). we had made our order after being seated and patiently waited for a while, until! we had noticed that tables seated long after us were receiving their food and drinks before us. we had ask two different staff members numerous times how our order was going, we were given no update. we were only then given an update on our food after 1 hour of waiting, we stood up and left. the whole time we felt as though we were denied of service. to give the benefit of the doubt there were only two waitresses and they looked under the pump.

!!!    DON‚ÄôT BOTHER GOING HERE    !!! I didn‚Äôt even want to give this 1 star. We arrive and are seated at a messy table, then an HOUR after ordering we still haven‚Äôt received our food. We didn‚Äôt even get water or cutlery until we asked half an hour later. Yet other people got their food within 15 minutes of being seated. Imagine you have a chronic elbow injury for a couple years and some time after surgery you finally have some confidence and courage to go out and be social. Service was great. Food was average.  Scallop didn‚Äôt have much flavour. Duck curry wasn‚Äôt really curry‚Ä¶ Pork belly tasted floury? Wontons were alright Brussel sprouts were the best - crispy and flavourful.

Young girl serving us was beautiful, always checking in to make sure we didn‚Äôt need anything. Drinks and Food was amazing, we shared the the taster platter and some light dinners. So flavoursome ü§§

The food was good and the service was excellent, the staff was very attentive to your needs. The dining atmosphere and decorations were great.
Great CBD dining & cocktail bar. Food is yum, but small servings

We walked in without a booking but were given a table if we could vacate it by 8.30. They quickly seated us with menus and water and proceeded to explain the menu. Loved that we could choose the size in most items. Our goal was to sample a variety of dishes so this suited us well.  Our feast consisted of sweet potato and snake bean poached wonton, duck and betel leave with Balinese sambal, crispy pork belly with Vietnamese salad, baked trout with sticky coconut rice, pumpkin and coconut custard to top it off.  Each dish arrived with lovely presentation and aromas that made the mouth water. Then, the taste buds awoke to such alluring and stimulating flavours, contrasting but harmonising textures and dishes that flowed seamlessly onto each other. Hard to pick my favourite, but the pork belly and trout were outstanding.  All staff were very welcoming, super helpful, attentive and accommodating - so unusual in itself. The decor has ties back to the building's history in textile manufacturing. The lighting and design created an intimate atmosphere that suits small groups and couples. Our experience here was faultless and we would be keen to come back and try out their other offerings.

Intriguing selection of dishes on the menu! Our pick for the evening started off with Scallop sashimi with avocado cr√®me fraiche, shaved fennel and orange gel followed by Roti bread with lemongrass, peanut and cashew satay served along with Black garlic & squid ink barramundi, malay yellow curry with charred bean sprouts, wombok and seasame crackers‚Ä¶..and Sirloin steak with spring onion salsa and enoki mushrooms! A mouthful‚Ä¶..literally! :)  Clean and flavourful ingredients combined! There was alot going on but somehow worked well together. The malay yellow curry with the barramundi was subtle and not overpowering in flavour which complimented the dish very well. The roti bread was a nice addition to the Black garlic and squid ink barramundi as it served to soak up the rest of the curry. The scallop sashimi was a little bland for my liking but played well as a starter. The sirloin was cooked perfectly to my liking and was a great topper along with the bowl of rice which really filled up the space! Yes, pricey considering the size of dishes but the quality reflects this!  A must visit for its unique interior decor and historic past! The levels consist of The Sweatshop Basement Bar and Yard, Drystore Espresso, Dining Room and Cocktail Bar, each level different to the other.  Full of character and vibe for the enthusiast as this was a former textile factory, in the 1930s a sweatshop, brothel and Buddhist monastery! Yes‚Ä¶..I know!

We visited this little gem a few weeks ago before the theatre, where we saw a disastrous version of a Christmas Carol. Unlike the show our experience at the Seamstress was excellent and saved the evening. We had a wonderful meal from start to finish. Each course was presented beautifully. The variety of textures and flavours in each dish left us in anticipation of the next. We are pescatarians and the chef understood the assignment - preparing each dish as per our dietary requirements. The dishes were served to us with love, attention and a brief description of the ingredients, as were each of the cocktails. The ambiance was perfect and we had such a fabulous time. Glad to have found this place. We shall certainly be returning. Please note the restaurant is on the first floor, up a couple of flight of stairs - check for alternative access if stairs are a problem for you.

Wpw, wow, wow. Food and service here are incredible. The duck and pork belly are outstanding.  Ambiance and service staff are   so impressive. Can't say enough good things  about the food, decor, ambiance.

In this post Covid world, it was fantastic to be treated to true hospitality. Amazing food exceptional service, real passionate professionals. The food had amazing flavours and we had a banquet that left all of us salivating and full. Thanks for an amazing night and allowing us to experience an escape from reality

I've dined here many times previously but after last night I won't be returning simply based on the unnecessarily rude/arrogant attitude of the male greeter. I haven't seen him before here, I don't know where he is from or where he thinks he works, but his manner and the way he speaks to customers is unbecoming in a relatively pleasant establishment. No, it's not the Ritz, but it's not McDonald's either. Interesting to read other people have commented in a similar way. The food was just OK. I've eaten better here previously. Such a shame.

Tasty food. Generous portions. Friendly servers. Reasonably priced. Order though QR code.  Affordable could easily eat under $15-20 per person. I had a noodle soup and a side. Just wow,  This place is amazing the food is amazing my fellow friends and I loved the food here. Our favourite would be the Yakisoba noodles and the curry. My friends and I really enjoyed our dinner here. Their hot udon soup was so nice - the dashi broth was tasty and the noodles were bouncy. Their zaru soba was really tasty too. Didn‚Äôt know what to expect when I booked dinner here.  Wasn‚Äôt much to look at inside. However, from the initial greeting by the friendly staff member, the easy method of ordering using a pad device, then the best part, the food, the experience was great! After I ordered, a member of the wait staff came over, confirmed my order, by going through the printed receipts from the ordering app.  The food came out very quick.  Beautifully presented and made with very fresh ingredients.  The flavours were fantastic.  Prices are very reasonable.  Staff, as I mentioned were great! Delicious skewers, wide selection of items, and perfect for dates and business gatherings. Ended up losing my satchel there the other night, and they graciously kept it safe until I returned. Will absolutely come back again.

First impressions can sometimes ruin an experience and this was fearful once we walked in and were made feel like an inconvenience with the offhand attitude of behind bar staff greeting diners downstairs. However, once upstairs and seated, the mood and environment changed to the other scale of the service chart with wonderful, friendly attitude and demeanou. All food ordered was way above expectations and sensational in taste,  quality and serving size. Started with prawn buns from the Cold menu then followed with the pork belly dish, paired with crispy corncakes and wok tossed veg in a spicy mushroom and garlic sauce. Great food.  I was wanting to visit Ginger Boy for 7 years and finally made it there.  Everything on the menu looks delicious.  We tried the chicken ribs, beef tartare, snapper and the dumplings.  Flavours were brought together really well.  We were a little disappointed when they didn't do their last orders for dessert before they closed the kitchen and said they couldn't serve us.  Finally, they did see our dissapointment and gave us the dessert menu.  We are glad we had the dessert, it was outstanding!  Staff was friendly. Really good vibe to the place.  Whoever had their play list on for music that night - üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•

Best experience in food. Service was 5 out of 5, and Arthur and Laura were amazing and excelled in explaining the menu and how to enjoy the food more.

Went to gingerboy this week for dinner. Food was amazing, especially the kingfish and scallops. Laura our section waitress was such a good vibe. Same as maya. The both Germans together are such a gem. Thanks girls for explaining how to cut a snapper to us. Gingerboy: you made our night so special

Impossible to fault! We had the pre show menu and the food was among the best we‚Äôve eaten - can‚Äôt wait to come back and try the full banquet. The staff were especially lovely and attentive, ensuring we were seated and served quickly after arriving late, so we wouldn‚Äôt miss our show.

Great restaurant hidden down Crossley Place. Can choose from a set banquet or a la carte. The food was delicious, couldn't fault it. We chose just enough from the menu and our service person guided us well. The drinks complimented our food perfectly.  The atmosphere was lovely in the main room. Not too dark, nice lighting though it reflected off the mirrors oddly at times.  Will go again!

Food. Good $95 banquet but no better than quite a few lesser options at other establishments. Wine cost over the top (Triple  Punkt Riesling $76 ). This can be bought at Vintage Cellars for $22. Overall not at bad but probably won't make the trip from Sandringham again

The best service you could imagine - our train was running late so they pushed back our Saturday night booking with only 1hour notice - so grateful! The staff here are a total dream, as is the food. Thank you for the delightful waitress that served us upstairs, you were so helpful and funny and made our night.

Honestly ginger boy is a must go to restaurant in Melbourne! Not only was the food incredible but the service was also the best we have had. The food was incredibly delicious and well worth the money you spend as well as the cocktails, everything was so amazing. The service was honestly so good. We were so well looked after and our waitress Alison was so great, she made us feel like a friend to her and was so personable and even gave us some great recommendations on other cafes that were awesome (ps. the matcha place was amazing). This was the absolute highlight of our trip to Melbourne and would 110% recommend dining here if you get the opportunity to. Thanks so much to the whole ginger boy team who made our dining experience one to never forget ‚ú®Ô∏è We will definitely be back!
Our waitress was really wonderful.  Very knowledgeable about the menu and gave us really sound advice about quantities of food to order.  Highly, highly recommend!
Great food but very pricey. Staff were amazing and brought me a happy birthday dessert! Will def be back

What a fantastic night, food was amazing the service top notch! Johann looked after me and my uncle and made sure we were well looked after.

We have been to Gingerboy a few times now and it is still the benchmark in Melbourne asian fusion restaurants. Every dish is impressive with beautiful flavours, creativity and very high quality ingredients. Along with the amazing food, the service is always on point and friendly, thanks Johann. Gingerboy is an absolute must go.

Celebrated my birthday here with friends on Saturday night. It was fabulous!! The food was amazing, the service was outstanding and the restaurant manager Arthur was an absolute delight!‚Ä¶I highly recommend it!!
Amazing food we had the banquet, will be back

We got in last minute for a Saturday night, amazing customer service and experience. Oysters, dumplings and crispy pork belly were delicious, as were the cocktails. The staff member serving our table, Hershaw (hoping my spelling is right?) was knowledgeable with the menu to help make recommendations and made the night memorable by organising a surprise dessert for our anniversary! So lovely and attentive, thank you Hershaw.

Bar staff are not helpful or friendly. We were told by one girl that certain beers were available for the happy hour special only to be overcharged and told by another staff member that the beer we ordered wasn't included after being poured, and forced to pay full price. Terrible service.
Very rude staff
Went on Sat 11 Dec, early afternoon. My wife wanted to taste a wine before she bought one, but the bar girl was so rude, she decided to pass altogether.

I used to work nearby so Laconda was my local.  But now even after more than a year of working at the other side of Melbourne I keep going back.  We almost always start our Friday nights there.  Great, friendly staff.  And love happy hour!
Excite your taste buds with the signature house dryed beef steak and yummy porterhouse steak ü•©, it was perfect. The Expresso Martini is on another level. ‚Ä¶

Fantastic cocktails and such friendly staff.  There chefs really  know there trade well. The steak was beautifully prepared and presented extremely well on the plate. We had three different cut of meat and they were all cook to perfection. Our family really enjoyed a great night out

We had a small lunch reception after a registry wedding at Locanda Private Dining and Deli. The events sales coordinator Emma was so helpful with any requests before the event.  Sheyenne, Daniel and Nancy made sure the lunch event went so smoothly. Their customer service exceeded my expectations. They were on point, helpful and friendly to all guests.  The staff also helped me to setup the venue perfectly. I was just floored when I arrived to see how beautiful it all came!  The food was amazing and so beautifully present from the yummy canapes to the plated meals! Our guests were so happy and left full.  I'd also like to thank the Chef for presenting our wedding cake so beautifully with fresh berries and cream.  As a bride with a hospitality and events background, I would highly recommend Locanda for any events in the future.  THANK YOU TEAM!

Liam is a fantastic drinks technician, happy, friendly service from all bar staff. Will be back again when we come back to the city, recommend go before happy hour as Liam will make drinks to your taste and is more than happy to explain what goes into the drinks, has the best people skills of ANY cocktail technician I've had the pleasure of meeting. Liam thank you for the great service and conversation.
Don't waste your money here. The only good thing about it is the lovely staff. The worst risotto we have ever been served and the crispy skin duck was not rendered and therefore not crispy skinned.

Great location plenty of outdoor seating. Has a happy hour but be sure to check the menu.

We had our wedding reception dinner here. The staff were all very friendly and the space was amazing. The staff were very accommodating with our requests as well. The food was delicious and we had a few different options as well and each dish was delicious. Fantastic space and worth every cent!

My partner and I booked Locanda‚Äôs Deli Private Dining Room for an intimate dinner with our families after getting married at the Registry Office. Communication with the events team - Kate and Jenelle - was great, very fast and helpful! The feasting menu was a perfect amount for the 10 of us and was all so delicious! The restaurant manager, Nancy, and the servers were all very helpful and friendly The room itself was absolutely gorgeous, we could have left it as is (but I would recommend a couple of floral arrangements and some candles to anyone wanting to do something similar) It was a very affordable evening as well and we felt as though we weren‚Äôt taken advantage of just because we were celebrating a wedding. We had an amazing evening and we couldn‚Äôt have been happier!
