Very overpriced.  Staff were great,  food would have been ok at half the price.

Sad to have to give a negative review but honestly we did not have a good time here tonight. I came for the cheese but was disappointed that the chalkboard selection has vanished and now you get 3 cheeses of their choice. This included a very average cheddar I would never have chosen. I asked about condiments and was assured there was ‚Äòa selection‚Äô. What I got was a sad pile of soaked sultanas only.  My wife fared equally badly although it was really her fault. She ordered Snapper with sides of broccolini and chips. She didn‚Äôt realise the snapper was raw, ceviche style. Her fault but you‚Äôd hope in a restaurant of this quality that the waiter might notice that the customer may not be aware the fish is raw.  Not great  Ps Thanks for your response. Your condescension and insincerity noted.
atmosphere good. mixology knowledge slim. I‚Äôd stick to ordering anything they dont make themselves.

Punch Lane has a stunning menu, space and atmosphere. The wine choices were wonderful and the food was delicious and beautifully presented. My husband took me on our first date to Punch Lane 10 years ago, and we returned last week for our 5 year wedding anniversary to find that it was still the perfect date venue.

Simply delicious! Had a lovely meal at Punch Lane - ordered the salad, pumpkin gnocchi and chocolate ganache. Every dish was so full of flavour - the gnocchi were like like pillows that melted in your mouth and paired nicely with the smoked cheese and pumpkin pur√©e! The chocolate ganache was to die for - will probably go back tomorrow for another!
Fantastic wine selection and food was I'd say inspired by french but very modern.  Staff really happy to help.
Great service and very welcoming vibe. The toastie was a yummy late night snack! Camilla and Dennis were awesome!
Amazing. Always.  Try the bread. You won't regret it.
Great food, great wine. Very attentive staff. And dud I mention how great the food was? A gem in Melbourne!
Fantastic service, great food, the inside vibe is definitely wintery but still very nice. Would recommend , try the duck.

This is my most reliable wine bar in Melbourne and located top end (Spring St) of Little Bourke St. Great selection of wines, nibbles, and great ambience. If I don't visit here on my trips I have not been to Melbourne.
Tasty lamb and john dory.... oysters were tasty. Wine list is solid.
Intimate atmosphere. Passionate, experienced and personal service. It was a lovely and indulgent date spot.

We haven‚Äôt yet had the pleasure of eating at Punch Lane but the reason for this review is to note how wonderful their customer service was when I had to cancel our reservation as we had become sick with covid. I had booked and paid for the Valentines Day dinner and when spoke with Jane and told her what had happened, she immediately offered to refund me or give me a credit. She was so kind and understanding and made everything so easy. I can‚Äôt wait to go and eat there in the future!

My mum and I dined at Punch Lane last night and it was amazing. From the booking process right through to paying the account. All the wait staff were outstanding, going above and beyond. From finding us burrata that we were so keen on having, to letting us try a certain wine before buying. The margaritas were amazing and the gentleman didn‚Äôt even mind my mum asking for certain ingredients. I have already recommended Punch Lane to all my Melbourne friends and I‚Äôll be sure to recommend to any visitors from QLD. The food was delicious, we loved the burrata and the swordfish. The wine was lovely, I‚Äôd be keen to see what specials pop up using the coravin. If I lived in Melbourne, this would be a local for me.

I recently TRIED to visit Punch Lane Wine Bar and was extremely disappointed with my experience.  As someone who uses a wheelchair, I felt discriminated against and dismissed by the staff. They called me on the day of my reservation (I booked weeks in advance). The attitude of the staff was rude and unaccommodating, making me feel uncomfortable and unwelcome. Staff repeated it 3 times to me, as a heritage building they were not required to comply with ‚Äúaccessibility requirements‚Äù. They also mentioned the very ‚Äúpetite toilets‚Äù which made me feel like I shouldnt even try using the bathroom.  I understand that heritage buildings are not required to change the build. However, it‚Äôs the consideration and delivery of the message which made me feel so excluded. To make matters worse, there were no options provided to accommodate my needs. I drove past and saw there were tables outside on the footpath which would have been perfect for me.  I was extremely disappointed with my attempted visit to Punch Lane Wine Bar.  Update:  I Appreciate the owner for responding. However, they were not part of the conversation and I am entitled to how I feel. Please do not compare disabled individuals and their accessibility requirements - everyone is different.  Completely understand and agree Melbourne weather is unpredictable. It could have still been mentioned and provided. I apologise to the owner as I understand that this is your livelihood and have since updated my review.  However, front of house staff are a reflection of the business‚Äô value and service. I do believe the whole situation would have been different if I had spoken to the  owner who has lived experiences having a loved one with a disability. But this was not my experience. I think some training and empathy from staff was all I was looking for.  There is no need for a phone call. I also wish you and your restaurant all the best.
Punch is a laneway staple in Melbourne. Always consistent, good service, good food and good staff. It's at the top end of town, so a bit pricey, which is the only downside.
Always wonderful service, and quality wine and cocktail options

We were a party of 6 for dinner. The restaurant and service was A1. The food was tasty and very nice however the portion sizes were tiny and at the prices charged didn't feel like it was good value I'm sorry. $18 for two small croquets. If it wasn't that I ordered fries as well you would be leave hungry.  I want to go back again great atmosphere but for food they need to increase portion sizes.

We were greeted with open arms by Camilla and led to a lovely laid table in a wonderfully cool dining room as Melbourne sweltered at 38 degrees. Drinks were promptly served and then we were introduced to Coco who looked after us for the next 2 hours. Food was sublime, quality paramount. Sharing is the idea. Portions we thought were perfect, not huge and that‚Äôs a good thing. You can see the love put into offering superb produce. We had the scallops (1 each), the steak tartare  - sensational (1 each) and then shared 2 large of the Gnocci (superb) & lamb (cooked to perfection). Then finished with the 2 desserts on offer, a Cr√®me fra√Æche bavarois & Valrhona chocolate fondant, both highly recommend. An amazing meal that highly recommend and will visit again when next in Melbourne. Thanks Camilla for your effervescent & hospitality. Great team work.

Called in tonight with a group of 6 , bar was only quarter full, waited for over half and hour for the useless staff to Not find us a bottle of their wine off their wine menu Finally had a drink from a second choice that still took another 10 minutes to locate , really ! Two staff one duty more concerned about cleaning up than customers
Very disappointing. I was not wowed by the food and it was very noisy.
Swordfish starter was amazing ü§© We had the steak for main which was unbelievable also, dessert was a little underwhelming though unfortunately.
Best food ever. Delicious it was. Thanks guys.

Highly recommended place on a weekday.  Went here on a wednesday eve right before seeing a show at her majesty's theatre.  Banquet is the best option if it's your first time. Highly recommend the somtam salad. You can ask to make the spice to a mild level if you have low tolerance for spicy food.  Nice interior decor as well as fixings. A nice touch on the coat rack that is placed near your table instead of a central location.  10/10 will definitely come back
Me and a friend had the Pre-theatre set menu and were blown away by the food. Absolutely delicious and will definitely be going back again!

Disappointing, sad experience of what used to be a favourite in Sydney. Waited 20 mins to be acknowledged by staff sat at bar table for one. Food arrived quicker than believable that a chef had prepared it, or even reheated it to warm enough to eat. Tough beef curry, def not worth the price. Trendy stemless wineglass made for disappointing glass of shiraz to match. Reputation is one thing, delivery is another with so much competition in the area...competitor across the road full with people queuing for tables. I'll wait in line next time!

Food was delicious and cocktails are very good. Service from our waitress Helena was outstanding. She accommodated our adjustments to the dishes and drinks with a smile and professionalism. Will definitely return for round 2 at Longrain.
It was a great experience and the food was scrumptious. Really friendly and helpful service made the experience even better. Kudos to our waitress Helena. We will definitely come back ü§ó ‚Ä¶
love this place and would love to go back soon! High quality food and unbeatable service, The Betel leaf appetizer was a refreshing way to start. Lamb ribs and coconut chicken was simply delicious.
Really amazing and tasty food. The restaurant is beautiful and the serving staff were really professional.
Excellent food!Highly recommend.
üòç

Im Regular longrain sydney customer. But today‚Äôs experience at longrain melbourne was very unacceptable. We have to wait for 1 hour for the food , we ordered 3 caramelized pork belly and 2 of them are overcooked , it was very difficult to bite the crispy part  tough to eat. Also we have to wait another 40 mins for the ice cream.  Furthermore, we handled by the rude and impolite waiter ( girl).She answered all the question with the high tone when we ask her  to explain one more time. And also she put the spoon without a napkin / plate on the dirty table for our dessert and got very angry when we asked for the new spoon. She took all the spoon from our table with bad attitude and throw all the spoon very hard into the dishwasher. I was amazed that one of the waiter in longrain could do that to their customer. 5 stars place 5 stars price 1 star service and attitude. Tamarine fish was delicious Eggnet was delicious  Definetly wont come back to the place that cost you $100+  / person and the place which asked 10% for service charge when we were not being serviced politely. Totally different with the one in sydney. Its sad when the other team work very hard but the frontliner cannot do the job properly.  Cheers to the manager who tried to calm us down, you did a great job. but i am sorry your waiter attitude is unacceptable..

Very bad services from waiter Her name is phim or phom Clean -10 Experience -10 Arrogant +10 The food came out very slow. The waiter put the spoon on the dirty table without napkin and get very angry when we asked for new spoon because the spoon is dirty.  The caramelized pork is overcooked. Definetly will not come back to this place. I am Regular longrain customer in sydney
Innovative menu of seriously good tasting food. All four dishes that we ate were yummy. Service was friendly and helpful and food arrived in a timely manner. Enjoyed the ambience of the venue

I was severely disappointed with this restaurant. I was expecting a near fine dinning experience (the price range would suggest so). But what I found was:  - Food; not better than Thai town and DoDee. The presentation is somehow more curated, but the flavours are similar.  - service: this was the biggest disappointment. Two interactions with the waiter made us very uncomfortable. I believe that in Melboune food wastage should be avoided at all cost. When I asked for a container to pack 3 plates we had barely touched (we over ordered) the waitress made us feel very uncomfortable with it. "We don't usually do this here.... I will see if I can find something... You are lucky we had this containers... We continued to smile and nod. I can't believe that at this day and age your restaurant promotes food waste.  The second time was when. It was time to pay. The bill was brought to the table unannounced. Payment terminal in hand. This is with the rest of the restaurant having 50% of the tables occupied, not that we were last. I had my phone off, because I like to do so when I am dinning and it is of no one's business if I do so. When I announced to the waitress that it would take a couple of minutes for the phone to turn on and be able to pay. I was expecting for her to go and return in 2 or 3 minutes but instead she stayed the whole time by the table and I terrupted twice our conversation to ask: - is it on already? - do you not carry a card? It literally took less than 2 minutes for the phone to turn on and she was rolling her eyes.  Overall, very disappointed

This was my second here and it didn't disappoint. I love the Little Bourke St location close to the Princess Theatre. It's a roomy restaurant with loads of atmosphere. Don't miss the saltbush sticky lamb ribs. The cured king fish was also fresh and zesty. The betel leaf entrees were also fantastic. I thought the southern red curry we had could have been a little hotter and spicier
Great place for formal dinner, fancy but the food was hit and miss. With some things just too small, or just too experimental so it didn't quite taste right. Expensive but service was excellent.

It‚Äôs been a couple of years between visits and the first impression they made upon arrival was abysmal. No one to greet you as you enter the restaurant so I loitered for a bit before tentatively venturing in. By the time someone appeared they attempted to unlock the iPad to find my reservation but didn‚Äôt know the passcode so off they went to find someone to advise and returned to try again.  This happened a further three times asking different people for the code on each trip before they eventually managed to unlock it (after accidentally setting it to camera mode and me helpfully advising how to turn it off). At this stage quite a queue had formed behind me and it struck me as quite clunky and unprofessional.  The bill came to around $115 a head for the banquet and two bottles of wine which is probably not too bad (if you are drinking the wine which I wasn‚Äôt but $89 for the food given we added the egg net) and I appreciated the way they made adjustments to the menu as typically when it‚Äôs a set menu I eat around my food requirements/preferences but when I advised them I didn‚Äôt eat oysters or pork they accommodated with different dishes that they accommodated the pescatarian and vegetarian with.  As we were a group of 8 the set menu was obligatory. As per my memory of the last visit the food is largely on the hot side but this was more my preferred spice level and absolutely delicious. Previously you could never book a table so I don‚Äôt know if this change was because it was a Tuesday night, we were a large group or due to covid but regardless it‚Äôs far more convenient.  Update My friend and I found ourselves at Longrain again but were sad to see it‚Äôs no longer in the entertainment book (which I should stop buying as I have not used it once). This is maybe the only hatted restaurant where you actually feel really full after. They don‚Äôt take bookings and you sit on communal tables but it is defintely worth it for this delicious modern Thai.  Penang curry was a tad hot luckily the cocktails are a pure delight (not to mention rather lethal) and the list is super-extensive. Order the banana leaf salmon. Do it  Original review Longrain is one of my friends favourite restaurants and whenever she is in town from interstate we tend to pay a visit. At over ten years old it was doing Asian fusion before all of the rest of Melbourne jumped on the bandwagon and it is still so iconic today that you will inevitably be waiting for a table regardless of what day it is.  I don't mind the wait so much as it has become a bit of a tradition for us to sip on a cocktail as we linger praying for someone to leave. Cocktail wise I favour the sweet fruitiness of the ping pong while my dining companion sticks to the freshness of the caiprioska. Both very tasty. I love the atmosphere which perfectly suits a special occasion or date night but works equally well for a dinner with friends (if you're friends are willing to spend up big on Thai that is).  The egg net is kind of obligatory but I personally adore the king prawns and the coconut poached chicken. So much delicious flavour it's actually insane. Do ask the waiters regarding the spice level of your chosen dishes if you can't tolerate a lot of heat because the food does tend to pack a punch (just order more cocktails). A beautiful space, seamless service and an electric atmosphere
10% discretionary charge for bookings over 8!!! What? An extra 10% on over a $1000, wow. Sorry for bringing in more business. This is bizarre

Last week I had lunch at Longrain for an event. The food was amazing and the service was extremely efficient. When I left I realised I had left my umbrella under the table. I rang and spoke to a Michael or Steven (not sure) and I do realise it was only an umbrella, but he asked around and rang me back to let me know it was there. I could not get back there for over a week, but when I went in on a busy Saturday night I was advised from the lady at reception that it was upstairs and to go up and ask for Noah. I went up and Noah handed me my umbrella. Now it might have only been an umbrella, but I was amazed at how I was treated and the efficiency of everyone at Longrain. Thank you very much. I will certainly be going back there for a meal.

Another banquet $85pp booking is getting harder so do book in advance , common to see it fully Book and the options for their other locations pop up so don‚Äôt get confused . Overall the food quality was fanatic , staff very friendly , we had a birthday they held our cake in the fridge and lighted the candles for us . Overall great night . Heads up Zero parking so you will need go Up one block to find a park .
Very tasty food. One thing that I‚Äôd change, replace chips with some good quality bread and butter ;)
Loved the late night gnocchi and a glass of wine after going to a show nearby. Menu looked very inviting!
Perfect in every way. Relaxed attentive and food is amazing.

First timers and grabbing a meal before a show, so location was the key, but now we know how amazing the service and food is we will be frequent visitors/diners. Our host was fabulous and guided us through the menu and wine perfectly. We are all still telling anyone who will listen it was the BEST steak we have ever had, and the share plate was plenty enough for 3 people. Great restaurant, and I would highly recommend it for any occasion.
Lovely

Really great ambience. Cosy yet chic.  My colleagues seemed to really like the coffee. My only gripe was the somewhat limited range of non-coffee hot beverages. I was told they didn't stock chai or similar, which tends to be a cafe staple these days. The tea I had was fine but nothing particularly memorable.
One of the most amazing dining experiences. The food, the atmosphere, the service... Such a special place for an anniversary. Will definitely be back!
Excellent food, service, and atmosphere - a great night out.
Always a wonderful experience. Best of Melbourne.
Amazing food and service!
Excellent food friendly staff

Tr√®s ordinaire! üòï This restaurant is much hyped but the service and food does not match its reputation. Firstly the service was lackluster bordering on indifferent. We had to wait ages for our first drinks and even longer for the courses to arrive. Mistakes were made with the ordering and things forgotten. We had to ask repeatedly for simple things like water to be refilled. The 250gm porterhouse steak ($52) was served on a cold plate and I had to wait for the sauce and frites to arrive while my fellow diners already had their meals. Why would a high-end establishment allow a steak to leave the pass without the accompaniments? The steak was not the delicious melt-in-the mouth medium-rare I was expecting. It was dry and chewy at one end, raw at the other end and sinewy in the middle. Very disappointing. I should have sent it back to the kitchen but really didn‚Äôt want a drama to spoil our family celebration. The desserts were nice enough but not exceptional. Overall an expensive and very ordinary dining experience.

Poor service and poor staffing interest. Couldn‚Äôt find their listed wine. Just had to leave. Interstate visitor. Melbourne generally has gone to the pack. Won‚Äôt be back while it‚Äôs a socialist collective

Nice European style restaurant with a selection of food and drink options, mainly European choices.  I ordered the pommes frites with aioli, pecorino salad, and the gnocchi dish and all tasted delicious!  Very friendly and capable staff members and lovely tables outside...  Constructive feedback for the female toilet... It wasn't very clean when I used it, however, giving the fact that the restaurant is European - style it reminds of the European continent...
Service and food are always an absolute 10 out of 10
This shop no longer offer's different size cups for coffee's etc.. To pay in excess of $5..for a standard coffee's a rip-off..there's nothing special about it's taste..
Second time around. They always have a great selection of wines. We also particularly loved the Tongue and Escargot dish. The Bordelaise sauce that accompanied it was outstanding!

It was second time after lockdown. I think taste was lil bit different to me. More healthier taste than before. I don‚Äôt know it is good or not. Maybe my tongue has changed. I‚Äôd like to try again soon.
Coffee cups seem to get smaller every time I go here. No  good value.

Oh, Red Pepper, what have they done to you? This was my go-to restaurant when visiting Melbourne. Fantastic food, decent prices, and that special buzz you get when visiting a place at the top of its game. None of those apply any more. My heart is broken.

Nicely made Indian food which had authentic tastes of all the masalas required to prepare an Indian food . Both the hosts were wonderful & took really good care of us. No hush hush during ordering & while eating was the USP of the place. Quality & taste of the Tandoori Naan ü´ì was fabulous & must try !!!

I had Bhang Chicken with a Garlic naan and was an absolute delight. On taste authenticity scale, it totally beats all the other Indian joints in CBD. I never thought I would leave a good review about a naan but it was so good too!!  Reservation process was a little sketchy but I think Sat night rush.
Best place I ever been in cbd. Fantastic food and customer service üëçüëç ‚Ä¶
Food was fantastic, sarso da saag was amazing,

The best Indian restaurant in CBD with the amazing vibe and a good food.This place has a good ambience to chill out with family, friends. If you got a chance to visit melbourne and you don‚Äôt get to go here it will be your biggest regret.Please do visit for the quality Indian food with the most affordable price‚Äôs.

All other Indian restaurants were jam-packed. We got a table in this restaurant.  It was good that we got our dinner, but after eating their food I realised the reason why their tables were available.
I haven‚Äôt been here in a while and I ordered the goat curry. It was the best goat curry I‚Äôve had in Melbourne. Wait staff were so lovely. I will recommend this place as a must try for goat curry.
Very tasty food, homely environment and amazing service

It‚Äôs was one of my favorite place during my travel in Australia ! I tried a lot of different starters and mains ! And my favorite is the vegetable pakora with butter chicken.  Good place - Good food - Good staff - Good moment

If i have to recommend a restaurant, i must advice you the red pepper which is a perfect place in the CBD. The food Is absolutely excellent and the staff very firendly. It feels like home, you can go with your eyes closed.

I had heard a lot about this place through colleagues but this was my first time there. I would say I am never walking in again due to the poor service and lack of options on their menu.  Drinks - Didn't have half the drinks on their menu. After one round of Glen Fiddich, the team comes over and says they don't have anymore of the same drink. They don't have options available! Same with the beer mentioned on their menu.  Starters / Appetizers - Real poor menu if you wanted to munch on something before you ordered your main course. We ordered each of the five things (2 non veg and 3 veg dishes) on the menu. The non veg dishes arrived in 20 mins and the 3 veg dishes arrived 60 mins later, with the main course.  Staff - Kept pushing us that we had to order our main course along with the appetizers! Would not take No for an answer. They didn't even know the names of drinks on their own menu and had to keep rushing back to the bar to check if they had the drink available. When our single malt round 1 was over and they didn't have any left with them, the staff got whatever they had available, on a tray - with none of them being single malt and they kept forcing us to order something.  Mains - Would like to state that this was possibly the only thing that all 11 of us enjoyed. Some amazing dishes and the chef knew what they were cooking. The only saviour to the price we paid for the food.

Highly recommended for a pre-show meal! Very conveniently located near the theatres. We had a delicous dinner here before our show. It was quick and still relaxing. The service was friendly and very accommodating. Will return.
Had a very enjoyable night here with a group of 4 friends. Tasty food and delicious naan. The servers were quite friendly and helpful.

Had a reservation for 7:30pm, got there a few minutes early. Staff were walking around unsure where to seat us. Ended up seating us right next to the door, I asked if we could sit somewhere else and were told no as this was the only table set up for two people. They then proceeded to sit other groups of two at larger tables. People were walking in with bookings and were told "we will try find a table for you". Staff were very unorganised. Food was okay but nothing great.
The food is still amazing however the place has become smaller. Restrooms are on the first floor.

I ordered the Kashmiri lamb and it was advertised as a medium hot dish, however it had no spice at all. It could have been an off night, but it was a little bland. Lamb was tender and the naan was good. Service was not great.

Nothing like old red pepper .  Service 0/10 takes ages for simple items to come out of kitchen .  Menu - the whole menu has been revised and only 10 % items available.  What a shame. After so many visits hate to say but last visit .

Being a Indian cuisine restaurant the difference between dry and curry chicken is not known to the staff. If you are not sure then please check with the chef before confirming the order. Also in the menu there is no starter option but on their billing machine they have the option.
I recommend this place if you like real Indian food, I took a Kadhai paneer by takeaway and it‚Äôs was better than what I expected !
Perfect place to enjoy some spicy and typical food from India, I recommend you the bhang chicken it was lovely
It is not a really Indian food. Only names looks like india. Please try to use Indian original spices.
superb restaurant with typical dishes that respect traditions.  Super accessible and good atmosphere
Manager had a poor attitude
Such an excellent place for drinks
It's gone downhill. The main lounge is closed and the wine list by the glass is limited instead of marvellous. Go downstairs to the Wine Room or the European instead.
Had a great night, good bar staff, active and engaging, food was on point

Great sparkling wine from Yarra Valley, as a French person and a Champagne enthousiaste I really enjoy it ü•∞ The place looks like you‚Äôre in someone‚Äôs place, so the feeling of being a privileged person is here üòè You can buy yourself a cigare too ! I totally recommend this place for a date!

Supper club use to be great, food quality has gone down and service is lacking lately staff standing around talking. Supper clubs butchers board use to be amazing now just a disappointment. On the plus side polenta chips are still the go to!

Funny, quirky place. Not my style. It's too pretentious for my taste, but I can see how other people would enjoy it. It looks like a good place for middle-aged fancy gay men, or for straight couples on a late-night date.  The entrance isn't clearly marked, which presumably ads to the "exclusive" atmosphere.  It's definitely not cheap, but it has liberal opening hours, and the kitchen is open until late (like 3am or so). I only ate here once, and the food was OK.  There's better value late-night food around the corner at "Butcher's Diner", but people come to the Supper Club mostly for drinks and the atmosphere.
Best Sticky Date, must order!

Accessed via a single unassuming timber door from the street, and pirched on a landing atop a narrow stairway, The Melbourne Supper Club boasts a classic interior with a beautiful large round window overlooking plain trees and enormous classical paintings. Burgundy paint casts a moody ambiance, lit with candles and soft lightening. The staff are highly attentive and the menu extensive, offering tapas and main options, suitable for individuals or to share. The drinks menu offers options of every kind, including wine, spirits and beer from around the world.

Great for a late night wine or an afternoon coffee. This is by far one of my favourite bars in Melbourne. Its intimate and welcoming, full of old world charm. Be sure to get a seat near their icon window over looking parliament house!
The one saving grace is.... the polenta chips at 2am
Love this place great food & wine with roof top Cuban cigars
Greate ambience and service. Thank you for excellent drink recommendations.
Traditional style restaurant/cafe with professional waiters and quality food, wine and coffee
Great service and great menu.

You might think that a restaurant called Waiters would have exceptional service. In fact, this was the first restaurant I have ever walked out of in my 56 years.  I arrived at 12 for my lunch booking and was served at about 12:10. Before saying anything else, the waiter, who I think was the owner, stated that I needed to order quickly as my booking finished at 1 o‚Äôclock. I responded that I had booked the day before and had not been told there was a limited seating time. Rather than apologise or try to find a solution, he told me that I was incorrect, and that I would have been told that I had to be out by one. I politely insisted that I had not been told that I was to be out by one, and stated that if I had of been informed it was an hour booking I would not of booked as we were expecting to have a long conversation over a long lunch.  Again, he told me I was incorrect, and walked away. As he left he said ‚Äúif you decide to stay, the special board is over there‚Äù.  My lunch guest, who I had never met before, and I looked at each other, laughed and left. And luckily found a very nice Italian restaurant around the corner where we had a terrific meal with great service.

It was everything I remembered from 35years ago Great simple homely atmosphere Chalkboard menu , no prices Cheeky glass of red and a fantastic meal. Osso Bucco to die for , stunning flavours and melt in your mouth meat. Chicken and mushroom fettuccine,  simple tasty and not drowned in too many flavours, Pure!!! Tasty herb bread A perfect meal. Good value and full of memories

Great pasta and quite a popular place.  I got the ravioli napoli which had amazing flavour and taste. The portion is enough to be satisfied from the meal.  Expect to spend $30 for a pasta here. I would also recommend booking in advance.

Have been dining here on and off since mid-70s and first time back in over 3 years - not much has changed. Food is home style Italian done very nicely, wine is basically house selections in recycled bottles drunk from average glasses but for $35 for a bottle of very good Shiraz, not average wine. Saltimbocca cooked properly, tiramisu for dessert a lesson in how to do it authentically  - soft biscuits soaked in dry masala and a beautiful cream topping, superb.  Three courses for 3 people, including drinks, $210 which is great value. Service is excellent, atmosphere the same as always. Basic tables and chairs, chalkboard menus. Very relaxed and completely booked out.
Great food and atmosphere with an interesting history. Loved it.
Al dente!
Traditional rustic Italian food! Always busy, always consistent and the best!
Highly recommended for pasta & garlic bread. 5*
Loved my first experience at the waiter‚Äôs restaurant, I will be back more frequently hope to see the friendly staff again and to eat your amazing food.
Very engaging staff, great service and the food is like a home cooked meal. Be prepared for how popular and busy it is. Everybody is welcomed.

Hidden in an alleyway, up the stairs to this traditional gorgeous authentic restaurant. It was a packed dining room but service was prompt and the food was absolutely divine! You have to call to book, menu is on the chalkboard (without prices though) but  I just love how traditionally authentic the experience was - if you‚Äôre looking for a quality Italian experience, this is your place!
One of the best Italian restaurants in Melbourne!
Food like nonna used to cook it. Crowded, cramped, noisy but wonderful! If you like peasant Italian food you'll love it...

I'm not sure why the reviews are so high here.  They don't take bookings and when you arrive and there are empty seats you still get sent away for 30min? Waiters weren't friendly. There is no menu and everything is written on the board with no prices. The portion sizes were small and taste was sub par.  Spaghetti marinara $31.50, small in size and just average in taste.  Mushroom risotto $25.00. edible but not good.  Spaghetti carbonara $25.00 was pretty terrible. Boiled spaghetti, hardly any seasoning and a few pieces of meat... If this is their standard, it is worse than most home chefs.  I wouldn't spend any money here. There are many nice Italian restaurants in Melbourne and this is not one of them.
Delicious pasta!!! Would definitely come back again.
Been to Italy numerous times and had amazing meals-but Waiters stacks up with any place I've been to in Italy
lovely food ( pappardelle al funghi) and host. Thanks for having me
Reasonable priced deliciy
Having returned to this restaurant after quite some time, I still love this place!
Needs salt.
It was delicious!! It seems like a good value for money restaurant.

Great spot up the North end of the CBD, me and my partner are getting to as many cheap eats places as possible in the CBD, and Butchers Diner is no exception to the myth busting - you CAN get great food on a budget in the city!  We had the Cheeseburger with bacon, and a Chilli dog! The hand cut chips are so good, they were a real standout on their own right. Both dishes were smashing, and we got out of there for less than $50 for the two of us. Excellent food, and a great bustling hustle, ques of people, and tons of things happening.  Definitely headed back, and couldn't believe how good the market special was on the day we visited - aged rib eye with chips & salad for $34!?!! Crazy cheap!
Great burgers. Nothing instagram fancy, just good quality ingredients. Good selection of craft beers too.
Wish I came a day later to try the Reuben, but the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich is was DELICIOUS!
A fun, communal eatery. It is a narrow venue so wheelchair users may find it difficult to find a place. The food was fantastic and the bacon was beyond belief good. Reasonable prices.
Enjoyed the chilli dog and ribs, but not 100% sold on the cracked pepper gravy used on the poutine. Would still recommend!
Simple, fresh ingredients handled with skill equates to the best burgers in Melbourne (IMHO).
Cheeseburger, chips and a drink for $27 - not bad for a late night feed, cheeseburger was pretty good with the onion, tomato and pickles cutting the grease of the patty!

Asked what‚Äôs good and was recommended the beef skewers, completely exceeded my expectations. Best quality meat I‚Äôve had in a long while. Short wait even at peak hour, lovely service. This meat is a reminder of how to properly respect the animals we eat.
Cool place with display of aged meat
Love going here after a late weeknight movie and yelling ‚Äúhey, I‚Äôm waaalkin‚Äô here‚Äù as I cross the street to get my succulent meal provided by democracy manifest. Can‚Äôt beat it.
Solid burger joint when you're after something that's not a restaurant or a fast food. Service was quick and the food ok at a reasonable price. Wine selection was good with half bottle options.
Ordered the blood sausage and devilled egg roll, cheeseburger with bacon, and potato salad. All of it was excellent. Potato salad balanced out the heavy burger and roll. Bacon was so crisp. Yum!
We ordered two sandwiches and meat in both felt overcooked and chewy. Both sandwiches were dry. Still tasty but not what I was looking forward to.
A good place worth to go for a quick lunch. I hang out with my boyfriend, and we order an island chilli hot dog and a small chip. The food is incredible but a little pricy for us.
Delicious food and the staff were lovely too
Great place great food

Have been to Butchers diner a number of times pre and post COVID.  Normally I don‚Äôt leave reviews but couldn‚Äôt help to this time as my visit on Saturday 01/04 was shocking- and as a result I will not be returning.  Firstly, the staff member seemed uninterested and unhelpful and I would be understanding of this if the restaurant was busy but there was a total of 5 people at that time.  The food arrived on time but how disappointing!!  The octopus & Chinese sausage skewer was ridiculously small, the tuna skewer was super overcooked and it was difficult to tell if it was chicken or tuna- both items were totally overpriced for what we got.  The only saving grace was the blood sausage roll and chilli dog (but how difficult really is it to make one of these) and the can of hard peach iced tea.  Will not return and would not recommend!!!!

I paid 25+ AUD for a cheeseburger with bacon as well as a side of regular fries.  The burger patty was quite tasty but I didn‚Äôt like that it was well done. I wasn‚Äôt asked about the preferred doneness of the patty so it came out on the tough side.  The fries were EXTREMELY SALTY. I didn‚Äôt enjoy the fries at all.  I don‚Äôt think much of this place.
One of the best burgers in town
My must stop eatery when I'm in Melbourne. Get there on a Thursday and order the ruban.

This place had been in our saved list for a while, and on 18 March we finally made time to visit!  We got: ü•™ Baked French Dip Roll ($19) This was the reason for our visit, a Saturday special that Andrew was soo excited to try. Unfortunately, it was quite average. We were hoping for a beefy broth dip and melting cheese on the sandwich, but they‚Äôre lacking on both. The only good part was the roll was loaded with the beef slices which was tasty!  üç∞ Tiramisu ($12) This was good, but not great. Nice soft creamy texture but missing that coffee kick that we wanted on a tiramisu. For the price, we could get a better Tiramisu elsewhere.  ü•î Patatas Bravas (Special $16) This dish was sooo disappointing, even remembering it makes me wanna cry! For a place that highlights their meat, the meat they chose to put on this dish was very appalling. There‚Äôs no beef texture in the chili (my cat food honestly had better beef chunks üò≠), the cheese wasn‚Äôt even melted, the chips were alright but this wasn‚Äôt helping.  For a place that‚Äôs rated quite high (4.5 stars on google at the time of this review), we‚Äôre so shocked at the quality we receive. We wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place, but if you still want to give them a try please skip the items we got above to avoid disappointment! üò¢
Food was great, service was nice, only be aware that it‚Äôs located on third floor with a tad dodgy staircase. Also heaters could have been more efficient

Really good place to go and have drinks and food with friends at any time ‚Ä¶ the staff is very friendly , ready to help you with anything, I had the best paella and sangria ever thanks to the Chefs ..really recommend to go.

It's such a beautiful place to go and enjoy having some drinks, but it's expensive and a place you need to book yourself into, not just showing up for a few and a few stairs to walk up to get to there floors.

Great little venue, nice atmosphere even when packed and stunning views. Wife threatened me with nastiness about halfway up the stairs to get there, so i was hoping the venue would redeem me, which it definitely didüòÇ Ordered a lime cocktail, which the bartender has never made before, so they got help from another bartender, and he was great with them, and despite the busy bar, made sure they were comfortable to make the cocktail... Wide said it was fresh and lovely! All cocktails looked kinda sweet, so I asked if they could make me a whiskey sour, which they did without question, and it was fantastic. Prices were excellent, and the vibe and view make this a return venue, Cheers

Nice rooftop with plenty of plants. It felt like a rooftop jungle. However, options for chic non-alcoholic (NA) drinks were basically zero. For e.g. Monday Distillery, Seedlip, NON, Lyres, Altina Wines, Heaps Normal...the list goes on.... It's 2023, and the NA demand has been growing rapidly since peak Covid in 2020, so I was quite disappointed with this.
Great spot for a drink in Summer sunshine or after dinner
Funky little hideaway.......needs misters for hot days. üòÅüëç ‚Ä¶

I celebrated with some drinks and food recently for my birthday at The Loop rooftop bar. It was a lovely ambiance with cool tunes. Laura the staff member made us feel welcome with her attentiveness, friendliness and professionalism. I highly recommend this venue. We also attended a comedy sketch on level 1 which was great.
Always good vibes and great service! The drinks were delicious.
Venue and staff were amazing. It‚Äôs five stars from me. Favourite rooftop bar!
Ordered 2 drinks, the bartender short-poured the alcohol in both and the pre-mix is coloured water. Not really anything particularly good about the place. Not worth the 4 flights of stairs to visit.

Amazing food!! Lovely rooftop bar. Dont give 5 stars. But the food here  deserves the 5 stars! 100 % will return. And strongly reccomend  this  place.  Been three times. Now since 1st review. Food is the main reason for our visit. Best calamari we have tasted. Michelin star quality. Freindly staff and lovely cold drinks.  If visiting Melbourne this has to be 1st on the list.
One of Melb's best rooftop bars, great staff and views, fantastic atmosphere

The kitchen regularly closes at 9 and the business stays opens significantly later and there is no mention of no food service closure. It doesn‚Äôt matter how stunning a place is (which it is) if they can‚Äôt state that they have no food when they are known for food and drinks it‚Äôs unacceptable. This is even more disappointing when reservations were made.

Full marks for great customer service, amazing drinks, mouth watering food and a really speedy service. ‚ù§Ô∏è They accommodated for my extra guests on short notice and reserved a cute spot for our group on level 3. Cornelius the host is such a vibe. He is just amazing and adds to this amazing venue, he is wonderful. I don't know the French bartenders name but she is amazing too üíú  Love the botanical bar vibes and the city scapes. Thanks for everything Loop team. I'm very impressed, my birthday was a success and I surely will be back üëç

It always feels like a family run business here. The manager Mario goes out of his way to look after you, and the bar staff at night are fantastic. Have been coming here since 2016. Highly recommend you pop in for lunch or evening drinks.
Warm cosy place with welcoming staff

The food took over an hour to come out with not much attention during that time or explanation as to the delay. I saw other guests also asking about their orders. The steak was very good when it arrived.

Steaks were way too salty. Seems the chef forgot how much salt he had added that a glazed salt layer formed on the faces of the steak, just like the top of creme brulee but by salt. Way overpriced for the quality of food.

I highly recommend the scallops here since I tried from many resturants in Melbourne and found this place is the best.  It is fresh, chewy and tasty, serve with bacon. The other foods /dessert also not bad (slightly less choices than the others but all come with high quality). Staff here is freindly especially the lady name Yao. She is very helpful and hospitality/advise to customer clearly. I will visit here again when I go to Melbourne.

What a gem of a place! Peter on the bar was like an old friend, treated me brilliantly and was just amazing, he makes great cocktails too. Glen the chef was so accommodating and gave me the most amount of options to cater to my dietary requirements that I have EVER had. I selected the salmon with a medley of vegetables which was absolutely delicious.  Will I be back? Hell yes! Delicious food, superb service and staff who treated me as an old friend. What more could you ask for?

We met an international visitor staying at the hotel for a quick early dinner here. The menu had good variety and our waiter was friendly. The beef burger was good, however the fish curry arrived without any fish, which was handled professionally. Compared to Melbourne's vibrant foodie scene, the atmosphere is pretty bland, but it's nice looking out onto Flagstaff Gardens.
Excellent
Awesome customer service, great buffet breakfast. Will definitely go back.
Great. Looking forward to staying here in March

My partner and I had dinner here last night.Everything was very nice-customer service 5/5,the food 5/5 and the location as well.I didn‚Äôt get the name of the woman who was welcoming us-I guess a supervisor(in black suit)-she was very hospitable!‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

Tonight is the second time we are having dinner at HQ‚Äôs on Williams and I can say I am very impressed by the quality and taste of their dishes. All the meals very delicious. Even kids meals are of high quality. My favourite entrees were scallops and tuna tartar; main dishes: T-bone steak and duck with delicious lentils and quinoa. We are yet to try desserts, but I loved banana milkshake with a sprinkle of cinnamon on top. Members of the team are passionate and caring. They made our Christmas dinner very special. Thank you all, especially Gerrill and Sky. We are so pleased that Radisson hotel has such a great restaurant onsite.

Christmas dinner was great. They looked after my dietary requirements and I still had a delicious 3 course meal. Service was great and they showered my 4 year old granddaughter with gifts. Definitely go again
Ordered the pasta with prawns and octopus, was luke warm and octopus was that tough was inedible, wagu burger was extremely greasy, partner ate 4 bites, cocktails are very nice and well priced

This is an alright place to eat. The restaurant is light, spacious and offers a fairly relaxing environment to dine in. The staff working when I visited were great fun and attentive. I had the house burger and it was big, tasty, crunched in all the right places and oozed juices where juices should ooze. The chips and side salad that came with it did their jobs very well, but probably should have bigger portion sizes. The whole meal filled me up but only because of the size of the burger üçî, not the accompanying sides. Price wise, I didn't think my food and beer was over priced and I came out of the place thinking about how I enjoyed my meal rather than its cost. That's always a good sign. I like burgers and love to try them in eateries I haven't dined in before, and this one didn't disappoint; and I'd gladly go back to HQ's and take their burger for another test drive.

Went there with family, friends for dinner.  I ordered the T-bone steak - medium cooked.  It after quite some time, it came out and was near raw (rare) and very difficult to cut.  I sent it back to get cooked more, and this time looked better, but was near impossible to cut and eat.  DO NOT order steak, they have no idea how to cook them. Ended up going down to Crown Casino and ate in the food court.  Much better.
We are love at the Radisson hotel is the best atmosphere/ service and fantastic food
The Victorian Beef Sandwich - just perfect... Perfect....

Scrambled eggs and mushrooms were good, although the sausage and bacon were a but too salty for my liking. The tomato was a bit hard as well, but juicy. Potatoes were undercooked and bitter for some reason.  Service staff were generally great, especially the waiters, who were very professional and friendly. Can't say the same for the chef at the egg station, sadly. The guy disappears from his station most of the time, and seemed really unhappy and frustrated when I requested an extra over easy eggs on top of my omellete.  Worst of all, my order was missing when I went to the station to collect (and of course, he was conveniently missing as well...)! Some other customer must have taken them! Can only assume that either he lacks training in his job, or just really can't be bothered at all and is just there to collect pay check at the end of the day. Either way, left a bad impression on me in what was otherwise an above average dining experience. It takes one bad egg to ruin the entire omellete after all.

$30 for a burger (pictured) not amazing.. staff are always super friendly.. we have been here about 3 times because it's on entertainment book.. otherwise not worth it.. the curry dishes are excellent though, we tried them on previous occasions and have been impressed. Think that is the specialty here.
Very friendly service with a smile and great food. Enjoy many meals here when I stay in Melbourne

What an amazing trio of waiters tonight. All 3 of you absolutely made my night! From the wine suggestions, to the food suggestions, to the attentive personalised service and laughs. Thank you! The food was amazing... had to try the apple cucumber oyster... wow, like a fresh, sweet explosion of flavours and textures in my mouth and the Lamb was cooked to perfection. Thoroughly recommend. I wasn't staying at the hotel, however,  based on the level of service from the three of you tonight  I will be next time. It's rare to find a team so committed to making a person's evening enjoyable and memorable. You should be commended üëèüëèü•∞ü•∞

My boyfriend and I had dinner there on a Monday night, we were expecting average restaurant and average service‚Ä¶very surprised at the amazing waitstaff and delicious food, I will never underestimate this place again!! Special shout out to waitstaff Peter, Gerrill and Luca you made it a wonderful experience for the both of us!!
Always come here when staying at the Radission!
Good Japanese restaurant. The Japanese-style deep-fired chicken is very good.
The atmosphere and decor were very reminiscent of Japan. The ramen was amazing. This place is a hidden gem
A little disapointed in service and price. Servings are small and a 10 percent surcharge on weekends. Food was ok but not filling for the price.

üëçüèªüáØüáµ  This place is a hidden gem in the city! With a lovely decor reminiscent of Japanese and a bunch of anime posters like Naruto, One Piece, etc. stuck around, it's a visual treat for anime and Japanese culture lovers!  üçúüç•  The Kimchi Beef Ramen ($20.80) that I ordered was quite delicious. Personally, I'd have preferred a slightly thicker soup, but it wasn't a big issue. A lovely bowl of ramen on a wooden table, with paper lanterns fluttering overhead, a faux cherry blossom plant near the entrace made the whole experience so amazing! The menu comes bound in a wooden cover, so that's something.  The place serves alcohol as well.  üí≤üàπ  Good price range, but I felt I paid more for the experience rather than the food itself, but it definitely felt worth it and therefore no complaints. The staff were friendly, the food came in quick and I'll definitely recommend this place for a wholesome Japanese dining experience!
Not the best quality but fine for what you pay for

Found this place open at 9pm on Easter Saturday so stopped by for a dinner and I was craving warm soup noodles because of the rain so I got the vegetable gyoza ramen and wow did it hit the spot although my complaints are that they don‚Äôt provide proper soup spoons so I was trying to ladle soup into those recyclable wooden spoons which was way too shallow and it was impossible anyways it also took half an hour for my order to come out even though the restaurant was pretty empty so idk what was up with that
Tasty and delicious. I love it and will visit here again when I go to Melbourne.
Simple, fast and tasty! Funky environment which the kids enjoyed.

Service here was so poor, the server maybe new, but it took multiple attempts to get our order correct. The food isn‚Äôt terrible but quick and easy feed it isn‚Äôt‚Ä¶. It was over an hour to get the correct food sent out of the kitchen! I wish you best of luck going forward but we won‚Äôt be back.
you know fast food mainly for take away for chinese students.

Cute fitout.  I recommend coming for the weekday lunch special - $20 for an entr√©e (takoyaki or harumaki), main (karaage or pork/chicken katsu curry with rice/udon) and soft drink. Also check Liven for further discounts (it's quite good value when one stacks both).  The alcoholic taste of the sauce on the grilled squid - I think miso and cooking sake - was a bit potent for me, but I enioyed everything else. It's good to see curry udon for a change.
Great food, beautifully cooked. Most enjoyable. So glad we found it in the side alley. We'd definitely eat there again if we'd stayed longer. We ate delicious Ramen and Tempura.
If I had the choice between starving or eating food from here again I would starve any day. Probably the worst food I have had in a while
Very delicate, service attitude is also very good
Authentic Japanese food in an alley way . Delicious üòã Friendly staffs & interesting decors! Love their curry üçú udon ! ‚Ä¶
really bad taste

Food were nice but the customer service was one of the worst that I‚Äôve encountered. The rude attitude of the cashier/server with short bob hair is the reason why I‚Äôm giving 1 star.  Upon entering, she was simply just standing behind the counter staring at my family with an unwelcoming expression. Nor did she bother to greet or serve us.

Amazing atmosphere, Beautiful food and Friendly service. While waiting for my food I got lost in the immersion of the decor. Portions were above average and I definitely got my money's worth. Well satiated. If I was a permanent resident of the area, Tokyo 7 would most definitely be my most visited restaurant.
Amazing place and service with good prices and delicious food.
I always ask the beef noodles. Everything is delicious and good price Congratulations
When I made a mistake and caused trouble, they were very courteous and helpful! Thank you :)
Great tasty food with an awesome atmosphere.  Lunch deal was excellent.

Restaurant does not operate the hours shown on Uber eats. Waited nearly an hour of it ‚Äúbeing prepared‚Äù called the restaurant 3 times to check they were open, no answer. Please change your trading hours on Uber eats!!!!!
Kind of cheap prices. Small portions for our bento. Salmon bento was okay but prawn one was not so good.
Wonderful vibe, delicious Ramen

Ordered lechon crispy skin that it tastes more like lechon kawali. It tastes ok and the team were nice. They gave us lots of sauce and packed the food well. I have not tried dining there and not tried their other food.

Lechon crispy pork on rice: it was not as amazing as I was expecting based off reviews. It was standard crispy pork, actually a bit dry compared to other places. Not bad, you‚Äôll enjoy it, but I took a special trip here just to try - I wouldn‚Äôt bother that much, just visit if you‚Äôre in the area & need a quick meal.
It was amazing!! Food was great and everything tasted authentic! The tapa beef was lean and the sisig tasted like one of those sold in carinderias. Overall, it was amazing

Went here on a Wednesday night.  Ordered the pork skewers, they came not on a stick. Wasn't told that before ordering. So was disappointed we ordered 18 of them ! Meat was tough.  Beef tapa - the meat was tough not tender.  The sisig was good, as well as the pork belly.  Sadly they had run out of chicken the day we were there.  Was a very long wait for the food.  I'm hoping to go back oneday and give a better rating

Does not accept eftpos only cash and did not inform beforehand or no signs outside. Waited in queue and ordered and then found out they only accepted cash. Had to walk to atm to withdraw and I was in a rush.
Their pork delivered. Filipino-style crackling perfection!
Quality is not worth the price. Worst filo food in AU so far.
I've been eating at GJ's for years and they never disappoint! The BEST Filipino food ever! Keep up the good work guys! üëå ‚Ä¶
It's average food and a little pricey, better off going to the Japanese next door in my opinion.

Limited menu. Authentic Filipino meats. Grilled pork. Grilled chicken. Flavoured rice. Don‚Äôt expect any/much green veggies. :)  Friendly staff. Can be very busy.  Basic decor.  Can be hard to find. It‚Äôs down a laneway and does not have obvious signage.  We have been many times as a family and also with friends and relatives.
This place got good customer service‚Ä¶but‚Ä¶ their food is not. Their tapa was horrible taste but the pork grill was admirable.

This was my first time trying Filipino food and I‚Äôve been missing out! Everything was amazing. Their menu has about 10 items on it.  The lechon was extremely crispy and super fatty, just the way I like it. The garlic rice that you can get on the side compliments the pork so well. The lechon sisig was perfectly balanced and tasted phenomenal.  The sinigang salmon belly reminded me of canh chua. It was sweet and sour - perfectly balanced!! The salmon belly was cooked to perfection and they were really generous with it.  I can‚Äôt wait to go back. I wanted to try their skewers but they sold out by the time we got there. Highly recommend trying this place out if you haven‚Äôt. It‚Äôs a bit tricky to find - you‚Äôll need to find an alleyway along Frankliin St and/or A'Beckett St.

Took quite a while to locate the shop. Its inside a building, through a lane. Ordered take away their star -Lechon with garlic rice and sisig. Then the surprise. They accept ONLY CASH. Have to go round the corner to atm cash. Hope the food don‚Äôt disappoint.

Went here during a trip to Melb and left very satisfied. The lechon was juicy and tender on the inside and on the outside the skin was so crispy and airy like chicharon. It came with their homemade lechon sauce which paired well with the meat. We also had the bbq chicken which was cooked perfectly and had great flavour. Already planning to come back whenever I'm in Melb again!
Easily the best pork sisig, and lechon I've ever had in my life... Just visiting Melbourne this is a meal that I'll never forget, and will make sure to come by as often as I can.
Absolutely delicious food! It's a tiny little place in a lane with not much seating. Friendly staff who told us about each dish before we ordered. Will be back.

Asked if the taste and smell of the pork is normal like the one they served me, it tasted sour and smelled weird, told me that I‚Äôm the only one who complained after all the people they have served and they are confident that nothing is wrong with it, but refused to smell or taste the pork they served me. Even my friends tried the pork and they said something was wrong with it. I was looking around and even the other table didn‚Äôt finish the food. Couldn‚Äôt handle a complaint

One of the best crispy pork i‚Äôve had. Crispy skin, moist on the inside, fatty, sinful but satisfying. The gravy it came with balanced the flavours of the pork. And to top it all,  fast and friendly service from the ladies who served me today.
yum!

the last time we tried to eat there, I was with my cousins who were visiting from Sydney, the old lady with short white hair terrorised us. she was so rude to us, she raised her voice and looked at us glaringly. Unbelievable experience, never going back there again. Anyone reading this I suggest just go to Cebu Charcoal Belly in Sunshine ‚Äúsobrang babait nila dun‚Äù 100% ang customer service!!!
Tasty sisig. Gave me a  taste of home. Lechon kawali is crunchy.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Diner on Franklin, a Korean restaurant that left a lasting impression on me. The first thing that struck me was the great value for money that the restaurant offered. Their Babsang, which includes a variety of dishes for just $25, was a feast for the senses. The portions were generous, and the range of flavors was simply delightful.  One of the standout dishes that I tried was the soft tofu and seafood soup. It was incredibly amazing - the broth was flavourful and the seafood was fresh, making for a delicious and hearty soup that left me feeling satisfied and content. The dish was also beautifully presented, with a colourful array of ingredients that made it a feast for the eyes as well as the palate.  The staff at Diner on Franklin were also a highlight of my visit. From the moment I stepped into the restaurant, they were welcoming and attentive. They were knowledgeable about the menu, and happy to offer suggestions and answer any questions that I had. Their service was truly excellent, and made for a memorable dining experience.  Last but not least, I have to mention the Korean fried chicken, which was simply amazing. The chicken was perfectly cooked - crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and very juicy. The flavours were bold and delicious, making for a truly satisfying and enjoyable meal.  Overall, my experience at Diner on Franklin was excellent. From the great value for money to the incredible food and top-notch service, I highly recommend this Korean restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious and memorable dining experience.
The food is somewhat a bit sweet for me. Well presented tho

Been here many times, even since their restaurant was called bebu near RMIT and only writing a review now. Yummy! I like their fried chicken and salad! Also their soft tofu soup which isn't spicy. Overall, I would say this Korean restaurant has a more modern-australian x korean taste / vibe to it!  The restaurant is small, I would recommend going during less busy hours

It was so delicious from the main to the side dish. Strawberries üçì From the tops cut off to the neatly placed rice cakes. I think I have to express that I put my sincerity into the food. I had a really good meal that warmed my heart. I will visit again next time!
If you have to eat cold noodles with kimchi rolls in Melbourne...... It's definitely here ......... It's so delicious.

Quite disappointed in the service of this place. Was very excited to try after seeing reviews, although after waiting 20 minutes we were told we had to wait outside with our pram which we did. Another 10 minutes go by, and a single diner had arrived behind us, the lady had given her a seat within 2 minutes without saying anything to us while we were still waiting. There was a table big enough to fit our group of 4 by adding another chair, and us putting our pram to the side, but she chose to seat a single person instead. Very disappointing service and will definitely not be returning.

I am quite sad that we missed out on eating here. I had my daughter in her pram along with 3 family members waiting patiently for 20 mins and when we finally got to the front of the line, the hostess only asked us to get out of the doorway to wait outside in the cold and did not acknowledge us regarding how many people to seat. We waited a further 10 mins watching the hostess not clear a table that could have seated us and it wasn‚Äôt until another patron who was alone and lined up behind us that she cleared the table and greeted said patron friendly and seated them. She could have said maybe she was waiting for a bigger table for us but she said nothing and didn‚Äôt even smile at us. We felt invisible. After this experience, I don‚Äôt have the heart to return even with all the positive reviews.

A small intimate place serving excellent Korean food. It is run by a couple who work efficiently and effectively so everything runs smoothly.  I can see the passion and care they put in every meal.  Food tastes amazing and service is great. We came for lunch and ordered the set meal, which comes with rice, side dishes, fruits and a mini cheesecake. Definitely going to come back to try other things on the menu.  Super recommended.
Super nice and worth for money!!! But I left my jacket in your shopüò≠ Can you keep it for me? I will go and grab from you. Thank you. Instagram: von_ng322 ‚Ä¶
Simple and very well priced Korean restaurant and takeaway. I am never disappointed when I come here.  The Babsang set is the definite pick of the menu.

Fantastic value.  We got the set meal with bulgogi beef and fried chicken.  The bulgogi was tender and marinated and pared well with the rice. The fried chicken was crispy, tender and juicy and in a nice sweet-chilli sauce.  The sides were plentiful and very nice. Notable sides included the cauliflower, the rice cake, the fried food and the cheesecake.  Both meals were $25, which is great value for the amount of food you get and the taste of food.

Amazing food!!! 12/10 food! Buza Chicken is an international Korean Fried Chicken restaurant serving dishes inspired by street food found at Hongdae Food Street and Night Market. They've got heaps of unique flavours and marinate their chicken for 12+ hours!  - Crunch King (mild) [$23] - This is a new item on their menu and apparently the no.1 fried chicken in Korea! It was crunchy and juicy, but the best part was the seasoning - COCONUT AND HONEY!!! So unique! We got the mild version, and it was slightly sweet and very delish! I think the spicy version would be bomb af too! This was our favourite dish of the night - Soy Smoked Chicken $201 - Smokey and caramelised - so yum! I've always preferred bone over boneless when getting Korean Fried Chicken. I just think it's so much juicier! - Spicy beef ribs [$37] - The slow cooked ribs were s000oo tender and flavorful! The meat just fell apart (see my stories). The serving is huge and enough to feed 4. A little spicy though - Rose Tteokbokki for 2 [$28] - Another huge serving of tteokbokki w/ glassnoodles and toppings in a very creamy and spicy sauce  I had heard lots of great things about this place and can confirm the food here absolutely slaps! The place is a vibe and the staff are so friendly, making the whole dining experience so much better. I'd definitely come back!  Follow me on insta @ evelineeats for more food content and reviews

The food here is amazing. A lot of variety to choose from. The staff is really sweet and polite and the service is fast. Impeccable taste with option to have different level of spiciness. I will surely be visiting this place again.
Lovely environment, yummy food
Authentic Korean meals.

I was here last night on what I think was a first date üòÖ and it was very busy (it was a Friday night so, I guess this is to be expected). My only complaint is that all the tables were so close together and it was very loud. Hard to have a conversion at an acceptable level. Other than that, the service was prompt. You could either order with a waiter or scan a code to order through that. We got a jug of Pale Ale that came out with the side dishes and a half and half boneless chicken of 'hot' sweet and spicy chicken and smokey soy chicken. The smokey soy was absolutely delicious!! I would recommend. The 'hot' sweet and spicy was good as well but wasn't as hot as I would like. The chicken itself was still crunchy while being lathered in sauce. Was a really nice texture. I'd probably come here again. I didn't take any photos as I was quite engaged with my 'date' but the serving size was quite large. We didn't even eat it all.
A place I went to because I wanted to eat Korean food. It tastes similar to Korea. The corn cheese was delicious, and it was nice to have chicken radish and cabbage salad.

I ordered take away Which wasn't crispy anymore when i got home. I ordered the spring onion flavour Which i am not sure what's the right way to eat it? Initially i Thought it will be battered with the spring onion flavoured sauch But that wasn't the case.  So Based on that i can't give a 4star. But i better try dine in in the future to be fair. Its nice to have some pickles and salads when dinning in to go with the fried chicken.

üëçüèªüêî  Pretty delicious Korean fried chicken is served here in a variety of flavours at great prices! The although the place looks bigger from outside, it's a bit small, with about 4-5 tables only.  üçóü•ò  The Soy Garlic Chicken (boneless, half plate 250 g, $19) with a bowl of rice ($3) made for a delicious dish. Although, on receiving my food, I felt that the rice wasn't necessary because the chicken was in really good quantity and had fries and bit of salad on the side.  The chicken was very well made. It was mixed well with the soy garlic sauce, but wasn't drenched in it, which was good. Soft, succulent and balanced in flavour the chicjen was quite good. The garlic wasn't overpowering at all, and the sauce made eating the rice easier.  The potato fries looked cute and tasted even better. Had I known about it, I wouldn't have ordered the plain rice with a few seeds of nigella sprinkled over the top.  üî§üßçüèª  Tha place could do with a little bit of cleaning an visual lift up. The cafe looled cool, but the water glass, jug looked worse for wear. The staff, although friendly, felt a bit aloof. Why there were no tissues on the tables is unknown to me.  üõçüòã  A good enough place to visit to address your fried chicken cravings on Queen Street. Also, using the EatClub app gave me a hefty 30% off on dining in!

food : - soy garlic chicken (üåü8/10) - tteokbokki (üåü8.5/10)  ambience : cozy with some great music on the background (9/10)  The tteokbokki is a little bit spicy even though I ordered the mild version. Chicken is tender, potatoes fries are always the best, however the sauce lacks umami flavour a bit. Food came out really late, we have to wait for 30mins. Maybe the lack of staff kind of making everything slow down. Overall, great food to enjoy with family or friends.

I recently visited ABC Chicken restaurant, and while the food was decent, I couldn't help but feel disappointed with the customer service. The staff seemed disinterested and unapproachable, and it took a long time for my order to arrive.  To improve their customer service, I suggest that the staff be more welcoming and friendly towards customers. They could greet customers with a smile, offer assistance with the menu, and check in on customers throughout their meal. It would also be helpful if the restaurant had a system for tracking orders, to ensure that customers receive their food in a timely manner.  Regarding the food, I think ABC Chicken could benefit from using higher-quality ingredients and ensuring that the dishes are prepared consistently. The flavors were good, but the presentation could be improved by paying more attention to plating and garnishing. Additionally, the restaurant could offer more vegetarian and vegan options to cater to a wider range of dietary needs.  Overall, with a few improvements in customer service and food quality, I believe ABC Chicken restaurant could become a go-to spot for delicious food and excellent service.

For my first experience, I just say the food was ok. I will Coke back ans try other dishes soon. The chicken could have been seasoned a little more and the sauce could have been a bit thicker. Kimchi Pancake was delicious (forgot to take a photo). Portion size could have been a bit bigger too. More chicken, less potato üòú Staff was nice.

If you‚Äôre paying with liven (especially with the foodollars), make sure to ask and check first whether their system is working or not. As when I was about to pay my order with liven foodollars, the lady at the cashier kept saying that their liven system is off. It was quite late at night so I couldn‚Äôt reach liven support and I‚Äôm in a rush to catch my tram so I paid in full. Got answered by liven and they tried to help me by contacting the merchant, which is ABC. Waited for a week for them to get back to me, but in between those days, liven support consistently giving me updates and in the end, they couldn‚Äôt do much about it as the payment is made through different channel other than liven - I used debit card at that time. So I tried contacting ABC as it would be easier between liven and ABC to sort this out on their side, because I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs right to have customer bear the mishap because there‚Äôs an error happening between the merchant partners. Very hard to find way to contact them, could only message them through the google map chat (as I‚Äôm sending the receipt and the conversations I had with liven support), was not responded until I had to chat them again.. was told gonna be replied once they‚Äôre not busy, but receive no follow up until asked again.. said gonna be giving me news after they got answer from liven. And it‚Äôs been more than 2 weeks now since I contacted ABC, with no follow up - pretty disappointing - as actually the restaurant received the money and they could‚Äôve worked it out with liven to validate my liven foodollars that I should‚Äôve been able to use, or give some refund/voucher or those sorts - but no solution of compensation given to assist the customer for their systems error. For the food itself, we had to wait an hour for the sweet chilli chicken to arrive, and 10 mins after that for the carbonara - starving. Taste wise, it‚Äôs good although the chicken pieces in the carbonara that time was served into very small pieces so you get more of the coatings than the real chicken piece and felt a bit dry. The servers that served us was generally nice, but could be hard to call because they rarely stay on upstairs.. and forgetting simple things at times, like the glasses for the water/alcohol. Went here a couple times before, but this last experience was not so pleasant that makes me reconsider to visit this place again or not.

Yesterday my wife and I went to eat chicken for the first time in a while, but again we were disappointed. I've been here since the first time it opened, so it's a pity to see the store go bankrupt like this.  The store is very dirty and messy. There were foreign substances on the tables and chairs, so I didn't feel good from the first time I sat down. I didn't want to touch the menu board because it was dirty. As soon as I sat down, he quickly explained that there was nothing on the menu, but it was so fast that I couldn't understand it, so I called to ask again, but the staff didn't even come because they were picking up and eating among themselves. In the end, I had to stand up several times and ask. As soon as I sat down, I put the water bottle on the table, but they brought the water cup and basic snacks a while later. Is it because there are a lot of people like me who don't order? If you run it like this, there will be no more people coming and going.  Overall, no one is in control. It's not like the store has been around for a year or two, but it's amazing that there aren't that many items at once. Are you unprepared because you don't want to sell? Even if you understand the other items, it's a chicken shop, but shouldn't you prepare enough chicken?  Seeing comments on recent reviews, you're only making excuses. Are you tired? Then close the store and rest at home. Don't do business like this.  There are a lot of Korean stores these days, so if you go there, there are many stores with good service. Don't waste your time here, I recommend going to Ktown or somewhere else.

so many bad reviews. please don‚Äôt waste your time or money, I was really disappointed, sat down but left after 5 mins.  Edit: as a business that‚Äôs been around for years, I‚Äôd presume you would understand that running your shop would have more to do with just the food.  If you‚Äôd like me to elaborate on why you received a one star - your service standard for your staff should be improved.  you sat us down, the seats were very dirty. I couldn‚Äôt even sit down on one of them. a staff put water on the table, no cups or plates, what‚Äôs the point to even put the water there if I can‚Äôt pour anything.  my husband tried asking you guys many times, but the only two staff on the floor were chatting and ignoring him, making him get up many times.  another things is, we couldn‚Äôt order 80% of the menu and lost our appetite.  it‚Äôs disappointing since we both work in hospitality for a long time and wanted to enjoy some food after work.  I know your business has been struggling, which is why I don‚Äôt like to leave a bad review, but i have to be honest, things really need to be improved.  i have only left good reviews on my account because there is a standard in Melbourne that every business should be following. if you have this many bad reviews, maybe it‚Äôs time to start changing some things.

Vegetarians rejoice! I came to Patsy's with pretty decent to high expectations and was blown away by the wine selection, the service, friendliness, and knowledge of the staff, and last but not least, the amazing food that was on offer.  There wasn't a single thing we ordered that we didn't love (I think the shallot tarte tatin was favorite of the night).  The only thing I could maybe critique was the wording of the menu since I felt like I had to google every third word (which probably speaks more to my own ignorance than anything else)  In any case, would highly recommend and return!

Service at Patsy's was some of the best I've ever had at a restaurant. The ambience was great, and so was the wine selection.  Food wise, I was a bit disappointed. Overall, it felt like the meals were oily and too salty, which is a shame considering the amazing textures that each meal provided.  I wouldn't personally go back, but if you are after a vego/vegan friendly restaurant with great vibes, check out Patsy's

A rather unique vegetarian restaurant with an extensive range of drink options. The vibe and service by staff were fantastic.
