I've ordered a 3 course meal banquet and overall I am satisfied. However, I think the dishes were more on the bland side and there was no 'it' factor considering the price tags There is definitely a room for improvement, and hence a 4 star rating for food.

Such a good spot. Came here for cocktails and wine before dinner elsewhere, and ended up working our way through the menu of food. Super interesting and good vibes, need to make it the final destination next time.

Came in for a quick snack and drink, and was really impressed. Gorgeous fit-out and nice ambience, delicious food for what we did try, and great wines with well-informed staff to guide you through the list.  Confusing lay-out for the wine list, though. Stuff listed by the glass were not actually available with random circles and lines to indicate what might be available. Made for an annoying back and forth to order a glass of wine. Otherwise a really great experience - will be back!

10/10 experience. Amazing food that reminded me of my Italian Nonno's cooking. Honestly one of the tastiest restaurants Ive been to in awhile. Wow! Just wow! Too enthralled in the food and enjoyment of it all to take photos! Certainly one for the memory bank. An amazing restaurant providing delicious food (that happens to be vegetarian). Peking duck, but make it BOUJEE! Chinese cuisine in the CBD and they also do yumcha for lunch!  We tried: ü¶Ü 1/2 Peking Duck w/ Sauce & Pancakes üç≤ Duck Rack Soup üçö Fried Rice w/ Black Truffle üêΩ Sweet & Sour Pork üçó Sizzling Chicken Wing Pot ü•£ Boiled Sea Cucumber w/ Millet Porridge ü¶Ä Crabmeat Seafood Ball w/ Cucumber Sauce  The interior of this place was really nice and boujee with intimate booth areas to dine in and a nice space to watch the chef cut and prepare the peking duck. We ordered the half peking duck set, which came with 8 pancakes, dipping sauce and veg, and a huge bowl of duck rack soup that could feed a family. The duck was juicy with crispy skin and they were quite generous with the serving, but would have liked some more pancakes to wrap. The soup was a little too mild in flavour for our liking. Loved the truffle fried rice, very fragrant! The sweet and sour pork was super crunchy, with a yummy glaze, however it was served on a bed of ice, which kept the crispiness, but it meant a few of the pieces were ice cold üòÇ The chicken was juicy and tender and flavoured well. We tried their new menu item - boiled sea cucumber with millet porridge. It was a nice warm, comforting dish with mild flavours, but pleasant. Their crabmeat ball was very squishy, with crunchy water chestnut bits throughout, in a cucumber soup. The soup had a very distinct fresh cucumber taste, an interesting mix of flavours.
Favorite of three year olds

Here's what we ordered: ü•ü Steamed crystal prawn dumplings üç• Rice noodle rolls with deepfried dough ü•ü Scallop dumplings üç§ Shrimp bean curd roll ü•ü Shumai üç≥ Steamed salted egg bun ü¶Ü Peking duck (half) - comes with dipping sauce, duck, steamed pancakes and a choice of duck rack soup or salt & pepper duck rack ü•≠ Mango pudding üç≥ Past√©is de Nata  Yum cha + Peking Duck for lunch, say less ü§§ Tried this place the other day where we enjoyed a selection of classic yumcha dishes as well as the peking duck, which was crispy and tender.  We got to see the peking ducks being roasted in a wood fire oven at the front as well as the chef slicing it. I liked how each table is separated in booths which felt cosy and private but it's also slightly hard to catch staff attention. Orders are made via a QR code. We went on a Saturday and it was fully booked.  Overall good experience and a lovely time spent - would go again.

Wowee this hidden gem is top quality! We came on a Monday night and from the outside you can‚Äôt see in but once we walked in, it was jam packed! Each table has their own little alclove so it‚Äôs great for privacy.  What we ordered: üçóHalf duck (which comes with pancakes, sauces, veg and a side of deep fried duck rack) ü•ü Chinese cabbage dumplings ü•í Cabbage stir fry with dry shrimp and vermicelli üçñSweet and sour pork scoop üçó Sizzling chicken wing pot ü•ü Steamed duck bun  The sweet and sour pork scoop came on ice - we‚Äôd never seen this before yet it was such a cool concept. The pork still remained warm  but was paired with fresh fruits.  The sizzling chicken wing pot is a must order. The chicken was just melting off the bone. The dumplings were both colourful (which was fun) and very tasty.  And the duck (their specialty) was delicious! It was cooked exactly how it should be - crispy outside and tender on the inside. It was very enjoyable.  Highly recommend for those who enjoy duck / trying some new concepts!

***It is so interesting to see after my 1 star review there were heaps of 5 star reviews popped up. Went with a group of friends on a Thursday night. The $50pp for 2hrs of room hire & food was well worth it. The food was delicious and we had heaps of fun. Will be back.

I went with a group of friends,  we were able to book a private karaoke room for our dinner and entertainment.  The room even have a private toilet so no risk of getting lost after a few drinks!  The facilities are new, clean and comfy. Everything we ordered including the dishes, desserts, cocktails and mocktails were delicious and creative, Cantonese dishes with a twist!  Perfect place to have a great night with your friends and family.

@yumsinghouse üìçCBD  üå≠ Caramalised Fig, Grilled Lap Cheong, Smoked Creme Fraiche üçÖ Pickled Mussels, Tomatoes, Chinese Doughnut üç£ Ginger Beetroot Cured Salmon üêñ Chargrilled Pork Cutlet, HK Pepper Sauce ü¶Ü Roasted Duck Breast, Rainbow Chard  Yum Sing House is a Contemporary Asian restaurant and karaoke bar located in Melbourne‚Äôs CBD. The Modern Cantonese menu by Head Chef Aiven Chee (ex @longrainmelbourne, @mamasitamelbourne) is expressed in a unique way, with familiar classics reimagined to share and enjoy. The space itself is very trendy, featuring neon light features, projections and retro pop art. üá≠üá∞  We enjoyed a taste of their new Autumn menu, paired with some incredible @sthugowines. Our favourite dishes were definitely the mains - The Roasted Duck Breast was a flavour bomb and the Pork Cutlet was beautifully tender and melted in your mouth. ü§§  Although we liked everything, each dish did have things we would suggest for improvement. The Salmon could‚Äôve been cut smaller and served more chilled as it did end up tasting like a very different dish. The Chinese Doughnuts weren‚Äôt soft enough to really soak up the delicious juices from the dish. The Duck skin was just short of crispy. Nothing was a huge dealbreaker, we will definitely be back to try more as we understand large events can of course effect the quality presented.  Head upstairs to find their 5 Hong Kong inspired private karaoke rooms and bar - ranging from small and intimate (7pax) up to their largest (25 pax). They feature state of the art studio equipment, comfy sofas and the option to have bottle service! üçæ  Check their website or socials for many available specials. * Book your birthday with YSH this April & receive a complimentary round of house drinks. * Happy Hour runs from 6pm-9pm * 50% off minimum spend on Karaoke specials Wed-Thurs * Dine and Sing for $55pp Wed-Thurs  ‚≠êÔ∏è 3.5/5 üí∏ $$

‚ÄúFirst we yum, then we sing!‚Äù ‚Äî Who jumped to conclusions when they saw this cheesy slogan? I confess that I did üòÖ Biases were quickly set aside however, when the first bite of the ginger-beetroot cured salmon revealed some serious culinary skills from the kitchen.  Yum Sing House is modern Asian. There is the usual refined plating, smaller √† la fine dining portions, occasional deconstruction of the well-known into its elements, and rebirth in a different form (take bubble tea as cake for example). But Yum Sing‚Äôs take on fusion from ex-Longrain and -Mamasita Chef Aiven Lee and team is more thoughtful than that.  Consider the Teochew-style mussels. The use of preserved vegetables to add tang to seafood is the oldest trick in Teochew cooking, but here the concept is turned on its head. Pickled mussels are dished with a variety of fresh tomatoes. Youtiao, usually eaten whole or cut into medallions, are sliced laterally here to be used like crostini.  Then there is the classic Italian figs and prosciutto, made Asian by switching prosciutto up for lap cheong, balsamic vinegar for Chinese black sweet vinegar, and walnuts and pine nuts for deep fried chickpeas and furikake.  What I really appreciate is the team‚Äôs take on reframing the norms, of making swaps in ingredients so brilliant yet simple, that you cannot help but marvel at the harmony of the marriage between East and West.  If it wasn‚Äôt already clear from its branding as a restaurant and karaoke bar, Yum Sing prides itself on food as much as cocktails. This was keenly felt from our first hand experience, and reminded us that thoughtfully crafted dishes can be had anywhere‚Ä¶ as true foodies we should always keep an open mind.  Head to our Story Highlights on Instagram (IG handle: chufoodieadventures) if you want detailed descriptions of each dish.  üìçCBD, Melbourne üòã Will return üí∏ $$
Thank you Yum Sing House. Especially the lovely waitress who looked after us. I had a fantastic birthday. Dinner and karaoke were both awesome.

Great space for dinner with friends. We were a group of 9 so we had the feed me set menu.  It was a nice combination of seafood as our entrees and beef ribs with vegetables as our main. the portion size was generous.  Love the food and flavours! will definitely go again.
Friendly staff and nice atmosphere, came for dinner/karaoke. Only problem I had was searching for song titles on the karaoke machine at times. Had to search by artists initials instead.

Had the karaoke and dinner combo. The atmosphere inside was great. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. special shoutout to Nancy, Huy and Bae - they provided excellent service. The karaoke had lots of songs in different languages.  There was a variety of food which was super delicious. I especially enjoyed the tofu dish which was vegan friendly, and the pork ribs.  Overall, I highly recommend the karaoke and dinner combo.

Went there with a group of 11. They were very accommodating with our dietary requirements. (Vegan, nut allergies and seafood allergies).  All the food there was great and the staff were super friendly.  We also stayed for 2 hrs of karaoke. Overall had a great night and would go there again.
Excellent service and food, the pork ribs was the best out of all the food.

Amazing food, amazing drinks, from vegan wonton to XO Lapchong fried rice, and from Oolong old fashioned to their glasses of wines absolutely amazing. Great vibe, great attentive and happy staff members, will definitely come back and recommend.

Went here on a few different occasions but both occasions were birthdays and the staff were very welcoming and friendly. The food is also amazing. It‚Äôs hidden away however it‚Äôs one not to be missed. 10/10 would always recommend to my friends and family.

The flavours are well balanced and their variety of dishes is perfectly cohesive. The truffle siu mai, sichuan pork ears and salted duck egg choux dessert are the highlights with their weekday specials a real bargain! Perfect for our after work girls night catch up last night. Thank you YSH

Food was great, service was great, however they had limited amount of songs available in their system and the other apps like youtube and sound-cloud weren‚Äôt possible to use there due to some technical issues they had.  And as I said library of songs was really limited.

Wow just Wow!!!! The food and staff here are spectacular. The Chef Nan is simply amazing and our waitress Emily was outstanding. Would 100% recommend this wonderful restaurant with a charming atmosphere.

Overall quite a bit more expensive than you would like to spend at a hotpot joint... It is not priced by your own portion choice and is rather packaged at set rates and sizes of sides ordered. This makes it far more expensive than normal. Overall good experience, would recommend going with groups of more than 2 however as most of the soup was wasted.

The reviews have to be fake no way this place is rated 4.8 stars from 5k reviews. The price for the amount of food you get is insane. $165 for two people. The soup base cost $30 just so you could cook the food!! So essentially you gotta pay a $30 entry fee and pay for meat ontop of that. The complimentary self serve sauce bar is not complimentary!! They charged me at the end of service and there are no labels and no warnings it cost money. The soup was horrible, we got level 1 mild spice level out of 4 and it was like i was eating Molten magma. Other then the heat the soup had zero taste and my god was it oily infact thats all it was, Spicy oil. The meat quality was terrible and tasted like it had gone bad. We were waiting 30 min just to get our drinks. Dont let the presentation fool you which was actually amazing as you can see from peoples photos. The place looks great but everything else was terrible. Avoid at all costs.

I do think this food would be good but they sold out of everything they close at 4:00 and my family and I had to walk half an hour up hill to get to this place and we can‚Äôt come again until the next time go on holiday and we‚Äôve been waiting to try this for ages but we couldn‚Äôt fly because each time we got sick. This one is for the favourite grab and go style food in the CBD. @rainbowtoastie_melbourne is Korean style of grab-and-go toasties! Daniyeru's Detailed Review:  Customer Service 3/5 *Standard, nothing good to say but nothing bad to say either.  Food 2/5 *Super cute for the Social Media posts, but you will soon know how bland and flavourless the Bing Su desert is. Go here for the photos, once, take photos. Eating it is optional.. Unless you like eating ice flavoured, shaved ice with colouring that looks cute.. * * *  Value 4.5/5 *If you get the couple/double set you get 2 toppings and 2 Bing su to choose from. Great value. But if you compare value versus food, it is not worth it. You wiuld rather spend money on something you can taste.  Atmosphere 5/5 *Really cute and well decked out. It is unfortunate the bing Su desert they heavily advertise is flavourless failure.. Please reform the menu and recipe and perhaps you'll have a winning combination.  Overall *I'd only recommend coming here if you really want to take some cute photos, otherwise come in negstive expectations so thst you won't be disappointed when you take the first bite..

Their meals are packed in takeaway boxes that are perfect for on the go meals or to be saved for later. The meals contains a box for rice and vegetables and another box is for the crispy meat. Everything is seasoned well and filling enough for one person. The food at Bento King is not something you can be easily sick of.  Their Orange Tea is so refreshing and is amazing for a hot, sunny day. Like their Bento King food, it is healthy and made fresh, you can the citrus in your drink which just adds to the flavour.  I think that having both a food and a drink place in one is really so convenient.

I ordered popcorn chicken bento ($15.99), with chicken 'sauce' on rice. In addition to that I asked them to make it spicy, which didn't work out great. As for the food, I believe one of the employees accidentally served the dish in 2 boxes instead of one, and that's what I got served. I didn't mind it anyway. The rice was fine, while the veggies were steamed. That's it. 2 whole quail eggs with the rice were tasty. A bit more flavour would've worked wonders. As for the chicken, it was quite dry. The taste was okay, but don't expect too much. As for the spiciness that I mentioned in the beginning, just a pinch of chilli powder was sprinkled ü§¶üèªover the chicken pieces. A few pieces were a bit more chewy. Nonetheless, if you're in the mood for some quick Taiwanese food, this place is worth a visit, but keep your expectations to minimum.

Also, the veggies were simply defrosted Costco vegetables, not nice ones as shown on the menu. The worst part was the bad food poisoning the next day. Sadly, the whole day was spent on the toilet thanks to this food.

Delicious Taiwanese bento box, very authentic, the drinks are amazing, too!! The signature drink is passionfruit QQ jasmine tea, brings me back good old memories ü•§üçπ Definitely recommended!! The store even offer 10% discount for first respondersüôåüèª

Food is great, staff are friendly. Yes it's a bit smokey but that's street bbq style for you. The only downside is how slow tables are being cleaned especially the ones at the back. A table in front of me was still with dirty dishes when I came in and it was still there when I left. I've been to this place twice and it was the same experience. It's not nice to be eating surrounded by dirty dishes nor is it a good look. Cleanliness should be a top priority for any restaurant not just food and service. This place has great potential just needs some tweaking. Otherwise food and service was great.

I was probably one of this business top supporters. Talk about pork skewers everytime and it wont be just 2 pcs. I would order 12 so i can take it home to bundoora. It was recommended by a friend and since then i cant stop eating them. I used to save the sauce and eat with with rice alone. Thats how good it was! So when they opened this restaurant, i was excited because finally they have a place. Super happy for them but it wasn‚Äôt how it used to be. Maybe because their OG Workers is not the one marinating the meat now or mixing the sauce. I noticed more new workers in the kitchen.  I went again yesterday and today, hoping they bring back their old mix. But i noticed Some days, the meat was tiny bit saltier or citrusy than other days. Although it was still good, but not as good.  About customer service, their waiters do not seem they enjoy their job. I brought my kids with me and they loved to interact with filipinos because everyone we met was nice but unfortunately not their staff. Ok maybe they had a bad day, so i went the next day but nothing changed. Maybe a ‚Äúenjoy your food‚Äù reply would be nice after my kids and i say thanks‚Ä¶ lol but no biggie. My non Filipino kids were trying to speak tagalog to the waiters, they didnt reply nor smiled with their eyes(since they wear facemask) after that interaction, kids never talked when they served. I can understand 1 day of bad service, but it happened every time i visit. Cashier was great tho, at least he and she looks happy to be working.  Overall, great place to eat, but dont go there expecting waiters to say anything after they serve your food. Other than that, love the food and the cashier staff, environment, smell. The best filipino restaurant in Melbourne.
Nothing wrong with the food. Spaghetti was just like back in Phils. BBQ pork is OK. The only negative is the place fills up with smoke from the bbq and quite irritating on the eyes.

Food was average. My dessert order was forgotten and I had to tell them that I still have an order to be served. Service was at par with other Asian restaurants and the restaurant was okay. Not going back.

Great BBQ! But their pork bbq did not taste the same since they moved here from their little stall at food lane Melbourne Central. I wish they kept the recipe, or if they see this review, they will change it back. When they opened this restaurant, they increased their serving which is great compared to when they were in the food lane. I always asked for extra basting because their sauce was the best! I remember I would travel 40min to go to Food Lane Barkada.  Overall, I love this restaurant, but because they changed their recipe for pork BBQ, I don't often crave it anymore, unlike back in the food lane.
Amazing Filipino "street food" with reasonable prices. However, our dining experience could have been better if the place was well set up.

Pretty good mostly bbq meat filo eatery, it has a casual cafeteria vibe and it would be perfect if it was served on the sands of Boracay lol I'm impartial to barbecue pork, i would have loved it to be a bit more saucy and serve banana ketchup also but otherwise hit the spot, my husband had the chicken and isaw, I would have liked to try the spaghetti but I don't think I would have finished it. Cosy little Filipino restaurant with super friendly staff and delicious food.  The menu isn't massive but I have always enjoyed what I've ordered here  I love whatever is in the glaze that's on the skewers and half the menu  And the cute little food stall out the front with all the Filipino snacks and cooking essentials that you can buy

This was on my "To Eat" list and surpassed all expectations. The place is tucked away upstairs and  from the little laneway below, it would be easily missed. As we ascended, our nostrils were treated to the aroma of heavenly BBQ.  We started with Kwek Kwek, quail eggs covered in fried batter, offset with a sweet and sour sauce. We shared the BBQed combo meals Inasal (chicken Maryland) and Pork Belly. Both were juicy, tender, richly marinated and lip-licking good. We topped off the meal with an Ube Taro - a hot, purple yam Tofu and sago dessert, reminiscent of the Chinese Tau Fu Fah.  I think we were the only non-Filipino diners, so we knew the food here is authentic. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout the visit. The atmosphere was super casual, almost like being transported to a part of Asia. It's definitely a great place to try out scrumptious Filipino BBQ and tell friends about.
Laaaami!

Barkadahan offers a great selection of Filipino street food that's sure to satisfy anyone's craving for  Pinoy food. The dishes are well-prepared and bring back flavors from home. The overall experience was wonderful, and I highly recommend giving them a try.

Super love this place!! Sure treat whenever you're craving that taste of home.  They have everything!!! Breakfast, lunch, dinner, meryenda, pasalubong! Delicious! I love the atmosphere and the entrance! Very nostalgic, and feels just like the Philippines!  Love the arrazcaldo too! The ube Taho was delicious! The beef pares and the garlic rice was flavourful and reminded me of my childhood  I want to try the spaghetti next time XD

üëçüèªüòç  Delicious food at the LG of Melbourne Central station! A good variety of items to choose from.  üçúü•ô  For lunch I had their Poached Chicken Pho bowl ($13.90) and Veg Spring Rolls with Pepsi Max ($6). The pho was sinply excellent. The rice noodles were short and perfect. As for the soup, it was chock full of flavours with tender meat and pickled onions elevating the entire experience.  The spring rolls looked gorgeous, were crisp and tasty. Those went quite well with the drink!  üíØüòã  A must visit place for pho lovers!

The shop is located super conveniently in front of Melbourne Central train station so it‚Äôs perfect if you‚Äôre looking for food on the go.  The BBQ Chicken roll is made with tender and flavorful chicken, fresh herbs, and a sweet barbecue sauce, while the low carb barramundi roll is made with succulent barramundi fish wrapped in rice paper with fresh greens and a zesty dressing (no rice vermicelli inside though because it‚Äôs low card).  The rolls are generously stuffed and packed, ensuring that you get a satisfying and filling meal.  In terms of service, Roll'd Melbourne Central is known for its efficient staff who are always happy to help you with any questions or concerns. The place is usually quite busy, so it's a good idea to be prepared for a bit of a wait during peak hours.  Overall, Roll'd Melbourne Central is a great place to grab a quick and delicious Vietnamese meal. If you're in the area and looking for a tasty and healthy lunch or dinner.

I recently visited the Melbourne Central Lion pub, and unfortunately, my experience was not great. While the location is convenient and the atmosphere is pleasant, there were a few issues that left me feeling disappointed.  Firstly, the prices at this pub are just too high. I understand that it's located in a prime spot, but the cost of drinks and food is simply not worth it. It's disappointing to feel like you're being ripped off every time you order a drink, and unfortunately, that's how I felt at the Melbourne Central Lion.  Additionally, even when the pub was relatively empty, the service was slow. It took ages for me to get a drink, which was frustrating and made me feel like my patronage wasn't valued. When you're paying premium prices for your beverages, you expect to receive efficient and attentive service, but unfortunately, that was not the case.  Overall, while the Melbourne Central Lion pub has a nice atmosphere and convenient location, the high prices and slow service leave much to be desired. I would only recommend this place if you're willing to overlook these issues and prioritize atmosphere over cost and efficiency.
